Reviews.Title: “Our holiday stay at the Handlery”
Reviews.Author: Carmel W
Reviews.Content: Lovely pool and spa area, best we came across. The staff and waiters were very polite and helpful, especially the concierge, who took us everywhere. The only downside is the hotel was located a little far from the main city area. Never mind, we still enjoyed our experience. The room was a little small, but we put up with it, and spent limited time in the room anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Ramon served us well”
Reviews.Author: Joe E
Reviews.Content: Great service. One thing in particular stuck out to me: We had just completed our seminar, parking validation was closed, Ramon walked me back to his office and used his own validation stickers to save me a few dollars. Great food too.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: tmepl
Reviews.Content: Positive points: helpful, pleasant staff Reasonably priced. $168.38 include tax and $12 parking per night Clean room Negative points: $10 per day charge for Internet in room ( free in lobby) Paper-thin walls. Could hear tv and conversation-level voices from next room As well as hall noise Shower handle fell off and sink very slow draining A room with a balcony is $20 extra. The room we were offered has balcony facing large hotel parking lot and freeway. Traded for a patio room which was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok...”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveler212
Reviews.Content: It wasn't amazing, and it wasn't bad. "Just ok" is how I would characterize my feelings about the property. Check-in was easy and the staff was very helpful and friendly. I had a double room on the first floor of the Point Loma Building. The bed was comfortable but I could have done without the green bedspread. It looked very old and I wasn't 100% confident that it was cleaned on a daily basis or at minimum, in between guests. The ambiance is pretty plain and the bathroom very small. They currently have a "water-saving" feature on the shower so the water pressure wasn't that great. I was able to enjoy breakfast and dinner and it was very good. At the front desk, there is a card that encourages individuals to place a review on tripadvisor which is why there are several new reviews. I would stay here again, but only if I absolutely had to.

Reviews.Title: “handlery hotel san diego”
Reviews.Author: smaasch
Reviews.Content: nice staff. nice-looking pool (did not go in; was cloudy and cool). attended conference; food was OK. conference facility above average. walls thin; dog next door barked some and it was quite audible. easy access to highway 8 and other freeways. easy to find with garmin.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but standard room very small”
Reviews.Author: Diane E
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of the hotel, the pool area, and the excellent and very courteous service from the waitstaff and front desk. It was clean and suited our purposes. However, the double bed standard room was VERY small. There was no bureau in which to put our clothes, so we hung what we could and used the nightstand drawers and tv console for the rest. It was tough with 2 adults and 2 kids - but we managed. I would go back to the hotel, but would probably request a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Handlery Hotel & Resort”
Reviews.Author: siziji55
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, but out of the way of the town. Bus service close by gets you to the Trolley & bus station centre in the Old Town or into the city centre if you want and free mini bus takes you to the Old Town, San Diego Zoo and Sea World. Also close by to the Fashion valley outlet which is a 10 minute walk up the road. Spacious rooms with a good sized bathroom. Try and get a downstairs room as you will also get a small patio area for sitting out on. You can also get to the Mexican Border by trolley for only 5 dollars but I wouldn't recommend that as it took us 3 and a quarter hours to get back to the USA.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for friends away on a vacation!”
Reviews.Author: crystal62263
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went on a vacation from Canada to San Diego, and booked the Handlery for 8 days... the room was clean, the beds were very comfortable, we weren't woken up at all during the entire stay by any loud partiers! The staff went out of thier way to be helpful, in particular Jeff and Rich, the shuttle drivers, were indispensible, friendly, and went out of thier way for us! If and when I ever travel back to San Diego I will be sure to stay again at the Handlery!

Reviews.Title: “Met all requirements”
Reviews.Author: betsieboo
Reviews.Content: Nice size rooms and very helpful staff at the front desk and at breakfast. Good standards of housekeeping. The location is fairly convenient but not picturesque. A bit of a haul up the steps with heavy cases and no elevators. No complaints but nothing outstanding either,

Reviews.Title: “Not for family travellers”
Reviews.Author: NGK01
Reviews.Content: booked a twin double bed room had to upgrade because beds wernt double compere to other hotels i stayed more like king singles and rooms outdated the front desk male staff members were unhelpful Jeff the driver and conienge was the only one to go out of his way to help and give advice

Reviews.Title: “For Business travellers maybe?”
Reviews.Author: windiewillows
Reviews.Content: We would really love to rate this Hotel higher as all the staff were fantastic, but for Tourists we really felt it was a more a business Hotel. First the good points. The Staff were extremely helpful, friendly and efficient. There is also a courtesy bus which we used to go to Sea World. They can also get you discounted tickets to various attractions.That's about it. The Hotel is miles away from anywhere. A ten minute walk will take you to the Trolley stop but other than that you will need a car. Our air conditioner cluncked so bad through the night that we had to turn it off. We had stayed in seven Hotels/Resorts on our month long trip and this was the only one that charged for Wi Fi, Internet, printing and even the bottle of water left daily in the room. The rooms are basic and there are no in Room safes. We would've rated it a two, only that the staff were so good. If you have a few days to Tour, stay Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Just the best service ever!”
Reviews.Author: DrinkDevil
Reviews.Content: So we checked in, upgraded to premier room, by the pool pretty nice! The employees were awesome, Laura & Sandra in the restaurant... Stephanie, Travis, Jeff and rich were great, very helpful - it just seemed like they went out of their way to be helpful! Rooms were nice and clean, restroom is small but, heck we didn't try to spend much time in there.

Reviews.Title: “Distance”
Reviews.Author: trippin_traveller_85
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on suggestion of the travel agent. To find out it was a damn long way from Legoland the only place we wanted to go in San Diego. The hotel is good with a free shuttle to closer by attractions such as sea world and old town. Although if you wish to walk to places there are boutique shops about 1 km away, although other general shops are quite a hike. Rooms are small and like an average hotel, long hallways of plenty of rooms. Unsure if I would stay here again as there really is nothing close by.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: joanne m
Reviews.Content: i just completed a five night stay. i am not going to name names because i don't want to omit anyone, but the staff was uniformly outstanding. they are the primary reason my husband and i will be returning in may when we come from minnesota for our daughter's graduation. even though the standard rooms are a bit dated they are a good value. the shuttle and the on site restaurant are also a plus. it is clear that excellent customer service is a high priority here. highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, front desk very helpful and pool is really nice.”
Reviews.Author: Jammn3390
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay, we were in town for a baseball tournament, front desk was very helpful with directions and helpful with things to do for our other kids who were not in the tournament. Only reason we gave the rooms a 3 is the bathrooms are very small. So the room that had our three teenage girls in the bathroom was not big enough for them to all get ready in, had to be one at a time. Our rooms were pool side, and it was very nice, not sure if we'd be as happy in the other buildings.

Reviews.Title: “loved Jeff and the shuttle!”
Reviews.Author: Denise E
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights prior to going to Mexico. The rooms were clean and the staff accomodating. Jeff was tremendous and their free shuttle service and tips on restuarants and things to see in the city were great. The rates are good and the restuarant food was also very good. If I could make a suggestion; it would be great if the hotel could set up a to go breakfast for the early morning travelers to San Ignacio Lagoon. If we could make arrangements for this the night before it would make the early morning less stressful to employees and the travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jessieBedfordshire
Reviews.Content: Hotel must of been once a motel and they extended and made it a hotel.Evenings you had nowhere to go if u didn't have car as hotel is beside a freeway.All considered they gave me and my husband a quiet room.Staff make this hotel great.Fermin the Mexican waiter was so obliging always on hand.We had to vote who was going to be staff of month and we wanted him so we voted him.But no box was on show and we gave to receptionist.Think a box should be put out.Daniel was great!! Any single English girls get over there!! He is looking for love!!! All staff great!! Well done

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value, tad bit dated”
Reviews.Author: MexVacationing
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel on March 31. It is located in Hotel Circle and is close to everything in San Diego. A major plus. It was my wife and I and two kids. The price was a good value, however the room with two beds was quite small. Bathroom was clean, nice 42 inch Samsung LCD. Bed comforter was worn and see its day. We were close to pool and there was an aroma of chlorine in the hallway and room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Surfchic55
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days since the wedding we had flown in for was taking place here. We had a king bedroom which was very nice and clean however the bathroom was quite small. We did have two problems with the AC and toilet not flushing but both were resolved quickly. The restaurant was good and reasonably priced, the wedding grounds were very pretty and the ballroom was the perfect setting for the reception. It's close to Sea World which was an added perk. Overall, the beds were comfortable, the rooms were clean and the staff was friendly. The only downside is there are no elevators so if you have quite a bit of luggage or have a hard time going up and down stairs, request a ground unit.

Reviews.Title: “First Trip To San Diego”
Reviews.Author: orahiram
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip - vacation-- to San Diego. We selected the Handlery off of Travel Zoo advertisement and were not disappointed. The rooms were reasonably priced and were freshly cleaned daily as we returned from our outings. The Monday night Hamburger special was the best deal on dining for the week. The front desk staff were always very insighful and helpful. We rented a car for a days' drive up the coast to La Jolla and beyond, and the office for renting vehicles is about 15 steps from the front desk. Both Jeff and Rich were very polite and timely on their shutle pickups and deliveries. Thanks guys. Jeff made a recommendation for a nice meal our final night in California - a steak house and prime rib place just walking distance from the hotel and provided a couple of discount coupons to boot. It's a great restaurant and if you are looking for an off property special meal, this is the place!! All in all we had a wonderful trip to San Diego and the Handlery more than met our expectations. We highly recommend the place. (Wish we could have used the lovely pool - but it was a bit cool the week we were there. Best wished Handlery from your friends in Nebraska.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary at the Handlery”
Reviews.Author: Sandy T
Reviews.Content: We spent nine nights at this lovely hotel, celebrating our anniversary. We enjoyed our stay and found the staff very helpful and friendly. Our shuttle driver Jeff felt like a friend and made some great suggestions for our trip. We were thrilled with a complimentary bottle of champagne on our special day. The rooms are updated and the beds are fabulous! The pool and gardens are beautifully maintained, you really feel the tropical ambiance of San Diego. Once we found our way around, with the help of staff, we found this location great. We didn't have a car and relied a lot on the great shuttle service and then became comfortable with the easy transit system in this beautiful city. This hotel is also a short walk to the Fashion Valley Mall which has a number of dining options. I would recommend this hotel to future travellers!

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: Sarah W
Reviews.Content: I left my cell phone there and they sent it to me at santa monica but they put there own zip code on it and I didn't get it before I came back home in Australia they refunded my $30 but I'm still waiting for the $168 that it cost me to get it sent back to Australia, when I was told that it will be and its been 3 to 4 weeks now I've left lost of messages and I haven't heard back. Not happy when we tipped a lot, I will write a better review when I get my $168 back that I was told that I will!

Reviews.Title: “Good vacation-not how it appears”
Reviews.Author: Vmmurphy4
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and nice and the rooms are nice nothing too big though- it isn't how it looks on the website. It is similar to a holiday inn express. The location is bad. You have to absolutely have a car if you want to go anywhere. It's about $25 can ride to the airport as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Courteous Service!”
Reviews.Author: PNairVancouver
Reviews.Content: I was with my family here for 4 nights and we enjoyed excellent service from Jeff to all the staff at the front desk, housekeeping and Postcards Restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: MaryEllen2012
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent a week at the Handlery. The staff was very friendly, the rooms were nice and very clean. We had breakfast and dinner there and were quite impressed, top notch. Jeff, the driver, was the best, our best friend! We would highly recommend this hotel and would love to go back for a longer visit next time. Thanks Handlery, we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff-great place!!”
Reviews.Author: Nicki P
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for almost a week. The staff were great ((in particular Erica, Erika, Rich and Jeff)) rooms were always cleaned fantastically daily, staff were only too eager and willing to help-extremely friendly and we are sorry to be saying goodbye. Thanks soooo much for making our San Deigo stay wonderful ((we'll definately be recommending this place when we get back to Australia)).

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely breath taking, clean, great service, and a great place for business or for families.”
Reviews.Author: KennaLee
Reviews.Content: As soon as I got there I thought it was gorgeous. It is a be beautiful hotel with excellent service. People at the front desk were very nice and made it easy to get my room. One employee who really stood out here was miguel, he helped us get all of our luggage to our room and told us about all the activities the hotel was providing. We enjoyed a great dinner at the hotel and were able to watch a movie at the pool. During the day the pool was is a great place to spend time. I honestly can't think of anything bad about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Steven E
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful staff! The rooms were clean and spacious enough for our needs. The cleaning staff did a great job every day. The shuttle drivers were awesome, very informative, helpful and readily available.They went above and beyond. The front desk group was fantastic and so friendly. All the meals we had at the Handlery were very good with the service staff being very good and very friendly. Likely the friendliest hotel experience we've had.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded Econo lodge”
Reviews.Author: medic32
Reviews.Content: This place is way over priced, it's so confusing. The hotel tries to be five star and totally looks like a motor inn. Just confused. Not a good value! Don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff! Clean hotel. Very awesome”
Reviews.Author: Bryn G
Reviews.Content: This was an AMAZING hotel with the best service I have had anywhere. Front desk was exceptional and the bartender was great too. Everything at this hotel was immaculate and I felt like I was not getting ripped off. Great location in Hotel Circle and you don't have to drive far to get where you are going. I will stay here again it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Handlery is OK”
Reviews.Author: AliO16
Reviews.Content: Handlery looks like a very nice resort type hotel on the internet, but its not. Its ok, but its not what I expected based on the photos and reviews online. Its decor is very 70's, single paned windows, air and heating did not work in our room, incredibly small bathroom and tub. The pool was smaller than expected as well. On a positive note, all the staff was very nice and the food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Handlery San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Mike K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Handlery from Feb.20 to Feb.27. We stayed here because our daughter Sarah stayed here for Comic Con 2011 and she enjoyed it. Jeff & Rich in Concierge were super to deal with. They were very knowledgeable and friendy. Erica, in Postcards, remembered Sarah from her stay last year. Both Erica and Laura were great to deal with. Jose, Lupe and Robert, also in Postcards, were great. Stephanie & Erica at the front desk were also great to deal with. Lisette was also extremely helpful and friendly. Any concern that we had was addressed quickly and politely. As for the hotel itself, it was clean and comfortable. The pool and hot tub were nice after a hot day wandering around. The hotel was located convieniently close to everything we wanted do, from Gaslamp to Old Town to Coronado to Balboa Park. Shopping was close and easily accessible from the hotel site. The next visit we do to the San Diego area we will definitely be choosing the Handlery for our stay. The staff made us feel welcome and we felt we were treated better then just guests staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in San Diego, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy8166
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in town for a conference and were very pleased with the staff, especially Erica. She made our work stay feel more like a vacation. The restaurant was outstanding. With the weather being so warm it was great to relax by the pool, which is huge! We will definitely come back, the staff were great!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic overseas holiday!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dekiel
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights The Hotel was Great,the staff were outstanding couldnt do enough for us the Front Desk were Terrific and Jeff the Shuttle driver/Concierge was just Outstanding.Helped us with everything, First Time overseas and They made our Holiday that Soooo Much Better.Great with Kids they have a great Pool and Restaurant Staff were Terrific.Rooms were always Spot on Hsk did a great Job.Overall We will definetley Be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and caring employees”
Reviews.Author: EMapman
Reviews.Content: I am on a cross country bicycle and I met Rich who works for the hotel in Florida at the airport. After talking for a few minutes he asked where I was staying. I didn't have a reservatIon in the area so he recommended the Handlery. He said it was nice and convienient to the area I needed to be in in the San Diego area. The room was very comfortable and the other staff excellent. The hotel was everything he said and more. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Recent stay at the Handlery Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anne Snowdenham
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights over a week at the Handlery Hotel en route for Baja California. The rooms were very comfortable, the food was good and the staff - particularly the front desk and the shuttle driver Geoff - were excellent. They bent over backwards to help us with all our queries and nothing was too much trouble. We would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: J2PTRAVELER
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a stay at the Handlery. I was pleasantly surprised. I was staying there as a tour I was taking was leaving out of this hotel, so they had recommended it. The rooms were spotless & quiet. And thier pool is awesome. The resturant is not to be missed. The waitress said their specialty was their mushroom soup. Boy was she right. It was amazing. And the people at this hotel are just wonderful. I would stay there again in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Sftravels59
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and tasteful. All staff were friendly and professional. Continental breakfast was plentiful with fresh fruit. Conveniently located with 5 min drive to Old Town and 10 minute drives to Zoo and Seaworld.

Reviews.Title: “Handlery Hotel & Resort in San Diego is the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: Erlinda A
Reviews.Content: We just had a Valentine's Celebration at this hotel last Saturday, 02-11-12, with more than 180 guests and the comments from 100 % of them were all positive. They've been asking me who's my contact and I said; Jamie Bartholomew. She is really a great Catering Manager. I followed her anywhere she goes because she's great! She has a great personality that you feel comfortable and welcome to deal with her. I really love Jamie, she's great! Actually, another group asked me if I could hook them up with my contact this September and I will surely take them to Jamie. The food was No.One! Thanks to the chef that night! Another thing that I would like to mention is our night manager, Ramon Ibarra. He made sure that anything we want that night was done.Thanks, Ramon! The location of the hotel is perfect and the rooms were all nice and clean. Staffs were all courteous and friendly too. I'll definitely bring more friends and heads of different organizations here. Thank you, Handlery Hotel & Resort in San Diego for making my party memorable and successful! Love you all guys!

Reviews.Title: “Handlery Hotel & Resort-A Great Venue for Your Event”
Reviews.Author: Alex S
Reviews.Content: VITAS Innovative Hospice Care of San Diego held our 5th Annual Memory Bear Reunion at this facility Sat. Feb 11, 2012. The staff helped us provide an excellent event for our patient's families. Ann Marie, Social Catering Manager, Ramon Ibarra, Banquet Captain, and the staff who worked our event were all Outstanding. They continuously check in to see how we were doing, identified an issue and resolved it as well as provided us with extra supplies we needed. I would highly recommend this hotel for your next event. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Handlery hotel San Diego rocks”
Reviews.Author: Sharon H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Handlery hotel in San diego In jan 2012 and we had a great time. We had a guy called geoff looking after us and he drives u anywhere u want ands it's complimentary. The hotel is clean,friendly and great value for money. We will definitely be staying there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful seven day visit”
Reviews.Author: SteveandShelly
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at at the Handlery. The room was very clean and quiet (even with the interstate nearby). A great plus was the free shuttle to Balboa Park, SeaWorld and Old Town. Drivers Jeff and Rich both went out of their way to make our stay fun and accommodate to our needs. Appreciated the complimentary newspaper available at the front desk. The front desk staff were very helpful in getting us specific information on where a movie was available and in locating a restaurant. Would definitely stay there again. If you book via an internet package and the package indicates you have free parking and wifi, make sure you mention that specifically or you will be charged. If I could have changed anything (and these are nits) I would have liked the public computer located near the lobby to have been free and for there not to have been bottles of Aqua Fina in the rooms that incur a charge of 3.50 if you drink them.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service - lovely resort”
Reviews.Author: Robyn G
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights for a business trip and had a great stay, although the hotel is probably better suited to holiday makers. The rooms are tradiitonal but have everything you need and the staff were more than happy to bring anything we needed from extra coat hangers to a Blackberry charger. The pool area is lovely and spacious plus there is a pool bar, restaurant and indoor bar area all of which have a good variety of food from snacks to full meals. The overwhelming attribute of this hotel though is the helpful and friendly staff who could not have been better. Particularly Dan in the pool bar and the complimentary shuttle drivers Jeff and Rich who were happy to ferry us around San Diego and both gave us great recommendations of where to eat, places we would never have found by ourselves. Overall we had a great time in San Diego, which was enhanced by a great stay at the Handlery Hotel and Resort.

Reviews.Title: “good serveice”
Reviews.Author: Tony K
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Handlery, food in the bar was good and reasonably priced. Traveling to and from the hotel in the shuttle gave us good access and the driver Rich was friendly and a great source of local information. Close by the Cheesecake factory at Fashion valley is well worth the visit for Aussies.

Reviews.Title: “January 2012 postive experience”
Reviews.Author: G S
Reviews.Content: First time at this property. It is a very old property one of the first in Mission Valley, saw some pictures in the lobby from the 40s. With that being said it is very well kept up and was clean everywhere we looked. Staff was friendly, restaurant was very good and the price was reasonable. You know you are in an older hotel when the pool still has a 10 ft deep end!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and staff are friendly”
Reviews.Author: Polina T
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in January 2012 and the hotel staff are very friendly. Particularly Rich the shuttle driver is very friendly and helpful, he gave us many good advises. Also Mitch the concierge is also very helpful and give us good recommendation on where to find the good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Handlery Hotel stay was brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Cathy K
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have just stayed here on our US holiday (from New Zealand) and what a great place to stay. Good central starting place to get to many local attractions. A huge thanks for the complimentary shuttle van & great drivers who were only too happy to go that extra mile out of their way to help us folks on our first stay in San Diego. Hotel staff very informative & great hints for best eating places & shopping when out for the day. Spa & swimming pool were awesome to relax in after a long day out. We loved our stay here & would absolutely go back there again if we head to San Diego again at anytime. Well done to all the staff for making our stay so enjoyable. Barry & Cathy Kewish, New Zealand.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at the Handlery”
Reviews.Author: alberta38
Reviews.Content: My family just got back from a week in San Diego last week, and we really liked this hotel/resort. We were lucky that it was not busy, so we basically had the heated pool and the hot tub to ourselves most days. The pool area was very clean and tidy. We still had poolside service for drinks or snacks from the poolside lounge. Daniel was very helpful with directions and recommendations in the area, he was serving at the reefside lounge. Thanks Daniel! Our room was small but tidy, the bathroom was always clean, needs a little tlc to fix it up a bit, but good otherwise. Nice to have a fridge for snacks and drinks in the room. The hotel is very close to a major roadway, so the road noise took awhile to get used to. The continental breakfast which was included for our trip was nice...the waiters always tried to bring a variety of breakfast items...not buffet. We had no issues with check in or out...Thought we would be charged for parking on site, as I was warned online before of this, but it did not appear on our bill..We did rent a car, and you better bring a nav. system or gps because this country girl's head was spinning with all the off ramps, interchanges, and feeder routes, etc, but surprisingly, traffic moved very fast, but very little traffic jams!I would not hesitate to stay here again or recommend it to friends... another perk was the proximity to a large outdoor mall called Fashion Vally Mall??? It has all the big name retailers, and you can even walk it if you want. We did not use the shuttle, but you can do this if you do not rent a car. Actually a close drive to the airport (15 mintues max?). Thanks to all the staff for a lovely stay! The staff seemed quite happy to be there and willing to help with all our inqueries....

Reviews.Title: “Credit Card Fraud”
Reviews.Author: Mark W
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at Handlery on 6/24/11 but when I called to confirm I was told I did not have a reservation and the hotel was booked. I turned around and went home. I was surpised to see a charge for $156.38 on my next credit card statement, so I tried to have my credit card company reverse charges. The hotel fought me vehemently, arguing that I had no showed on a reservation. Finally, I posted a negative review on Yelp and got an email from the general manager, Pete Lassalette, who assured me that the money would be refunded. It was, and then was promptly REBILLED. This company has absolutely no integrity. I was completely scammed.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Iz0nevisi0n
Reviews.Content: This hotel recommended a restaurant and gave us the directions to it. We dressed for dinner and proceed to the restaurant using the direction we were given. During a two and one half hour search we never found the restaurant (even though we asked many people for help including the police). It was dark and the neighborhood was not very good. Finally, after being exhausted by this wild goose chase, we gave up and then had a difficult time returning to the hotel. By the time we got to the hotel it was late and we were obviously quite hungry, as well as disappointed. The receptionist who gave us the directions admitted she had erred and had printed out the wrong instructions. The next day, when we decided to check out, there was no effort to compensate us for our horrible night caused by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and well placed”
Reviews.Author: Kiwitravell
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here post cruise. Very quiet as just before Christmas. Hardly saw anyone else! Initially was a bit concerned about distance from downtown but didn't end up being a problem. Free shuttles a bonus, to Seaworld, local fashion mall, Old Town and the zoo, but they don't run very late in the day though. Great breakfast was included in our room rate, not buffet but ended up being much nicer being served. Restaurant menu limited but reasonable quality and price. Loved the heat of the spa pool - very toasty and great to soak in after a day out. Only cost about $10 to get taxi there from great local shopping mall and from Old Town. I would recommend others this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Ann442
Reviews.Content: The Handlery is a great hotel with staff who went out of their way to make sure we had a wonderful vacation. We have just spent 2 weeks there over Christmas and we were lucky enough to be upgraded to a room with a balcony overlooking the pool area. We used the restaurant about six times over the 2 weeks and Erika, Robert and Fermin were friendly and looked after us every time. Special thanks to Jeff who drove the shuttle bus which we used frequently over our time at the hotel. The shuttle goes to Fashion Valley Mall, Old Town, Seaworld, Zoo and Balboa park. Jeff was fantastic, never late, good source of information and went out of his way to make sure we had a wonderful time. We would have no problem recommending the Handlery and would definitely stop there again when we next visit San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Must be Better Options”
Reviews.Author: sak116
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Handlery in October 2011 while attending a conference at the Town & Country Resort. The Handlery is within walking distance of the Town & Country and the hotel also provided shuttle service. However, if you can find a Hampton Inn close by, go for it. The room I had was musty smelling and in need of updating. Also, the hotel nickle and dimes you to death, charging for internet service as well as parking. You may think you're getting a bargain, but they'll get it from you in the end. Steer clear and go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: oceansideCalgary
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November before and after our cruise. This hotel offers great value for the price. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Jeff the shuttle driver was the best and the shuttle service is free to certain locations, San Diego Zoo,Old Town, etc. It is also very close to Fashion Valley shopping mall and we were able to walk there in less than 10 minutes. You can catch the train at the mall, which we did and took it to Old Town. The rooms were spacious and clean. Ate breakfast in the restaurant, and the food was great and the portions were large. There is a lovely pool area. Also stayed at the Sheraton San Diego Hotel and Marina 1 night and definitely preferred the Handlery. Much better service and value for your dollar. Would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2011Patricia
Reviews.Content: Our girls holiday (7 of us) spent time at this hotel before and after a Mexican Cruise. This hotel was close to many sights and the staff was incredible. The free shuttle service to Old Town, Zoo and outlet mall was a nice touch. The large pool was great with lots of lounge chairs. Will stay there next time in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Raja R
Reviews.Content: Very courteous staff. Very comfortable room. Complimentary shuttle service to San Diego Zoo, Sea World, Old town and Fashion Valley shopping mall. The coach drivers are very friendly and helpful. Free WiFi from lobby. 24 hour WiFi from room at $10 per 24 hour period.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: SweetMcLaughlin
Reviews.Content: Staff was very helpful,and friendly. Jeff the shuttle driver was very too. Shuttle runs 9-5pm. Room was cozy. Bed was very comfortable. Postcards was a pretty good place to eat dinner. Walking distance from Fashion Valley Mall. Be prepared to have $300 held on your credit or debit card. If you dont rent a car $18 oneway will get you into the Gaslamp, $10 oneway gets you into Old Town if you dont take the shuttle. $25 oneway from airport. Enjoyed stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay!”
Reviews.Author: CaribbeanJo
Reviews.Content: We are happy to stay here because it is a union hotel that gives excellent service. It is central to many San Diego attractions and the shuttle takes you to the zoo, Balboa Park, Old Town and Sea World, plus they will drop you anywhere along the way. Jose and Stephanie at the front desk are incredible help; attentive and knowledgable! There is not a better bartender on the planet than Lupe and Rich is the best driver around. There is a concierge named JIm who works his butt off to accomodate all requests The rooms are clean and functional. My maid, Martha, was sweet and got me anything I asked for. There was a fridge in my room which helped for leftovers. We never even left for dinner since Erika and Laura are so good in the dining room. I love it that they keep the pool heated and I swam in it for three hours on a 65 degree day since the water was 82 degrees. The spa was hot and well-kept, also. I can't say enough good about our stay here. We were here for five days for my husband's work and the staff took care of anything I asked while I was there. The rooms were comfortable, the shuttle was great, the food was terrific, and the service was superb. (An extra thanks to Jose.)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: mtcouple4
Reviews.Content: The staff here is very wonderful.Very friendly and so very helpful. Rich is excellent shuttle driver. Gives great tips. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: boydmi
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I stayed here October 2011. The room was excellent and the restaurant food and staff were amazing. The cooked breakfast was great. Jeff the shuttle driver went out of his way to be helpful which we very much appreciated. Close proximity to Fashion Valley was a plus. We were lucky, we had a local friend drive us around. I found San Diego to be very much a drivers city but loved it & I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service!!”
Reviews.Author: Bobby B
Reviews.Content: Stayed a single night on a busy weekend in San Diego and with a bit of serendipity and luck ended up at the Handlery and had great service from the friendly staff all the way around. Wonderful help with check-in, assistance getting local transportation and super check-out. Friendly staff that I was happy (as happy as you can be) to give my money to. Great location, clean rooms, nice upgrades, and super experience. Outgoing hospitality and all services exceeded my expectations. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay Hotel but Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl J
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just okay! I stayed from 10/30-11/04/11! The staff all over was very nice and helpful but they still need to upgrade a few things such as The shower handle fell off when trying to turn it on to use. Also the special at the restaurant on 10/30/11 was Prime Rib and was a horrible experience. The meat was mostly fat and was tough. Tasted liked marked down meat leftover. Ordering from the menu the next day was better. They redeemed themselves the second day. NO MORE SPECIALS! UGH! TERRIBLE! Need more lighting at night when walking throughout property outside for safety reasons. Need a wider selection of food on 950 lounge menu. Also would like to recommend serving turkey products as well.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nicko1977
Reviews.Content: LOCATION - Located next to the interstate 8 APPEARANCE - You can't miss this hotel with it's huge sign outside. the hotel is split into different buildings RECEPTION - extremely friendly and helpful lady on reception when we arrived she found us 2 rooms adjoining and helped us with lots of information regarding sea world and the zoo ROOM - We stayed in room 405. Room was very clean with 2 large beds which were extremely comfortable, lots of power sockets including sockets in the table lamps. A good sized tv although the tv had terrible reception. A desk with a lamp with power sockets. The room didn't have a safe. The bathroom was on the small size but still very clean. And the air con was on but even when set at 20 degrees it wasn't very cool. BAR - bar area is very open plan. Located near reception. RESTAURANT - very good food at a reasonable price. MISC - big car park so no problem with parking you need a security pass to get in and out of the car park however what they fail to tell you is they charge $8 per day to park. Another downside was that they charge $10 per day for wifi. However they do provide a free shuttle bus to San Diego zoo & sea world. OVERALL THOUGHTS - while I recommend this hotel and had a pleasant stay I would suggest that they reconsider their wifi charges as this was the 3rd hotel I had stayed in on this trip and the only hotel that charged for their wifi. And I found it deceiving that I was not informed about parking charges especially when the car park was less than half full.

Reviews.Title: “* A cut above the others*”
Reviews.Author: sunflowers061
Reviews.Content: My first trip to San Diego! where to stay amid all those Hotels-Motels? Did some research including Tripadvisor, made a booking and as we sped thru *hotel valley* there it stood, tall & majestic, The Handlery Hotel & Resort. What a gem! From my first meeting with both Jose & Micheal at their respective desks I had this great feeling I had chosen a winner! As I entered my large cool immaculate bedroom, complete with tea\coffee facilities plus a refrigator, then stepped into the compact fully furnished bathroom with shower\tub, loads of fluffy white towels plus toiletries, I knew I had made the right choice. the grounds are beautifully maintained as is the lovely pool, with fresh towels set out on sunbeds each morning. The entire staff could not have been more pleasant and helpful. The dining room serves delicious food both at breakfast and dinner with lots of variety on the menu. And for those of us (without wheels) the Hotel has a courtsey bus, I managed to visit Sea World, The Zoo, Old Town and the shopping mall during my four day visit. Thank you Michael for your courtsey,help & information. I most certainly recommend this fine establishment to discerning travellers who want that extra touch - upscale without being snobbish! I believe there is a sister hotel in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Not as special as I expected”
Reviews.Author: wkrupa7586
Reviews.Content: The Handlery was listed as this special place to stay a prime spot in San Diego. Well, there was nothing special about it. The rooms are outdated, the bathrooms are even more outdated, I guess if you wrere here to golf then it would be just another place to rest your head at night. However since it was business for me and I expected a lot more, I was not blown away at all, but it was clean and had a good restaurant if you did not want to leave for a meal.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place, Helpful Staff, Will be getting another * i hope.”
Reviews.Author: NewlyTravellers
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing, the staff where helpful and always went out of their way to make our stay comfortable, nothing beats sitting in the spa at night with a cold beer and this is the place to do it. Say G-day to Rich, Jim on reception, Erin in the bar, or Brooke who loves green elephant shirts hahaha.. I will be back to stay again as for the whole 4 weeks i was in California this was the best place myself and my family stayed. Congratulations on a job well done guys, be proud of the team you are with and enjoy you upcoming Star!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to the drivers”
Reviews.Author: caldicot_11
Reviews.Content: Recenlty we spent one week at the hotel & 2 people stuck out in our minds & that of our grandson (9yrs) was the two drivers Jeff & Rich. No obstackle was any difficulty for these two gents, They did what they say they would & when they should but they both went that little bit further to make our stay so memorable. Thanks guys. Jerry & Wendy Allen September 2011

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Handlery Hotel”
Reviews.Author: babyblue1982
Reviews.Content: I have recently come back from a 2 week stay in California and spent 1 week at the Handlery Hotel. The rooms were basic, but nice and roomy. The pool was great with a bar close by. We used the courtesy free bus to get to the old town, Sea World and San Diego Zoo, which was fantastic. The staff were very pleasent and helpful. I would definately recommend this hotel to others in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Darryl B
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights and our only problem was that we wished we stayed a bit longer.Our rooms were clean and comfortable,and when you are on hols that is what you want as you are not in your rooms all day.The restaurant was fantastic and the meals were very filling.Robert in the restaurant was great and the nights we dined there he gave us exceptional service. Jeff and Rich who drove many of the guests around in the hotel shuttle were also excellent,each of them helped us out at various times.We had a little problem where we had to go back to Seaworld the day after our initial visit and Jeff drove us there and then waited while we got our issue sorted out.He then suggested we head to Old Town,and we are so glad he did as the day we had there was fantastic.Rich also helped us get to our train on time the day we were leaving,we have recommended this hotel to our family and friends here in Australia and we are already planning our next trip there.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected...”
Reviews.Author: Wetfella8062
Reviews.Content: This is a family hotel through and through with a motel feel. Thehotel is relatively small, the reception feels as though you're in a conference annexe to the main building. Staff polite and helpful. The pool area works well as a children's play area - lively rather than peaceful. The Reef Pool Bar is fine, service good, decor tacky to say the least! Security doesn't feel good - many room doors open onto open air stairways - anyone can walk into the Hotel, literally! No elevators so prepare to hump your bags around! The location for access to San Diego is poor. Cabs to the Old Town cost 13 dollars each way, 17 dollars to the Gaslamp area. The nightlife and restaurants are best in the Gaslamp area which is why I would recommend a large hotel ( Marriott or Manchester Hotel in the downtown bay area. Cab drivers usually do not know this hotel. The hotel website boasts free transport into town - this ended at 5.00pm and I saw no evidence of it in any case. The on-site Postcards Bistro is uninviting, I didn't try the food though. Also be aware that some of the poolside 'rooms' are used for external group meetings and conventions. This is a well meaning hotel but it really doesn't cut the mustard for a city such as San Diego. Personally I'd look elsewhere and not be taken in by claims of easy access to the main town areas. The hotel is linked by a fast moving motorway to the town areas - driving is a nightmare especially during rush hour.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: Lara F
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night as we had come off a cruise and were flying out the next day but the people who work at the Handlery Hotel and Resort were fantastic. They really know how to look after their customers. We had a pre-paid voucher which stated breakfast was included however we needed to be at San Diego Airport at 4.00am to check-in for our flight and breakfast at the hotel didn't start until 6.00am. Upon asking whether or not it would be possible for us to be given some cereal and milk so we could eat it in our room before heading to the airport we were advised they could definitely put something together for us and they did! We headed off to the zoo for the day and took advantage of the free shuttle service provided by the hotel. When we came back they advised breakfast was in the fridge in our room. What a feast they provided us with - milk, yoghurt, orange juice, fresh fruit and pastries. That night we ate dinner in 'Postcards' and again the service and food couldn't have been better and it was really well priced! We would highly recommend staying here, it's just a shame we had such a short stay with them.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: Albert377
Reviews.Content: Best experience staying at a hotel ever! Staff was very helpful and courteous ( especially Jeff--the shuttle bus driver and Michael at the info desk). The hotel is very clean and the room is spacious and spotless. The hotel has shuttle which goes to Old Town, San Diego Zoo and Seaworld. Jeff was wonderful--friendly, goes out of his way to help people out, informative, and always on time. We bought tickets at the hotel for the Zoo and Seaworld at a discounted price and that enabled us to skip the line-up for getting tickets at the zoo or seaworld ticket booth. It is away from downtown so it's nice and quiet. It is about 3 blocks from Fashion Valley Mall and the trolley station, about 15-20 min from airport, the cruise pier and downtown, and about 10 min from Seaworld and Old Town.It's very convenient! We enjoyed our stay at Handlery,San Diego very much and would certainly recommend it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: shay e
Reviews.Content: I've stayed all over San Diego, and this was the best experience overall so far. Staff was very courteous and helpful with any request. Great ambiance, rooms were spotless, and the overall atmosphere is very inviting. The pool area is much better than anywhere i've stayed on hotel circle, and it doesn't feel like you are right next to the freeway like so many other hotels in San Diego. Family friendly without being 'kiddie-land', and great bar area with friendly bartenders.... definately going back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room at check-in but...”
Reviews.Author: Igobytom2
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and clean. Second floor balcony was nice and private but I never had time to use it but I liked the amount of natural sunlight. I expected car noise but people talking on their patios and sounding like they were on your patio was disturbing. I kept looking out the window to see who was out there. Then I noticed that the bathroom smelled like ant spray. When I used the shower the smell got worse until it washed out. At night I kept trying to turn down to the tv only to find that the walls are paper thin and the tv sound was from the next room over. Paper thin walls also caused me to experience more of the neighbors more amorous adventures than I wanted at 2am. Disturbing Sleep. People hanging out in the parking lot. Thin walls. Slow service at restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Handy to all in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: kimandco_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Handlery, San Diego, good size complex away from central city, about 15-20 min from Airport the Hotel had a lovely restaurant open till 10pm and room service if you were late getting in, they had a big laundry, so you didnt have to wait long to use it, two bars and the whole place was very relaxed. They have a free shuttle service that will take you to several tourist places and collect you if required, and if not in busy season they will take you almost anywhere. Rooms were a good size (all you need on holiday) with coffee maker, fridge, Iron etc. The monorail service was only a 10 minute walk away, right at Fashion Mall, and getting back at night was very safe, although not alot of lighting between monorail station and hotel. Hotel not really in walking distance to anything, you need to use the monorail, but nice location and quite and peaceful. Lovely pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Guests allow pool use!”
Reviews.Author: Shooter38
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Handlery San Diego in Early Sept 11 for a few days. We stayed in one of the primier rooms with a balcony overlooking the pool. The room was actually pretty small considering it was one of thier best rooms. The restaurant in the hotel, cant remember the name of it, was ok but very over priced for average food. The biggest concern i had was the hotel lets the public use thier pool. Every day the pool is extremely crowded by the locals, great for them, but sucks for the hotel guests who would like to relax poolside. Loads of children, adults, ect...and just couldnt relax. I have no idea why a hotel would allow this, the locals i believe pay for parking, but thats it. I really could care less about them paying or not. Many other hotel residents also complained as we spoke about the locals using the pool. No one was happy.. Handlery, wake up and listen to your customers!!!!!!!! No more locals in the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with complimentary transport to seaworld, zoo ,beaches & downtown”
Reviews.Author: MidlandsHelen
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th stay here. The rooms are great & the staff are excellent. The complimentary shuttle bus, with Jeff & Rich, will take you to the zoo, seaworld, beaches & downtown daily. The new grill bar is a good place to get a snack & Susie is brilliant. Fashion Valley shopping mall is only a 10 minute walk too. Will be looking to book again in 2012 too.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Tiki-Tim
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel with very clean rooms.Pool was huge and well layed out.Continental breakfast was good.The thing that amazed me was the fantastic service.From desk clerks to the maintence staff,all were very friendly.Shuttle service to local attrctions were fast and prompt (thanks Jeff).I highly recommend staying at this hotel if you're in SanDiego.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding staff; ok rooms”
Reviews.Author: Martha G
Reviews.Content: I was staying there when the San Diego power went out; the staff handled the situation very well. They handed out bottled water and glow sticks and were pretty darn cheerful. I ate in the casual restaurant by the pool and the waitress was super as was the ice tea. The pool is beautiful. The rooms are mediocre, old style and as I found out when the power went out, the windows only open a few inches. The workout room is nice and faces the pool. The bed was comfy but it was hot! Again, the staff was first rate and kept checking to ensure everyone was ok.

Reviews.Title: “VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: Shelley C
Reviews.Content: Good, clean property. We didn't pick up a car until we left San Diego so for eating out / night out we had to book cabs, but not very expensive. During the day there is a free shuttle to take you to main attractions which is well organised. All staff are very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Emma C
Reviews.Content: The Handlery Hotel and Resort in San Diego is perfect for any length on stay in San Diego! Its location on Hotel Circle meant that we were in a very short distance to every district to visit. This hotel could not have been faulted! I feel this price we paid, was almost under what this hotel could charge, for its first class service and amenities! After arriving with no luggage due to the airline losing it on our travels, the reception staff were genuinely lovely in accommodating with toiletries and anything we needed. All staff at this hotel were friendly and went out there way to help us get the best out of our stay. The concierge and reception staff offered great assistance and advice on how to get around in San Diego, as well as calling various taxi services to get the cheapest deal for our return trip to the airport! The manager also opened the small store when it was closed so we could purchase suncream before heading to the beach. The rooms were to a high standard and the pool area tranquil, with the added luxury of a actually good band playing into the sunset. One aspect of this hotel's amenities was the shuttle service that runs to the Old Town, San Diego Zoo and Seaworld was a fantastic service, and free to use! Jeff who runs the shuttles was our perfect tourist guide, giving us the inside tips what to see first at the zoo, and making extra runs to fit us in as we forgot to book the shuttle the previous night. He took us to bus and trolley routes and explained how we got to the districts we were visiting, which were only two stops away, as well as telling us to buy the $5 all day ticket to save money! So helpful and kind! As well as always on perfect time to collect us at the arranged time after the zoo and seaworld! Could not fault this hotel in any way! It is fab and perfect for anyone wanting to be in a prime location for all areas of San Diego! Would book again in a flash!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel....I will be back”
Reviews.Author: maryhuff75
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this hotel in March 2011 for my son's graduation from USMC boot camp in San Diego. The hotel is in a great location and the patio is gorgeous (as was the pool/hot tub area). It was very clean and the staff was great. The breakfast buffet was adequate, but if you want a substantial meal, you would need to order from the menu.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very nice!”
Reviews.Author: lcmiller1s
Reviews.Content: We found the Handlery Hotel on a travel site (bookit.com) for a price reasonable enough for my friend and I being students. The room was very very clean and really pretty. Great balcony looking over the pool, free wi-fi, nice big flat screen and super comfy bed. I loved it. The staff as always helpful and the hotel premises was always clean. Breakfast was free every day, it was simple but just what I liked- fresh fruit (yum pineapple), bagels, yogurts, etc. If I had one complaint it would be that you had to pay for parking, but splitting the cost between 2 people made it not so bad. The location was perfect, central to pretty much everything. Could hop right on to the highway and take off for the beach. I would definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “No value to the cost. We will never return.”
Reviews.Author: Larry L
Reviews.Content: This expensive low-quality hotel does not stand up to other nearby hotels that I personally visited; I went to 5: Marriott, Best Western, Hilton, Quality Inn, Comfort Suites. This hotel's rates were higher than other options without the quality to back it up Parking costs extra, ballpark of $12 per day. There is an exorbitant charge held for "incidentals" ($100 per night which came to $300 total for me, compared to $50 total or $0 total from other hotels). When I refused to allow the $300 charge I was left feeling very un-welcome but they still gave me a room for fear of losing my business. No elevators. The room had a filthy dirty carpet which literally turned brand-new white socks black within the first three minutes walking in the room after check-in, and filth continued to also be a problem each day after a maid enters to "clean"; and made bare feet visibly revoltingly dirty. Hole in tile on wall in shower. Very dated and poor quality shower and bath fixtures. No option for 2 queen beds (only 1 for 2 double beds). We got a king mattress but where would the kids sleep? Roll away bed costs extra ($10 per night), no hide-a-way bed. Why bed my children on the floor after knowing how un-clean the carpet was and continued to be? No extra chair or sofa in room, as is common in competing hotels. Part of curtain hanging or dangling off curtain rod (not clipped in place). Wi-Fi costs extra to use.

Reviews.Title: “Do not waste your money”
Reviews.Author: marla l
Reviews.Content: Hotel website makes hotel look beautiful. In reality, hotel very old and dingy. Absolutely no customer service. If you request towels, you won't get them. If a package is delivered for you, you won't receive it. Pool area smells like chemicals, no exhaust fan in bathroom, bath tub did not drain, slider doors do not lock or open and close properly (out to patio area). Our per night rate was $174.00 and this hotel should have cost about $80.00 per night. I will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel if you're visiting San Diego Zoo and Sea World”
Reviews.Author: beta1975
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights with my husband and our two young sons (5 year old and a 21 month old) as part of our 5-week trip to the US. We were visiting San Diego to visit San Diego Zoo, Sea World and Legoland. I chose this hotel because it looked nice (although I think the photos on the website make it look better than what it is), offered a free shuttle to the zoo and Sea World and because Expedia had a half price deal on the room rate. Overall I was very happy with our stay considering the price we paid. I had booked a standard room with two double beds for $65 per night (bargain!!). Upon check in we were given the option to upgrade our room, which we did. I think it was an extra $30 and we were given a room with view of the pool with balcony, free Internet and two bottles of water a day. The rooms were quite small (we had a crib as well in our room) however we didn’t spend all that much time in the room anyway. The room and bathroom were both very clean. There is a coffee shop downstairs, which came in very handy with the kids, as we were able to buy milk, snacks etc. however it does close early. Breakfast that was included was good although it would be nice if they could include some hot breakfast items. We were a little confused on our first day how the coupons worked as our waitress did not tell us even where we could get out breakfast from as it was hidden behind the restaurant bar. Some days we were charged for the toast we ordered whilst other days we weren’t but we never did query it as it only a few dollars. We dined in their restaurant and used room service quite a few times and the food was very nice. The shopping centre Fashion Valley is very close by (10 minute walk) which was a really nice big shopping centre; wish we had more time to shop there! This hotel however is in the hotel circle (surrounded by other hotels) so there is nothing to do at night. This was fine with us as we were out all we were happy to stay in our hotel room at night. There are plenty of taxis in the hotel car park which was great as we were able to use them easily if we needed to go somewhere. We even booked the taxi service "Green ride" to take us from San Diego to our next stop Santa Monica. Loved the fact that the hotel had a laundry on site so I was able to do some washing before we left for our next hotel. The staff at the front desk were all very friendly and helpful and most of the other staff were lovely too (except for the waitress on our first morning breakfast). Overall a lovely hotel for our stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “I am missing my vacation already”
Reviews.Author: deana m
Reviews.Content: The service at the hotel was excellent. Everyone was very helpful and nice. My room was spacious and neat and also close to the pool. The hotel provided a shuttles service to select attractions. The pool area was great for children as well as adults. On select nights they had a band that was very good and also an outdoor movie night. My family and I really enjoyed our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Older Style Layout, Worth Staying At...”
Reviews.Author: RDibbxsh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is older, but up to date. Room are nice. Bathrooms are the older, smaller style, but fully updated with nice fixtures and counters. Bed was very comfortable. Nice black our curtains so you're not awake at the crack of dawn. Excellent air conditioning (a biggie to me.) Nice bar/bistro. Food was good and good selection of beers on tap. Nice pool are with an attached bar.

Reviews.Title: “This place was terrible -- stay across the street marriott courtyard”
Reviews.Author: texan123Austin
Reviews.Content: hotel was old, bathroom unclean , service unattentive -- if you're a business traveler give this place a pass. AND IT WAS LOUD -- even after I asked for quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: QualityLife
Reviews.Content: The Handerly was a great place to stay and very close to most major attractions. The hotel staff was very friendly. They were very attentive to our needs and responded to them immediately. The only down side was a Happy Hour at the pool where the restaurant lost our food order and did not return to see us. Perhaps the vents in our room could be vacuumed. Aside from that, we were very pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Lewis M
Reviews.Content: We stayed long enough to catch an early morning flight. The minus was the $12 seperate parking fee. The bed and room were great and check in was efficient and easy. Yes some stuff was dated but the TV and desk were outstanding. Slept well and had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Lived Up To Expectations, And Then Some:)”
Reviews.Author: Mitch G
Reviews.Content: My son and I were in San Diego recently for Comic Con and we stayed at the Handlery and I'm sure glad we did. Initially when I went shopping for a room I came here to tripadvisor and read the reviews about the hotel which were decidedly positive. Then I decided to take it one step further and actually call the hotel in order to get a few more questions answered and get a feel for the professionalism of the staff, as I'm one of these people who firmly believes that you can tell a lot about a place by the tones of the voices you hear over the phone and how they handle your call or your inquiry. The guy I talked to was Jason who was super professional and welcoming, not to mention extremely informative about the Mission Valley area as well as the hotel itself. At the end of our chat he even went above and beyond by telling me to ask for him at check in and he would see to it that we were not only well taken care of but also that he would hook us up with whatever upgrades he could. While he wasn't actually there when we checked in - he had already worked his shift and was done for the day - I dropped his name and what he told me to the girl at the front desk and she was more than accommodating by wasting no time in upgrading our room to one with a patio which I thought was nice. Every single person working there is friendly and courteous and helpful and seems to really care about seeing to it that your stay at their hotel is an excellent one and you can tell this straight away. The room, I'm happy to say, was nicely appointed, VERY clean and comfortable, and at night was PERFECTLY quiet for relaxing and sleeping which is a huge deal to me, especially when you've stayed at enough places in the past where the walls were thin and you could hear all kinds of noise from people out by the pool, etc. Not so with this place and just on this point alone I would stay here again. Also the Handlery is well situated as it is well within about a 15 minute walking distance to a really nice mall as well as the trolley station for local transit. This came in handy as a few times I had to buy some things that we needed and also my bank had an ATM there which was perfect because I really don't like to pay the fees that come with banking at a foreign (bank other than your actual bank) ATM. We will definitely book at the Handlery next time we hit the Con. The only thing I think I would change or make better, and this is not necessarily a criticism so to speak, is if the Handlery could somehow find a way to provide transportation to and from the airport. There's a limo service that does a lot of business there (in addition to taxis pulling up there in front all the time), I think it was called Green Ride or something like that, and it costs about $25 to get to the airport ($21 plus $4 gratuity) and that's what we ended up having to go with. Perhaps it has something to do with being located in Mission Valley I'm not sure but like I said it's not a criticism of the place overall. GREAT job Handlery staff and thank you again! We look forward to seeing you again next Con:)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: mswheeldon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Handlery for 6 nights at the end of our California Coastal drive during our first visit to the US. The staff on the desk were welcoming and friendly and first impression of the room was that it was basic but well equipped and clean, though a little noisy outside. We then opened the curtains and found we had a room overlooking the car park and freeway hence the noise, so i immediately went to the front desk and asked for a room change as we were staying for 6 nights and the noise would have been a problem for us. The front desk staff were very helpful and, although they couldn't move us immediately, on the second night we were given a room away from the freeway which had a more pleasant outlook and was much quieter. We found the complimentary breakfast to be adequate, especially with additional toast, and the staff in the restaurant to be very attentive and polite. We also ate in Postcards restaurant on two evenings and really enjoyed our meals and the service we received, especially from Robert our server on both nights. The concierge was really helpful, sorry i cant remember his name, but there wasn't anything that was too much trouble when it came to assisting us. The free shuttle bus was great, taking us to, and picking us up from San Diego Zoo, Old Town and Balboa Park. Both Jeff and Rich were really helpful, pointing out places to eat and tips on what to see. We also unfortunately had a problem with very noisy neighbours on another evening, playing music loudly and shouting to each other late into the night. I eventually rang down to the front desk and wished I'd done so earlier, as the response was quick and effective, as we heard a loud rap on the neighbouring door as security announced their arrival! There was no noise to be heard from then on! For a large hotel we felt that the service we received at the Handlery was very personable, friendly and welcoming. We would return and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Handlery SD no worries you will never have a chance to see us again.”
Reviews.Author: sanfranciscoao
Reviews.Content: OMG! We made our reservation over the phone. We asked to know about the shuttle service to the SD Zoo, we were told that we should not book the shuttle just to come and book it upon our checking in to the hotel. ThE only choice available was on the second day of our stay drop off at 10:30am and pick up at 4:00pm keep in mind the Zoo opens at 9:00AM till 7:00PM. Bummer right upon checking in. Next, we got room 110 which is close to the parking lot(+) but facing the freeway and main street. The CHP were very busy on the night of our stay in SD and we could hear them talking with the drivers. Not that pleasant during family vacation with young kids. Rergading the room furntures, look like the hotel website made some photos makeover to the pictuers, we wish we would get as shown. It was a disaster dasty room, doors needed some big time change, as well bathroom tiles, shower heads, sheets and blanckets. We called and complaint to the front desk- the reply was that all the rooms are the same. We wish we would read more carefully guest cooments. One thing for sure there are diffrent kind of rooms. Best suggestion make your own homework better as we decided to do now on. Handlery SD no worries you will never have a chance to see us again. The parking fees should be part of the room, as there is no where else to park. We did not like to be on the side of the freeway and be awake during the night by the CHP, aperantly they were very busy during our stay. Handlery upgrade your windows and doors. You look like inn or maybe a cheap hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: CaspianJVC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. First we were put in a room near reception that had noise from the hallway as well as the highway and it also smelt damp. We were then moved to a new room that was far better. The new room was clean and much newer looking. Having to pay for parking here is a bit of a rort. For 2 nights it was $24. As the hotel is on it's own with a huge car park and there are no other options. It should be included in the room price. Breakfast is also fairly average. You are better off driving and buying your own. If you do not have a car i would not stay here as there are not to many options for transport and the shuttle finishes at 6PM.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: nlm32
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed. The on-line pictures are very deceiving. Old and dingy looking. I requested a room with an interior corridor, meaning I want to walk by through the lobby to get to my room. This hotel is set up like a dorm with a keyed entrance from the parking lot into a building separate from the main lobby. The door to my room jammed. Bathroom was very small not suitable for two people. But what really ticked me off was they blacked out the Giants-Padres game in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service I Have Ever Had!!”
Reviews.Author: Sid0378
Reviews.Content: My family and I were looking for a good hotel to stay in, and we found this gem! We wanted to stay together to limit the cost of a Hotel. What the Handlery offered was a Suite that consisted of 2 hotel rooms connected by a breezeway. It allowed us the privacy of not actually sleeping in the same hotel room, but also the savings of actually staying together. The rooms were a good size; we did not feel like we were on top of each other. We had our own showers and a deck that connected both rooms. The maids were prompt and are beds and bathrooms were always cleaned and made up by the time we came back. They were so friendly that when we asked for extra lotion on our way to check out they gave us a handful. They said good morning and hello whenever we saw them. When it came to the shuttle that they offered (for free) he took us to the Zoo, Old Town, and even stopped along the way so my mother could get something at the convenient store. He new all the great places to eat and was always prompt and helpful. I cannot speak highly enough about this Hotel. My family and I cannot wait to come back. The service alone will keep me coming back for years. Thank you Handlery; you made our first trip to San Diego such a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “We wish we could have stayed longer to enjoy more of it.”
Reviews.Author: Otaking
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel to San Diego often to visit family, but a wedding mandated staying in a hotel for a change. As such, we were grossly unprepared for a last-minute booking in the tourism-rich San Diego area during peak summer season. We settled on the Handlery due to a special rate offered by Hotels.com. The hotel's architecture is reminiscent of a large "motor inn" from the late 50's or early 60's (it recalls the Vagabond motels of my childhood). The rooms are a little more compact than those of more modern hotels, but the Handlery has a trick up its sleeve - high ceilings that create the impression of more space. Even so, what the room may lack in space is more than compensated for by its appointments. The desk has an actual desk chair. The coffee condiments come in an open basket, not sealed plastic packages pre-measured by cheapskates who don't know how to enjoy coffee. The biggest surprise was that every time we turned on the flat-screen television, it went to the last channel we were watching, rather than a promo channel. How uniquely progressive! The design of the hotel may appear to be decades old, but recent renovations are obvious, including a modern, muted color palette with granite counter tops and medium gold wallpaper. Were I to find one nit to pick, the bathroom seems to be next in line for renovation. Although the shower curtain was lovely, the fixtures were a little dated, the tile could have used just a tad of re-grouting, and the ceiling showed a handful of paint flecks. I would be interested in seeing the bathrooms once they are renovated, as well. The hotel had some fun events planned by the pool, regrettably none of which we had time to attend. The first was open-air movies, the other was Sunday happy hour, complete with live band. These were free and open to the public, demonstrating the hotel's eagerness to be an inclusive part of its local community, rather than being exclusive. Booking in the middle of the summer season, we didn't have the luxury of getting one of those packages other reviewers have talked about that included continental breakfast. Be that as it may, travelers who choose this option to save money are truly missing out, not only because the continental breakfast is paltry, but because the regular breakfast served at the hotel restaurant is fantastic. In the interest of full disclosure, the Executive Sous Chef is a friend of ours, but in complete honesty, both our entrees were original and delicious. I had peanut butter and banana french toast for melt-in-my-mouth yumminess, while my wife had "La Revolucion", an amazing egg scramble with chorizo cooked inside hash browns (so each flavor infuses the other), and topped with sliced chili peppers. The entrees are comparable to what would be expected from a "higher caliber" hotel, yet the price is only about $10 each, so they are a bargain. All in all, the Handlery is not your typical hotel. It offers a pleasant decor, "why-didn't-I-think-of-that" accoutrements, and plenty of great experiences without leaving the property. My wife and I consider our initial taste intriguing, and the Handlery will certainly be at the top of our list of hotels to consider next time we need one in the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “So happy we chose this hotel - especially during crazy Comic Con weekend!”
Reviews.Author: SomSom129
Reviews.Content: We were attending Comic Con in SD and all available hotels were ridiculously priced for the weekend. The nightly rate was very reasonable considering all this, and I was in for such a pleasant surprise. ROOMS- were very clean, bathroom modern and clean and wow the shower was great - water pressure was high, what a nice bonus that was. Soap was lemony yum and shampoo was also pleasant. They had a dryer and iron as well. We had a balcony upgrade for free which was great. Mini fridge available but no microwave (boo). PARKING- plenty of spaces near our hotel room, but I think it's ridiculous to charge 12 per day for hotel guests. It would be better to just back it into the price instead of remembering to calculate into our expenditures. POOL- one of the nicest hotel pools I've seen. Not packed when we went, which was a surprise, and everyone should know that the pool itself is open to the public - so anyone can come in , park and enjoy this pool too. I don't think that's a well known fact due to the # of people I saw at the pool each day. Pool was large and L shaped, kids stayed mostly to the shallow part, and us adults enjoyed plenty of space in the deeper section. There is a whirlpool/hot tub there but since there were oodles of kids in there, my boyfriend and I didn't want to um, share with that. You should expect the whirlpool to be occupied at all times! Still, that was ok with us. Indoor bar onsite, served pretty decent food and just about all drinks. Pool closed at 10pm. On certain nights they show a movie poolside at 8pm. Great concept, expect since the pool closes at 10, you may have people - ok KIDS - splashing and screaming in the pool, and so unless you are like right up on the screen, may be hard to hear. Maybe someone should rethink the rules or set up a louder speaker system when they do movie night.. it was a nice experience for us except for the moments of noise, screaming, and occasional splash of water on us (really parents? you couldn't be just a little bit more considerate of us by asking your kids to keep it down a little or just not to splash us??
