Hello!) I think the hotel would get more people to watch movies if they restrategize this, thus making the set up and equipment worth it. STAFF- pleasant enough, no complaints here. WIFI - you have to pay $10 a day for WiFi. Really? Another gripe - so if you're driving in, and need to use your computer, tack on 22 buckaroos per day between parking and wifi fees. Since we stayed 5 days, that can really add up. Thankfully my phone allowed for mobile hotspot so we bypassed that, but it was a big pain. Nowadays nearly every place has free Wifi - we stopped at a Super 8 on our costal drive up to San Francisco and even they had free wifi! Come on - the parking and wifi may be enough to turn a lot of people away from this hotel, so I highly recommend rethinking this. My boyfriend couldn't stop complaining about the costs and I really wished the price was baked into the nightly rate so it didn't annoy me as much. Overall, the hotel was wonderful, easy to find, reasonable car ride from all major sights of beautiful San Diego. If I had to go back, I may not go back only b/c of the extra fees which I really feel are ridiculous for this hotel. As long as you're aware of this going in, you will definitely enjoy your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and fun property. Great pool.”
Reviews.Author: sunbunny31
Reviews.Content: The Handlery is an interesting property, in that it's low to the ground and somehow also multilevel. We checked in at the nice, cool lobby, and check in was swift and painless, with friendly staff. We were asked if we needed assistance with our bags, which we declined. Again, we took our own bags to our second floor room, and somehow five flights of stairs were involved., and no elevator in sight (I'm sure there's one somewhere). We were offered help, so no complaints, just an observation. We were given a poolside room, so we had a nice view of the large pool, and a small outside deck with a couple of chairs. The Handlery is apparently trying to be somewhat of a destination for locals as well as tourists, and they are providing a variety of entertainment. The night we arrived, there was live music and a band was setting up. The existing tables, chairs and chaise lounges were all taken, but additional chairs were brought out by staff, so someone was paying attention to the needs of the guests. Anyway, I did notice that the staff was totally on top of guest noise from the pool area and made sure that the pool shut down right on time. The room itself was quite well appointed and very comfortable. Again, in-room coffee (a virtual must for me) and a refrigerator were provided. The bathroom was large enough, with a shower/tub combination. We spent most of the evening poolside, and made a quick trip down to Old Town for some great Mexican food recommended to us by the really helpful and friendly security officer. The room was absolutely quiet and because of the non-linear lineup of rooms, we heard no other guests, so a great night's sleep was had by all. The next night's entertainment was a poolside, kid-friendly movie. We liked the property very much, and the fact that we had a fridge enabled us to pick up some things for breakfast so that the kids weren't starving first thing in the morning (no free breakfast, though they did have room service if you wanted). Now, my pet peeve rant: It seems that almost all properties in the Hotel Circle area charge a daily parking rate. I'm not sure why this is essential for paying guests, and it's something that is a personal issue for me. I find this particularly strange, however, in that Hotel Circle isn't in the city center, or next to one of the many attractions in San Diego. ...it's a bunch of hotels and conference centers and a golf course or two. So, why the parking fees? Are there really that many freeloading locals wanting to park their cars out in the middle of a bunch of hotels?

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel experience we have ever had!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JetSetter1435
Reviews.Content: The rooms were cozy, clean, comfortable and welcoming. The staff was so helpful, and the amenities were wonderful. My husband and I have traveled to many places but have never enjoyed our stay as much as we did here. We cannot wait to return and even try the San Francisco location.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Ask, Don't Tell”
Reviews.Author: nycgirlvegas77
Reviews.Content: The Handlery is more like an Inn that a Hotel Resort. We stayed there 3 nights for the recent Comic Con 2011. For the most part the room was clean, but more attention needs to be paid to the bathrooms. The corners of the floors had hair, which was gross. But, what really was bothersome to spite the hotels responses in other post, no one bother to mention the $12.00 a night parking, nor the $100.00 per night hold for incidentals. I have stayed in some of the most elegant hotels in Vegas that hold $100.00 per night for incidentals. This hotel does not come close to any of those hotels. I did not find out about the $12.00 until checkout. Also, when I requested a copy of my nightly charges upon check-in, I was told told I would not receive that until check-out, which I thought was odd, because every hotel I have stayed at has always provided me with a tentative receipt showing nightly room charge, tax, parking, etc., then I will receive a final bill upon check out. I will probably stay elsewhere during my next trip to San Diego, because I like it when my hotel discloses costs to me up front and as a courtesy should do so without one having to ask about common charges that will be attached to a bill upon checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for one night stay”
Reviews.Author: lluvia17
Reviews.Content: We arrived to this hotel monday July 18 around 11pm after a day in seaworld, we were really tired and hungry the check in was fast, i asked if there where any pizza hut close by, and there were any around but the lady at the front desk told me that theres a restaurant that delivers to their hotel 24/7 so we order pizza from them it was really good and the price too. The room is really small also the restroom, but at least they were clean, and the beds really comfortable i wished i could off stayed one more night to sleep in and to go to the pool. The location was nice close to seaworld. What we liked best was how comfortable the beds are and the rooms are really clean, The only bad thing is that tha A/C was really loud, and the pool is not to close to all the rooms, well only if u get a superior room,

Reviews.Title: “No Brainer... Will always stay here.”
Reviews.Author: dfahleson
Reviews.Content: The employees, facilities, events, activities and location are the perfect mix for a San Diego hotel.... short stay or week long vacation. Truly worth every penny. A great value.

Reviews.Title: “Visiting from Sweden and we will be back!!”
Reviews.Author: PK57
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two weeks at the Handlery Hotel in San Diego. The room we got at first was faced to the freeway, no problem if you want to stay for a day or two but we would be staying for 2 weeks. We asked if we could get another room and that wasn't any problem at all. The "new" room was good, clean and the beds comfortable. The pool areas is nice and the gym small but ok. Breakfast is not Swedish Style as we are used to but it was good. Staff serving breakfast is very friendly and especially Robert who gave us some good info on where to look and go in and around San Diego and Los Angeles! Th hotel is close to the freeway and gets You fast to different attractions nearby. All and all... We enjoyed our stay a lot and and can recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladyblue_11
Reviews.Content: Although my package to this hotel was supposed to include breakfast for myself and my child, the hotel refused to honour that. Their breakfast menu was overpriced and service very hit and miss. They also charge for everything you want to do - it cost me almost 30 dollars to access the computer a total of 3 times during the week in the business center. Parking is not free, nor are local calls from your room, wifi, etc. The location is good, the pool was lovely & there are many positive aspects to this hotel but I won't be back as I don't appreciate financial surprises & the unhelpful attitude of some of the staff is puzzling - the pool-side bar & food service was great so I am not sure where the disconnect is between that & the interior restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel - so warm and welcoming!”
Reviews.Author: schr0866
Reviews.Content: My mom and I visited San Diego for a girl's weekend, and absolutely loved it! The Handlery Hotel was wonderful, offering exceptional customer service and accommodations. Jeff, the shuttle driver, definitely made our trip personable and extremely enjoyable. Not only did he go above and beyond in customer service, but he also gave great recommendations for restaurants and attractions. Micheal, one of the daily customer service representatives, was also very helpful in advising on different restaurants and things to do in San Diego. The Handlery Hotel was a very clean, safe and friendly hotel; we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfy”
Reviews.Author: SInger60
Reviews.Content: I just got back from this hotel. Spent one night. I really like the people worked at the front desk. Very friendly and helpful. I was very happy about the price. It was amazingly worth it. My rate included a comfortable 2 beds clean room, 2 continental breakfast, tax and free parking for $87.75. I couldn't ask any thing better for the price. It was so easy to go to and from Sea World. One word of advise is print out the original contract. I took my contract with me and got my parking free because it was stated on my contract.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly what I tought.”
Reviews.Author: sirgeneral
Reviews.Content: After searching for a good place to stay in San Diego for couple months, I found this hotel. The hotel seems like a very good hotel to stay. The nitely rate was just rite for me and my family. We had a package that include free parking, internet and a continental breakfast. This hotel has no valet or bellman. The rooms is small and so is the bathroom. Also, the pool and fitness center. About the room, I had to call the maintenance person twice because the mini frig didn't work and the bathtub didn't drain at all. Next time I will try stay at another place.

Reviews.Title: “New Reef Lounge - so much fun!”
Reviews.Author: CarolineSiv
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got the chance to try the reef lounge yesterday with friends and had a fabulous time there! We were greeted by a very nice team and manager, I believe her name was Sandra, she showed us the way to the oasis, the reef lounge by the pool. Their new kitchen by the pool is just fantastic and the food is so tasty. We got to goof around while listening to Southern California beach rock reggae music. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Want to give it a good review, but...”
Reviews.Author: azizah04
Reviews.Content: The good stuff first, because I normally write all positive reviews - but I was disappointed (more on that later): -able to check in 2 hours early with no problems -staff was GREAT -pool is really large and one of best I've seen in terms of hotel pools -had free parking and free internet because of an online deal and had no problems with either of them - smooth and great bonuses. Normally parking is $12 per night and you have to pay for Wi-Fi. -centrally located, close to mall, easy access to freeway, really close to seaworld, downtown san diego, zoo, etc. -lots of towels provided, nice TV and room furniture The bad stuff: -something came out of the drain the first time we turned on the shower - it was like a large cockroach or something, about the size of an inch. it wouldn't go down either, had to keep putting extra hot water as it scurried around. Scared the bejezzus out of me and my son. -had some water dripping out of the air conditioning in the morning. We were in a hurry to get to legoland so I we just put the ice bucket under the leak and said we'd come back in the evening to report it but it stopped. The air conditioning is on the ceiling so it was dripping down to the carpet. Wonder how often it does that. -complimentary breakfast (also a part of the online deal) was a joke! I understand continental but it was kind of ridiculous, I've had so much better free breakfasts at other cheaper hotels. It consisted of some cut up fruit, yogurt, some croissants and apple pastries that were too small and hard, and I think you could order toast/a bagel. We had breakfast for 2 for 2 days and on the 2nd day we didn't even bother, we just went out for breakfast. Most likely we won't return - but I rated it average because it wasn't an awful stay and the positive stuff really was positive. As I said I like the location and the pool was awesome. If you can find a good deal and won't spend a lot of time there (to see the leaks and cockroach..lol), it might be worth it, but again I probably won't come back.

Reviews.Title: “would never stay there again, won't recommend it”
Reviews.Author: emteelb
Reviews.Content: Arrived early and preregistered. Hotel called me about 4o minutes later that room was ready. Able to check into room about 1:45 (vs. 3:00pm). Seemed like a good start. Room seemed ok at first. Starving, we went down to have lunch @2:15 at Postcards Bistro which according to the hotel's website is open for lunch 11AM - 3:00pm. We were told it was closed and did not open until 5:00pm. Staff suggested we go into the poolside bar. ON a Sunday afternoon they were having a "pool party" with a very LOUD band. The combination of the smell of freshly applied lacquer on the tacky surfer decor tables and benches and the horrible band that we found unbearably painful to listen to, we left. We asked for a shuttle ride to the San Diego Zoo to have lunch there and spend the rest of the day there. (shuttle is complimentary according to website). No problem except it was weird how the driver kept asking us our room number. Good thing we mentioned our husbands were back at the hotel. Then all seemed well until 9:00pm when the zoo closed because by the way - No shuttle. It stopped at 5:00pm "because they only had one driver". Hmmm, too bad for us I guess. So, out $20 for a cab ride back to the hotel. Approached exterior door with note to slide room key card for entry BUT door opened without it...so much for security. Decided to have balcony doors open for fresh air (paid upgrade for the balcony room). Door opened very wide but NO SCREEN to keep out any bugs! And staring right at us all the people at the hotel next door. Plus the rotted and termite eaten wood and peeling paint...another $20 out the window since we didn't use the balcony. Went down for some ice. On way back up bumped into my friend turning on the landing and she bumped the "railing" and it almost came off wall! OMG! What a joke! Shower - Ha!! I could stand in between the streams of water or stand directly under it with head against wall for the faucet like flow. In morning no pressure, toilet tank didn't even fill properly and we had to play around with it filling it with water using ice bucket. Before I forget, my friend was congested with sore throat and itchy eyes all night but we didn't know what was affecting her allergies...until the morning. On top of a couple of our items was a vast layer of dust which obviously was coming from the vents where the A/C came out as it went on and off all night. Clearly those ducts need cleaning. Needless to say we were VERY UNHAPPY with the experience at The Handlery in San Diego. Otherwise room was ok for cleanliness. Not very roomy. Not even a chair to sit in except a fancy desk chair which was the place for the big pillows that smelled like other people's heads. Overall we would NEVER consider staying there again and we will NEVER recommend it to anyone. It did not come anywhere near to meeting expectations. We were extremely disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “staff was nice butt the room and prices sucked!!!wont be back”
Reviews.Author: franko1981
Reviews.Content: i looked online a thought i got a good deal but i was wrong... the staff was nice no falt on them butt all the stuff you usually get with hotel suckkkkkkedddd. 1. no free internet $10 for the night 2. no free breakfast. 3. the room made noises all night a/c must of been broken or working poorly bc a huge bang would happen every 10 min we thought some one was breaking in 4. parking $12 a day not included ...i could of stayed at motel 6 for cheaper deal and free everything..wont be back at all read before you book with this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Check your fridge for last guest's leftovers--ewe!”
Reviews.Author: BohoMinnesota
Reviews.Content: We planned this trip as a celebration of my husband's 40th birthday and booked the Handlery through Expedia. The hotel overall is probably a good 20 years past its prime given the exterior aging, but they have done a nice job of updating the rooms and lobby to reflect a more casual elegant business traveler style. The check-in was great, and the front desk staff was wonderful and very helpful. I will even forgive them for recommending a clearly tourist trap restaurant our first evening (perhaps I should have been more specific and told her that I was not interested in a paper napkin-Americanized Mexican food restaurant where only the aged and those with young children go when they're on vacation.) Housekeeping services was another story. Our coffee was not replenished (one bag per day is never enough for folks like us) and the guest fridge in our room contained the remnants, God knows how old, of the leftovers of a previous guest. Overall I think the hotel is trying despite its obvious aging to appeal to family travelers and destination travelers, but compared to other hotels that I normally stay at (Marriott and Hiltons) I would rank this as a lower-run candidate for my next stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Expected better”
Reviews.Author: Phillbear
Reviews.Content: Just had a four night stay here. Very disappointed that pool area appears to be open to locals. As paying guests it is very disappointing to be unable to get a lounger around the pool whilst locals take all of the facilities. Had one meal in the restaurant which was only average. Thevworst experience was in the bar on Monday night. We had been out for the evening and returned to the hotel at 09:30pm. We went to the bar for a nightcap as it was advertised as open until 11:00. The lady behind the bar was quite hostile and told us at 10:15 that the bar was closing. There are no other bars nearby so that was the end of the evening for us. The bar should remain open until it's advertised closing time.

Reviews.Title: “We definitley will be back!”
Reviews.Author: DonnaPam
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and the rooms were immaculate. Very relaxing atmosphere. Free parking if you stay more than 3 days and free shuttle to area attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Poor location but nice resort”
Reviews.Author: Janine85
Reviews.Content: The resort was clean and staff helpful, food was expensive. On booking this hotel we read that the hotel shuttle bus took you back to the airport but when we asked they said no. So make sure you book a shuttle when booking holiday as cabs work out expensive ! Would highly recommend a tour around the Midway aircraft carrier, excellent! Value for money lasts about 2 hours. Also San Diego Zoo. We found it easy to get around using the blue and red line trains. Went to Mexico on day trip but was dissappointed az we were taken to a strip of shops for 3 hours !!

Reviews.Title: “Vaction at Work”
Reviews.Author: mzphd2008
Reviews.Content: I am so excited to share my love for this property. I was in San Diego the week of June 13-16th for a conference with a major assessment publishing company. The host hotel that the conference chose was completely unacceptable and I called home saying that if I could not find other accommodations, I would be flying back home. Thankfully the conference staff chose an overflow hotel which was the Heavenly Handlery Hotel. The rooms ~ Modern and Spacious The staff ~ Friendly, Knowledgeable, and Patient The location ~ The Perfect Distance to any and all attractions and the hotel has a free shuttle to mostly any place you want to go within reason. If I am "made: to come back to San Diego for work next year, I will be booking with the overflow hotel, Handlery. I guarantee there was NOTHING absolutely nothing second best or rate about this facility. Thanks Handlery, you have my business for now on!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with an exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: Dramagurl
Reviews.Content: We came to San Diego for our anniversary and tried to get a 4-star hotel on Priceline for under $100 and couldn't. We read such glowing reviews for The Handlery, a 3-star, and the pictures looked so amazing, we went for it. Stayed here 4 nights. It's an older hotel, and the room was pretty basic with a very small bathroom. It was exceptionally clean, the bed was very comfortable, with nice linens and we always had more towels than we needed (we usually have to ask for more towels). Every single staff member we met, from the front desk to the restaurant servers to the pool servers to the maintenance staff were EXCEPTIONALLY helpful and friendly. This may be a 3-star but it definitely has a 4-star attitude! It has one of the best pool areas I've seen at any hotel in the U.S. Manager Pete Lassalette and his staff are outstanding. I appreciated that many of the staff are "older"--some in their 60's, which many companies would be trying to get rid of and replace with younger, beautiful but often brainless & unfriendly people.

Reviews.Title: “The staff made the hotel”
Reviews.Author: KateW84
Reviews.Content: My sister and i stayed here for two nights. We came down from Los Angeles to visit the San Diego zoo before returning to New Zealand. The hotel was not what we expected from looking at their website, not in a bad way, just again not what we were expecting. The service was amazing! The reception staff could not be more helpful and the concierge who's name i have forgotten deserves a medal, as there are no elevators in the hotel and he was kind enough to help us with all 6 of our suitcases which were extremely heavy. He had a "good morning" for us each day we were there and was one of the most hard working people i have come across in all of my travels. The location for us was fine but i can see how it may be a problem if you want to see "downtown San Diego". The hotel is a little bit out from the central city, next to the freeway. We did not see any buses pass by but there was a shopping mall about 10-15 minutes walk away which had all the necessary shops, cafe's etc and a bus station. I must admit that the hotel was not what i was expecting, to me it seemed more like a motel but without the kitchen amenities. As i mentioned there are no elevators and there are three different blocks of rooms so there is a little walking and lifting involved, not good when you have 6 suitcases. The house keeping was exceptional and the rooms were spotless, however they were a little dated, our toilet lid in the bathroom had obviously broken and instead of replacing it they had reattached it with what looked like putty and superglue. The walls are also quite thin therefore we heard our next door neighbors talking and yelling for most of the second night both in their room and in the hallways. We had room service on the second night, it was delicious but by the time it arrived to us it was almost cold. It was also strange that i tried to order something from the menu and the women proceeded to tell me that it was no longer available. I thought they could have at least updated the in room menu. The breakfast each morning was really nice and again it was the waiters and waitresses who made it great, nothing was too much bother, however half of the breakfast seemed to be buffet and half was order, i.e you could go and get your own yogurt but had to order your toast which meant it took a little while. On the second morning we arrived at about 8, the dining hall was full so we had to sit in he lobby for about 5 minutes and by the time we were seated there was no yogurt etc left. We found the hotel perfectly fine for the two nights we were there but we would choose to stay closer to the city next time we are in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Janey1UnitedKingdom
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week in April with my best friend and our daughters aged 9 and 11. We had just spent a week in Newport Beach (Hyatt Regency - separate review) and came to what we thought was a centrally located hotel. We didnt pay a vast rate (Virgin holidays UK) so our expectations were not very high and it's a good job they were not. The hotel, I should say motel really, is located near a busy freeway and other cheap hotels/motels. If you choose to use public transport to get into downtown San DIego, should your timings be out it can take over an hour. A bus stops outside the front of the hotel which takes about 8 mins to the Old Town station where you can get on the trolley (tram) into San Diego - 7 stops to Seaport Village. The other alternative is walk the 10-15 mins to Fashion Valley Shoppng Mall where you can get the trolley to Old Town and change. All very tedious and time consuming. The buses only run every 30 mins and after 6 every hour and finish at 8. The staff at times did not know the timings and gave me incorrect information so it took my daughter and I 1 hour 15 mins to get into San Diego. We were very disappointed with the rooms. It had 2 double beds that just about fitted into the room and a tiny bathroom, and very little storage for clothes. There was no safe in the room and no conditioner in the bathroom. We had just spent a week quite easily in a room with the four of us. We couldn't here. We had to pay for an extra room for the week. The only plus was we had a terrace, most rooms did not. Car parking was included in my rate. The pool area was reasonable but lacked sun loungers. I think I counted about 20. If we wanted a drink we had to go to the inside bar to get them. We tried the continental breakfast as it was included in the rate. Little choice of croissants, yoghurt and cereal. You can ask for toast. No ham or cheese. Slow service. We did eat the first night in the bar and this was typical bar food - burgers, sandwiches, fish and chips which was ok. That night Daniel served us and he was the only member of staff who was really helpful. The hotel has a free shuttle bus you can book to go to the zoo or Seaworld in. We used it to the zoo but it only runs during the day so we left without having done the zoo justice. We took the car to Seaworld!! I needed to get somthing from a shop on the way back but the driver would not stop so my daughter and I had to walk the long way round to the shop which although is located just over the freeway, you can't cross it. The bar closed really early - 9.30pm one night so after arriving back at 9.45pm on the Monday and wishing a night cap we couldn't have one. A bar that closes so early in an establishment that calls itself a hotel and resort is ridiculous. Towards the weekend it seemed to stay open longer - 10.30 ish but often no barman was present and 1 night I waited 10 mins until someone could be located to serve me!! We all loved California and can't wait to cross the pond to come back but I certainly won't be staying here again. It's too far out, has too much of a motel feel to it, small rooms that just about accommodate 2 and services that are not available for enough hours in the day

Reviews.Title: “We were treated like royalty on our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: danceswithjack
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd stay at the Handlery. You can't beat the LOCATION!! Not to mention the affordable rates! We were there on our honeymoon and were so impressed with the friendly staff and gorgeous room and grounds. They even went as far to bring us champagne after we checked in! The hotel recently went through a major remodel. Everything is new and clean. We enjoyed the ipod dock radio, mini fridge, and spacious balcony. The pool and hot tub area is so tranquil and relaxing. For being so close to the highway you really can't hear it and we loved the close proximity to Old Town, Balboa Park, Maritime museum, Gaslamp district, Seaport Village, Sea World, and all the other great attractions San Diego has to offer! We felt very comfortable and safe and I would highly recommend this hotel and will return the next time we are in san Diego. This hotel is also family friendly and has a very impressive breakfast buffet. Don't waste your money anywhere else.... Handlery Hotel and Resort has it all!

Reviews.Title: “The Dream Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Teacher_32
Reviews.Content: Hello fellow travelers: My husband and I stayed at this hotel. It was in-between low-priced and a little pricey. It was the best hotel that we ever stayed at! The staff was wonderful. The free breakfast was delicious. The room, pool, and spa were delightful. The plants were also lovely. All the positive adjectives can be used to describe this hotel. On the last day, I lost my glasses by the spa. The staff, my husband, and I searched for it. Mr. Rick, the kindest pool cleaner, found them, and returned them to me. He jokingly told me that some guests had left behind items such as ipods. PS, this is the only hotel that I have been to that offers guests free tooth brushes. San Diego was great to visit. Imperial Beach looked like it was made of diamonds, and the ocean was made of pearls and sapphires. Some people took their dogs out for walks. The air was between warm, cool, and chilly. There were flowers and trees that I had never seen before. Balboa Park had stunning and artistic buildings to view. The Museum of Man, although it was small and had a few exhibits, contained evidence of the existence of Nefertiti and her family. The Zoo had many creatures, some familiar, some unfamiliar. It had an adoreable black puma or panther that talked a lot. The Cheese Factory and Bchans had tasty food. But, my husband and I never got to eat at these places. These restaurants were packed with people who were dressed like if they were going to a ritsy nightclub. Some people camped out in front of the restaurants. Joes Crab Shack, Chipotles, and Dave/Busters treated us better, had better food, didn't make us wait all day, etc. Most people were nice. There were a few rude ones. At the Cheese Factory, a kid kicked me, and his mother didn't correct him for it. On the roads, a few road hogs cut us off. At a burger joint at Balboa Park, the staff cooked me a tasty cheeseburger, but mostly ignored me, and a few other customers. Every city will contain its good and and bad aspects. Nevertheless, San Diego was awesome. I still dream, hear, and read about it. TripAdvisor assisted us greatly with planning this trip. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: XimeD
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located on Mission Valley, in walking distance of Fashion Valley mall, not far in bus or trolley from major attractions in San Diego The hotel is really really really charming, although at first you have to look at the map a few times (first time I got lost lol).... the rooms have everything to make your stay the best experience... beds are so comfy, flat screen TV, balcony, a desk if you have to do some work too. Customer service is great, they all make you feel at home. Swimming pool is awesome and the bartender passes by offering you something to drink. I loved everything about this hotel, if you have a light sleep, I would recommend you bring some ear plugs with you because walls are rather thin... in my case I hibernate so I did not find my neighbors' noise much of a problem. Even though I was on a solo trip, this is a great place to go with your family.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Resort more like a Motel!”
Reviews.Author: Zz281
Reviews.Content: The pictures are very deceiving. This is a Oversized Motel nothing more. I regret trying to save a buck cause you get what you pay for thats for sure. The breakfast "Buffet" sucks and their restaurant staff SUCKS. They did not ask us what we wanted but did stop to put a bill on my table that later i told the waiter he can ... cause i shouldnt be charged $5.00 for a tiny muffin. I stayed 2 nites only because i booked it and paid for it prior to my arrival. Its an old run down Motel i dont know why certain websites that review Hotels allow them to advertise as a Resort i consider that false advertisment????

Reviews.Title: “rip off”
Reviews.Author: emzolita
Reviews.Content: not worth the money, in fairness we were't looking for a golfing holiday just to stay here for 3 nights until we got settled into sandiego and found out where we wanted to stay, but i was shocked when i realised that although we were staying in the hotel we had to pay 12dollars a night for the carpark(because they had a carpark attendant), and then we had to agree that the hotel would not be held responsible for anything? I thought that was a bit odd. the rooms are ok, a bit tired looking, and it's a drive away from beaches etc. not worth the money tbh.

Reviews.Title: “friendly, clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: nakdan
Reviews.Content: I had heard of the Handlery hotels since there is one in San Francisco. It is close to Balboa Park and within a few minutes of Old Town. The room was a nice size with a very comfortable bed and large screen TV. The room was kept very clean while I was there and the staff was friendly. A good continental breakfast is included and the parking was free. And the price was under $100. I like quiet and asked to stay in one of the wings of the hotel where the traffic noise can not be heard. This hotel is a good choice for a vacation hangout.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: larmac
Reviews.Content: i was lucky enough to get an exceptional rate for this hotel on line but barring that i would have paid more to stay there. the staff were outstanding and helpful we purchased tickets from the front desk and somehow misplaced them the driver waited for us and then actually came back to pick us us so they didn't keep everyone waiting, he was very helpful and gave us discount cards for a wonderful resturant down the road. we misplaced our zoo tickets and the front desk went out of there way to replace them n/c they have an awesome pool a ticket center where we bought baseball tickets, also there lounge staff were freindly and very nice a pleasure talking with them rooms were roomy and comfortable, I will not hesitate to stay there again, also close to town and shopping which my wife appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Handlery Hotel just made our staying that PERFECT!!!”
Reviews.Author: UltraVV
Reviews.Content: Me and my bf decided to go to San Diego for it's world famous Zoo and seaworld to celebrate my birthday, and it is actually my first time travelling down to the States. We stayed at the Handlery Hote for 7 days. I have to say, the Handlery and its staff really made my first trip to the US that perfect. We loved San Diego, such a beautiful city, Thank you guys! We chose this hotel for it's promotion. The price was unbeatable. I knlew it was an old family hotel so I thought it would be dark or smelly, but when we got there, I was surprised by how clean it is. It is recently renovated. I loved the carpet and that fresh scent. I'm a light sleeper so I requested a quiet room, we got one at the end of the hall far away from the Highway side, with a balcony too. Very quiet, good nights of sleep gave us the energy for long walkings at daytime. And just like all the other comments, the bed was really that comfortable!! I'm very picky about beds but I miss the Handlery bed now! When we get up in the morning, have our breakfast, the Hotel has a shuttle to drive us to the Zoo, Seaworld, Old Town, Fashion Valley and etc. It saved me a lot of money for taxi. I really have to mention the shuttle driver Jeff, he was the nicest guy there and gave us so much help. We went to all the restaurants that he recommanded and we loved them all! One afternoon when we came back, we even received a little gift of treats from Jeff and the front desk staff, how sweet!! (The next day was my birthday so it made me so happy :D) I saw that some people were complaining about there is nothing on Hotel circle except hotels, but you can always walk to Fashion Valley, it's a big mall. We took public transportation everyday, it is very easy. Usually we go out in the morning with the shuttle and take either 120 back from Downtown or the Trolley. Front desk staff was very friendly and helpful, specially the Concierge, sorry I forgot his name but he helped us with our trips a lot! The pool was so nice, and the Hottub. After a long day of walking in the Zoo and parks, it feels so great to relax in a huge outdoor hottub. I went to Cancun last year and we stayed in a Luxury 4.5 star hotel, but quite honestly, the staying at Handlery is actually happier than that one. I liked the warm "family" feeling it gives me. Everyday when we take the bus back to the hotel, I feel like I'm going home :) For those who were complaining about there is too little choices in breakfast, maybe they didn't know they can order Toast, Cereal or Oakmeal from the kitchen, it is included. No one told us that until the 4th day of our staying, lol. There is one Mexican looking waiter, he was very nice and helpful. The other waiter, however, looked at me as if I was stealing when I ordered one more toast in the morning :S. We didn't have a car but the parking seems very convenient, having a car for this city is a wise choice. Wifi was not bad, last time we stayed at Cancun, my bf lost his wallet in the hotel :(. So this time I was kind of worried about bringing my laptop. End up I worried too much, lol, the room service ladies are very nice and professional. Everyday when we get back, everything is cleaned and new shampoo lotions are stocked. Thank you ladies~ I wrote so much, but trust me, you can stay at this place and enjoy your vacation with such a low price. I travel around all the time and I will go back to Handlery Hotel. We got the service way more than what we paid for. Thank you Handlery Hotel and all staff!

Reviews.Title: “Renewed soul and great down time”
Reviews.Author: tx77dreamer
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and helpful. Jeff, the shuttle driver, was a great conversationalist and really added to the good vibe of our trip. Amber and various other front desk staff were very genuine and easy to talk to. The Handlery offers an old school feel and a very clean environment. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, good service...just don't order room service!”
Reviews.Author: whoser69
Reviews.Content: We staed at the Handlery Hotel to Visit San Diego before going on a cruise to Vancouver. A good hotel for the money, we had a second level level room, breakfast included. Here are the highlights and lowlights: Checkin on Sunday was fast and professional, we wanted to see the Zoo for sure but the shuttle service to the Zoo was full for both days we were visiting. The agent (Erin, I think) offered to comp for a taxi to the Zoo and was going to call our room to confirm but we did not hear back so I was a bit worried, but everything worked out and we did get a cab to the Zoo. The shuttle service for the Trolley Tours also stops right outside the Hotel. Breakfast was good, service was attentive and fast, lots of screaming kids so beware, continental with cereal or oatmeal, which is what we expected. The room was clean, a bit dated, good bed. We used the hot tub only, good temperature. Room service....ugh. We had been shopping at the nearby mall and since no restaurants were within walking distance we ordered room service. The hamburger was $18 so got one to share, when it got to our room 30 mins later it was cold and had no flavor and the fries we cold and soggy, very disappointing. When we told the front desk at checkout they apologized but did nothing further. We enjoyed our stay in San Diego and would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel,location,food and customer service!!!”
Reviews.Author: lambo4
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights at the Handlery Hotel the room was fantastic the pool stunning and the breakfast great. The staff we so incredibly helpful, we would stay at this hotel again without a doubt!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value.”
Reviews.Author: JDBuchanan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to San Diego with our one year old daughter, and found this hotel and resort to be a great value. The Fairway Suite was clean, comfortable, spacious, and directly next to the pool -- a great room. Service at the front desk and the bell desk were great. Parking was convenient. Breakfast was added to our rate at no additional charge. A great experience that I would recommend to fellow travellers. The only negatives of the accomodations were 1) a slightly creaky floor -- with the folks in the room above moving around both late at night and early in the morning and 2) a relatively disorganized waiting area for breakfast. Neither of these, however, diminished the value of our stay. Will definitely return to this location in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Average room no issues needs facelift”
Reviews.Author: joannelucy85
Reviews.Content: Pretty standard stay, booked premier room, looked no different to basic room, staff friendly and helpful, short wall to bus and Reilly stop to downtown SD. Pool and tub clean. Overall average value, age of rooms let's it down.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, restful spot”
Reviews.Author: SomervilleReisender
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four days for a business trip. Like many CA buildings, the hotel is laid out with some outdoor walkways between buildings that house the guest rooms. The room was spacious and well appointed. The pool area is beautiful and a relaxing hangout in the evening. The exercise room was small - just four machines in a small room. Location was fine - just a few minutes' walk to bus stop or trolley stop and you can get most everywhere in the city. Breakfast buffet was included in the room cost, but the selection was limited and the same every day. All in all, though, for a mid range hotel, this was quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: MossbackCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We attended a 100th Birthday celebration held here. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. Restaurant and bar are more than adequate and the continental breakfast is good. Rooms for events are most attractive as are the grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Request room 234 in Del Mar if you want space.”
Reviews.Author: sugarsprinkle02
Reviews.Content: 4 adults 1 child under 2 We stayed in room 234 in the Del Mar building for 4 nights. When I read the reviews about the hotel on this site I was truly expecting a TINY room. I thought for sure we would have to get another room. I was pleasantly surprised when we walked into the room and found it to be quite large. We had 6 (large) suitcases, and 3 carry-ons and still had plenty of room. We even had a roll away bed in there. When I walked down the hall to get ice I looked into a room that the housekeepers were cleaning and it was TINY. We obviously lucked out and got one of the bigger sized rooms. There is no way all 5 of us would have fit into the tiny room that I looked at. Having seen that, I understood where people were coming from that said this hotel was too small for them on this website. Cons: The beds are definitely doubles as the website states. They are not queens. My husband and I are used to sleeping in a king at home, so we really didn't sleep all that comfortably. Also, the beds are not the best I have slept in, but I have slept in much much worse. They won't give you a roll away bed unless you are sleeping in a room with a king size bed. We asked the front desk for one and the housekeepers and both said no. We broke the rules and found a clean one and put it in our room so no one had to sleep on the floor. They do offer cribs for babies, but we had a 2 year old with us. There is no way he was fitting in a crib. I would imagine that if we were staying in one of the tiny rooms the cot would not have fit anyway....so again, we lucked out with the room. The whole breakfast scene was weird. The waiter we had was rude and not helpful whatsoever.The restaurant was not even busy. It was a weekday and there were 4 other people in there with us. When we sat down he didn't even come to our table for the first 5 minutes we were there. Then he came and asked what we wanted to drink. Someone else brought us out our drinks and after that no one came by again. They all stayed in the back by the kitchen. We had the continental breakfast cards and had no idea how to use them. We literally sat there for 10 min until I finally got up and asked the hostess what we were supposed to do. She was nice and told us where the "buffet" was. It is quite far from the table and behind a wall, which is odd. I'm still not really sure what comes with your breakfast. They do not offer you toast, or a bagel or cereal (which apparently comes with your meal) you have to ask. So half of the breakfast is buffet style, the other half you have to ask your waiter for. The fresh fruit was nice, but the pastries were mediocre at best. The wait staff (especially the male the helped us, Jose maybe?) could use a course on customer service and more training. They need more ice machines. The closest ice machine was on the other end of the long hall, and down the stairs. There is no fan in the bathroom. It stayed humid in there for hours after we all got done showering. The water pressure was terrible. But expected since it was built in the 1950's. No elevators. As I said we had 6 bags, plus a child and carry-ons so it would have been helpful to have an elevator. The business center is where the internet is. It is NOT free, and it was quite expensive. We did not check in online for our flight because of this. We figured it would cost us at least $9 to print off our tickets. Not worth it. This should be a free amenity. Pros: Our room was at the end of the hall way so we only had one neighbor. It was pretty quiet. We did not hear traffic like past guests have said on the site. Luckily our window was facing the pool, not the road. The walls are very thin and I can see how annoying it would be to have neighbors on both sides of you while hearing traffic outside the window. The Bellhop was very helpful and knowledgeable. He gave us addresses and directions to places that we wanted to go. Also, when we checked out we still had 7 hours before our flight so he took our baggage and held it there for us until we came and got it. Worked out very well for us. The front desk staff was nice and helpful as well. The pool was very nice and clean. I have noticed that sometimes when hotels post pictures of their facilities on the internet, they look nothing like the pictures when you actually show up. This is not the case for the handlery. The pool area was very nice and well kept. The rooms were clean. I'm weird about germs and carpets, but I did not have a problem here. Very clean. The staff around the facility (housekeepers, security, etc) were friendly and always said hi when we walked by. The housekeepers were more than willing to give us towels or whatever we needed. Overall it was a very good experience. I would go back again, but only if I got the same room. I cannot imagine cramming 5 people into one of those small rooms. Unbearable. We went through bookit.com and got a good rate. $78/night. Remember that you are not staying at the Ritz. If you want something extraordinary and elegant, this is not your spot. If you're looking for a place to sleep, hold your luggage, and swim...this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of like a classic car - You can appreciate it, even with its quirks”
Reviews.Author: Falcarragh13
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I would absolutely stay at this hotel again if I were in San Diego. However, I can see why the ratings here are extreme. This is a place you'll either love or hate. The rooms are tiny, but really nicely done. There were four of us - two adults, a 15 year old girl and a 13 year old boy in a room with two doubles, and we were there for four nights (the first two nights my daughter was in a different hotel with a group). There was not a shred of floor space. However, the beds were extremely comfortable and the room was spotless (my wife didn't even give my daughter grief about sitting on the floor while my son was in the shower after we got out of the hot tub one night, and she is usually a bit of a freak about hotel room floors). My wife and daughter did complain that the hair dryer in the room was the worst of any hotel they have stayed in, and it also caused a fuse to blow (which was corrected within minutes). After having read the reviews about the breakfast, I was prepared for the worst. I don't know if it was because our expectations were so low, we were all really happy with it - specifically the fruit - honeydew, cantaloupe, watermelon, pineapple and strawberries. Fresh and non-stop. Saturday morning around 9:00 am, the place was a zoo. We sat in the lounge area. I would guess there were 100 others at the same time. The people working there were moving constantly to keep the fresh fruit coming. The breads/pastries were good, but the fruit was great. They do give you the breakfast coupons at check in. And, they do take their coupons seriously - I think a little too seriously. They have a "choose ONE of the following" with the ONE in caps, bolded and underlined - breads, pastries or cereal. Again, having read the reviews, I was afraid the breakfast police might say they saw the remnants of a danish on might plate while I was biting a croissant. They didn't. But, my suggestion to them would be to lose the SCREAMING "ONE," and just make it a free continental breakfast - what's there is there. The location, whether it's this hotel or any of the other hotels on Hotel Circle, was outstanding. Yes, you do have to get in the car to go anywhere. However, you are not in the car for more than a few minutes to any of the main areas. The zoo and Balboa Park is a few minutes. Downtown, Horton Plaza, The Midway Museum, a couple of minutes further. Sea World, a few minute in a different direction. La Jolla, about 15 minutes. Finally, the staff. The previous review praised the hostess in the breakfast area. I think with the volume of people that was there, she may have been getting frustrated when we dealt with her. She was fine with us, but getting short with a woman who did not understand English all that well, raising her voice and telling her to go get a box for takeout. Other than that, the staff was exceptional. Arriving at 1:00 am after a long flight, I did not want to see the pool, but the front desk clerk was that proud of the facilities, he wanted to show me it quickly. And, while the breakfast staff may have been running ragged, they really kept a great attitude. Prior to the economy going south in 2007, we would typically stay at high end hotels - the Ritz Carlton, JW Marriotts. We had to get real with our money and have been mostly Hyatt Place, Fairfields, Courtyards since. This is clearly no Ritz, and it is not nearly as predictable as the chains. But, it's clean, comfortable, the staff is great, and it has a California quirkiness that I would go back to on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, but . . .”
Reviews.Author: razziProsser
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Handlery with my two grown daughters and a four-year-old granddaughter. The front desk staff were very busy but friendly. They took the time to help/answer questions in a respectful manner. The gal that is hostess to Postcards was ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!!! She needs a big pat on the back and a raise. The hotel rooms are, indeed, small, but certainly comfortable. It is noisy; however, I'm not sure that the hotel can bear the brunt of disrespectful hotel guests. Quiet after 10:00 should be a guest's responsibility. My only complaint was a certain waiter (Jose M., I believe). Seems to me that there are many other people looking for a good job that could replace him. He was most disrespectful, particularly to my disabled daughter. Thankfully, another person working in the restaurant (manager?) politely attended to her. The way the "complimentary breakfast coupons" are handled could be more polite. When the waiter rudely asks, "Do you have coupons?" before they even greet you politely, there is a problem. This, again, was an issue with abovementioned waiter. He was absolutely terrible. Other waiters were very polite, helpful, and busy!! I would return again; hopefully rude waiter has another job.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend the Handlery!”
Reviews.Author: MelissaSchut
Reviews.Content: My husband, child and niece stayed in a 2-room suite for 5 nights. Amanda, at the front desk, had assisted me with my reservation, and I am so glad we "sprang" for the suite! Our rooms were quiet, clean, comfortable. The wrap-around balcony with lounge chairs was a delight! Every member of staff that we encountered--housekeeping, front desk, maintenance men--were very friendly and seemed sincerely pleased that we were there. (altho, the wait for breakfast each morning was a downer) The Handlery was our home-away-from home and made our stay in San Diego all that much better. When we return to San Diego, we will definitely stay at the Handlery again!

Reviews.Title: “Humiliating experience but at least the pool was nice.”
Reviews.Author: SDLisa74
Reviews.Content: This is not a good place for groups first off. The staff is very unfreindly, not accomodating and the walls are very thin. The air conditioner did not work either. The food was pretty good but the only redeaming quality was the pool. There are much better places for the price!!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: samSanClemente
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at many hotels, some luxury some not. The Handlery Hotel in San Diego was great! We were unsure as we arrived, because the layout of the hotel seemed dated, but the rooms were remodeled, the furniture new and the bedding was glorious! We encountered a few minor problems with our room and they were fixed immediately. The staff was extremely courteous and helpful. The service we received throughout our stay was equal to that of a five star hotel. Even at breakfast the service was exceptional. We would most definitely choose the Handlery again.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, over priced”
Reviews.Author: sassysheri
Reviews.Content: The standard room is very small. There were 4 of us staying in the room, which they charge an additiona $10 per nightl for each person over 2. We had no room once we got our bags in the room. The wall were so thin that you could hear people coming and going all night long and that was not only in the hall but outside. No shuttle from the airport, but they do have a shuttle to some attractions. There was black mold growing in corner of the bathroom ceiling, they have no fans in the bathroom so it is not suprising. There is only a bath room, no additional area to prepare. RETHINK YOUR STAY, unless you get an excellent price.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place - but noisy from other rooms because of thin walls”
Reviews.Author: LeesSummitCruiser
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful and clean place to stay. However, don’t spend the extra money for a balcony if you think you will get a room with a view – you might not. The room walls were wallpapered concrete or brick so we heard one neighbor coughing all the time and the other side played their TV louder than ours. It was noisy. Breakfast was ok, but who wants to spend 20 minutes waiting for a 6 oz drink? We seemed to be invisible to the hotel staff. They do have a business center where you can print off your airplane boarding pass. I would not stay here again because of the noise in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Decent older hotel”
Reviews.Author: atraveller57
Reviews.Content: I was comfortable in this hotel. It is older and I did request a quiet room close to the golf course and it was perfect. It was clean and the bed was comfortable. Would recommend. Used before a cruise. It was a $20 taxi ride but booked the shuttle from the airport to hotel and that was $9 with a discount.

Reviews.Title: “So gross!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tash1193
Reviews.Content: I decided to book this hotel in advance due to the great reviews that most people leave and the overall rating.. Plus the price I figured I couldn't beat it. When we arrived, check in was the usual but then when we went to our room on the first floor it had a complete Motel Feel. I was worried about this before we even got there, but it felt cheap and dirty. We dropped off our luggage and ventured out to get some dinner. When we returned I just didn't feel comfortable enough with my two year old getting on the beds and floors so I unpacked my emergency sheet sets. When I pulled back one of the covers, I found BODILY fluids on the comforter. I completely freaked out and had my husband go ask for a refund and packed up our things. Refund or not I was not staying there. They did end up giving us our money back but we went down to the Comfort Inn and Suites at like 11 at night, and was pleasantly surprised of how much better that hotel was. We ended up staying there the entire week, and it was cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, but loud”
Reviews.Author: pindey
Reviews.Content: Overall polite staff, nice pool facilities, and common areas, however the noise is relentless in the room. If you happen to be in a room next to small children you are in for a long night and a very early morning. we were up every day at 530 to the sounds of mother and crying child. As mentioned by others you can hear everything. But if you can stay asleep it is a nice place, with polite staff and nice facilites

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kateinater
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Handlery for 4 nights, 4 very comfortable nights! We are missing the comfort of our Handlery bed. We usually get home and are thankful to be in our own bed, but not this time! We took advantage of the shuttle to Sea World and the Zoo. It is fantastic! We even called and asked to be picked up early one day and the shuttle was there in about 10 minutes. The shuttle driver is a very nice man. The hotel area is great, only a short walk to a mall and a train. We spent one day riding the train to different areas: seaport village, gaslamp district, and it cost $5 for an all day ticket. The train was very easy and convenient to use. The front desk gave us a map of the train routes. I had read some bad reviews about the free breakfast, but we loved it. The breakfast ticket cards make it seem like you can only pick one item on the card but this is not true. We had delicious fruit every morning, strawberries, and melons. There was yogurt and muffins and you could ask for toast, bagels, english muffins, cereal, and oatmeal. They left a pitcher of coffee on the table for you to help yourself and it was very good coffee. We always looked forward to breakfast. All the staff at the hotel were very friendly, I felt like every time I passed anyone I was greeted with a smile. The people at the front desk helped us out multiple times. Our room was always very clean. The maintenence man helped us one day with our balcony door. He was there in about 5 minutes and fixed the problem very quickly. Very nice man. We had a balcony in our room, which I highly recomend. It does not cost much more and it is so nice to have fresh air and a nice place to sit. The hotel restuarant was a little pricey for us (i'm sure it compares with surrounding area prices) so we ate elsewhere. I highly recomend the spaghetti factory in the gaslamp district, really good food and prices! We did have the restuarant pizza one night and it was delicious! I was surprised when we checked out that we had a water fee. I just didn't realize that it cost something, if it had a little tag on it with a price I would have known. I was pleasently surprised with how quiet it was at night. I normally am awoken a lot when I stay somewhere, but it was very quiet here. Maybe we just got lucky with our neighbors, but it allowed me to get a nice nights rest on my wonderful bed! All in all it is a great hotel and I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “nice/clean food/drink to expensive”
Reviews.Author: cigarjim
Reviews.Content: good location/had good easy commute to all attractions.All food and beverage was over priced!

Reviews.Title: “a perfect 10 all around”
Reviews.Author: TimoLV
Reviews.Content: What makes this Hotel a perfect 10 is that it is a great value, clean facilities and no extra fees. What you pay for is what you get and then some. The rooms have been recently renovated and the Facilities are well taken care of. The building itself is old as are most in San Diego, but you would never know it. The location is convenient to basically everything, a rental car office on site if you need that. The front desk and other staff were very friendly and seemed to enjoy their jobs which makes a big difference. You can tell the company values its employees, ultimately reflecting on the end result. There have been some negative reviews about the free breakfast but I would disagree, they have fresh fruit, bagels, toast, cerial, muffins, pastries, yogurt, and excellent coffee. I think that is more than enough to please most every one. I really enjoyed my 3 nights there and I will be back soon, this time I will go for one of the rooms with a pool-side patio.

Reviews.Title: “suited more for business not families”
Reviews.Author: klyn79
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 2 children for 3 nights, it was our 2nd stop on a California holiday. I would say this hotel is better suited for business trips rather than families (dont rely on a travel agent to book your hotel :))There isnt a lot close by, the nearest shopping centre is a good 10 minute walk and even there they didnt have a lot of dining options, and as nice as the resturant in the hotel was, it does get pricey eating there for lunch and dinner every night. The first day we got there we were able to check-in early which was great, however as soon as my son got to the room and used the toilet it was blocked and overflowed onto the floor. Informed the front desk, went on a tour and by the time we got back it was fixed HOWEVER the toilet water was still all over the floor! I dont know if im asking too much here but I would have expected it to be mopped up especially since we had JUST walked in and had not even unpacked yet.. We used the towels to soak it up and just let it be. Again the next day the toilet blocked, rang front desk, someone came to fix it within 15 minutes, had no other problem after that. the staff were polite enough but sometimes when I had a question to ask it felt as if they didnt really have the time for me and that I was holding them up. On the other hand the maids were OUTSTANDING, they were lovely and always had a smile and/or a hello for me. Overall its a comfortable hotel, clean and secure and i would recommened it for business travellers, I just dont think I personally would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great people,great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: brenrowe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at The Handlery for the first time, and I can assure you it won't be the last! The Hotel Staff were professional, helpful and friendly. Everyone we encountered seemed to enjoy their job and it showed! The Hotel itself was very nice! Very clean and modern and just a good place to "hang out". We had room service and the food was amazing. The service was great as well. Breakfast was quite good and being so close to everything we wanted to do made our stay that much better! Can't wait to come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay. Great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Kitespre
Reviews.Content: Stayed for business. The hotel was very busy with a convention. I never felt like a number. Registration ladies were very nice. Ryan the concierge was very helpful with directions I needed. It was raining and he helped me to my car with his umbrella. I will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Like a Jail!”
Reviews.Author: Ularu
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel a couple of months before arriving and what a shock! It was nothing like the pictures or discription, the standard rooms are set up in jail like wings, depressing, small ,beige in color and nature! Noisey air cond & to top it off miles from San Diego surrounded by other dodgy looking hotels just off a freeway. Tried to cancel a second day of a 2 day booking but because it was past 12 midday they would not accept my cancelation for the second day! BEWARE the $12 parking and $10 internet! I'm taking the loss on the second day and booking a hotel in the center of San Diego. Get me out of here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place! We will definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Artanis1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were there for two nights and everything was great. The location was very convenient to everything. Another reviewer mentioned that it was too far from downtown, and to that I can only say - Buy a map next time before you book a room :) The staff was friendly and helpful, the room was nicely decorated, clean, comfortable and overlooked the swimming pool. Perfect for us! The restaurant exceeded my expectations. Our meal was just outstanding and the menu was well chosen, creative and had a great variety! The bar didn't carry my favorite whiskey Ri1, but then again not many places do :( I would recommend this hotel and resort highly. We'll be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, super friendly, felt right at home!”
Reviews.Author: emthetraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at this cute place. Rooms were clean and comfortable, location convenient to everything. Restaurant was excellent, wonderful food, exceptional service, creative menu. Can't wait to go back!! A real find!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but lacking”
Reviews.Author: NewLew
Reviews.Content: My stay in this hotel was not memorable. First my room was OK, but there was no regrigerator for my medicin, I am a diabetic. I had to keep it on ice in the ice bucket for two days. No microwave, so the $16.00 breakfast leftovers went to waste. Shame. It was a good breakfast. You continnetal breakfast was mediocre at best. Though the fruit was fresh and ripe, the breads and pastries were lacking. This is old school continnental breakfast. Today you usually get more, like waffles or something. I have to admit the bed was awesome. Best night out sleep I have ever had. TV? Eh. Low quality channel lineup and picture. Overall, I would say that for the price, it was OK. I have gotten more for less, which of course is the bottom line.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay.”
Reviews.Author: shona&terry
Reviews.Content: Just home from a fantastic 10 day stay at The Handlery. i dont understand the negative reviews left on here for this hotel every time we stay here it just gets better and better. All the renovations are finished and the rooms are beautiful. Spotlessly clean and very comfortable beds. We had a pool view room and were delighted with it. The staff are wonderfull too many to name but especially, Matthew, Dan, Jose and Fermen. They go out of thier way to help and make yor stay enjoyable. A huge thank you again to Michael who reserved all this for us again......Thank you Mike we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more from this "quality star" hotel..”
Reviews.Author: marynafromSA
Reviews.Content: Too far from the centre(downtown) and had to take a taxi to a lot of the places we needed to go. Their shuttle would take us to "most" of the attractions but not to the local UPS store or even to the mall. Their complimentary breakfast was a major dissapointment compared to the other hotels we stayed in. Would have expected a lot more for the price we paid ...Staff was very helpful and the atmosphere was nice....we were situated opposite the exit door of our floor and everytime you would go to the bathroom the outer door would click open... very irritating and the door seemed not to be sound proof...could hear the noise in the passage!

Reviews.Title: “We had a very memorable stay and all for the right reasons”
Reviews.Author: ronmask
Reviews.Content: The staff where exceptional, alwasy pleasant, always smiling and offering assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Their response to one small problem was overwhelmingly positive.”
Reviews.Author: Notbrown
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on the north side of Hotel Circle on I-8, with very easy access to I-5 & I-15 for N/S travel, as well as CA-163 for quick access to downtown and wharf area. It is clean, quiet and comfortable, with secure parking. Located just 1/2 mile from the Fashion Mall - which is huge and has an array of stores not commonly found in smaller cities - and also 1/2 mile from Riverwalk Golf Club, which has reasonable rates and 27 holes of good golfing experience. We had poor service at the in-house restaurant for breakfast two mornings in a row and told the Front Desk about the problem. Their response was so quick, professional, and comprehensive that I am booking another stay at the hotel with my spouse next month. The continental breakfast was included in the hotel package, and had a menu price of about $5, so it wasn't that big of a financial deal, but the Desk and the entire staff treated our disappointment like a personal failure. They immediately altered our bill, although we neither asked for this or expected it. They comped us to dinner so that we could, in their words, "experience the proper dining experience they expect every guest to enjoy." The manager came to our table at dinner to check on us, and he was also in the lobby the next morning at checkout to greet us and other guests who were leaving. From this you might conclude that we made a big issue of the breakfast and caused some type of scene and became notorious to the entire staff. Not true. We very quietly explained that their was a shortcoming in one area of out stay, and the remaining experience had been exceptional. Their response was that every guest should have an exceptional experience in every aspect of their stay at the hotel. Wow. They deserve some credit, and some loyalty. I have found my hotel for every trip to San Diego. Finally, their location could not be better. Access by freeway and by surface streets to anywhere you may want to go is perfect. We drove to Coronado twice, and both trips were done in 15 minutes. The Zoo (with which the hotel has a free round-trip shuttle service) is ten minutes away. The only area I gave less than "5" to was the rooms. They were fine, but a little crowded, with the bathroom being noticeably small. Cleanliness and quality were fine. The fitness center has about four cardio machines - ellipticals or treadmills- and one bench with a rack of 8-10 dumbbells. It is a very tiny room. I highly recommend the Handlery Hotel and Resort.

Reviews.Title: “I really wanted to like this place, but.....”
Reviews.Author: kvlansdale
Reviews.Content: We travel to San Diego every February and have been searching for a hotel we really like. I had high hopes for the Handlery, since it's location was ideal for us and it had been recently remodeled. Unfortunately, our search continues. At check in, the front desk person wasn't rude, but she didn't go out of her way to make us feel welcome either. I will say that the front desk person at our check out did a great job. The parking was convenient, but if you're looking for a hotel type feel, you need to stay in the poolside rooms; the rooms not by the pool have a definate "motel" feel. Bathroom counterspace is non existent and the beds were too soft for my taste. The doors must be pulled quite hard to close, so all night we were disturbed by the sound of slamming doors. All in all, it wasn't horrible, but for the money it cost, I wasn't impressed. We will keep searching for our San Diego "home away from home"

Reviews.Title: “Really good spot!”
Reviews.Author: lakerdave
Reviews.Content: This place was really nice. The staff was great and the accomodations were very nice for my wife and I. The only thing that I didn't like was the complimentary breakfast. Bagels and fruit didn't cut it for me!

Reviews.Title: “Outrageous Prices on Extras”
Reviews.Author: glenwmr
Reviews.Content: Ordered a bottled water while sitting at the pool, and literally took over 1/2 hour to get it - at least they didn't charge me. The "free" continental breakfast, in my opnion, is SO minimal that it is probably a ploy to get you to order off the breakfast menu. And the breakfast menu prices are OUTRAGEOUS! The markup is criminal! And the worst, NO FREE INTERNET. Again, price gouging here with charges of 50 cents a minute. $12/day to park is just another way to get your money... this is not like a parking garage in a downtown area where parking is hard to find... this is just a parking lot for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: JanesmomLynnwood
Reviews.Content: We did research on Hotels for our trip to San Diego, and found that the Handlery fit our every need. The service was great and knowledgable, especially Michael in Concierge and Jeff our tourguide, van driver! Both were always willing to assist and find info we needed via internet if they didn't know. The one thing that could help is if the pool was heated better! Was a bit cold to enjoy. Thanks everyone for a great trip to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “a place to call home”
Reviews.Author: traveler34227
Reviews.Content: The staff makes you feel important the minute you step foot inside The rooms are spotless The service could not br better Can't wait to return

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was a perfect fit for us.”
Reviews.Author: abfan2
Reviews.Content: The rooms had all we needed and were clean. We were treated to a free breakfast everyday that was generous with assorted fruits and a choice of cereal, toast, or pastries. The dining area was pleasant, quiet and clean. The service was top notch. We had access to a shuttle that took us everywhere we wanted to go except on Mon and Tues. The driver, Jeff, was personable and receptive to our wishes. They had a car rental on site that was reasonably priced, fast and easy to use on the two days Jeff had off. Location was good. We walked to a shopping mall. Old Town and Sea World are close by and downtown isn't that far away either. They arranged for us to get airport shuttle to and from the hotel for a reasonable cost. We didn't have time to use the pool, but it was heated and spacious compared to most hotels. We had a great time and a great part of that was the Handlery. Thanks all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: ACouplefromCMH
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience staying at the hotel. Particularly due to the availability of the shuttle and the friendliness of the driver. We were in town for a wedding and had a little time to site see. We did not rent a car and between the hotel shuttle and the proximity to the San Diego trolley we were able to get everywhere we wanted to go conveniently and for low cost.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: Austraveller83
Reviews.Content: If you are wanting to stay in a clean, friendly and well equipped hotel then this one is for you. The staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful. The hotel has a lovely bar, restaurant, gym, pool and even a convenience store. The hotel itself is extremely clean and comfortable. The rooms are of a standard size, bit very comfortable and the house keepers do an amazing job. The best part of this hotel is Jeff. I have never encountered in all my travels a more sincere, helpful and thoughtful concierge/shuttle driver. Jeff took us to old town and recommended where to go and where to eat. As we were staying a lot later than the shuttle service he showed us where to get a cab home from etc. A few days later we needed to send home to Australia some parcels. Jeff took us to the post office, took our parcels in, waited in line with us and organized all of our things to be sent. We were in the post office for half an hour. Jeff just wanted to make sure that we had the correct forms and to make sure our things were sent off safely. This hotel is close to everything and especially the great shopping at the fashion mall. Highly recommend!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “HOSPITALITY PLUS”
Reviews.Author: debi60
Reviews.Content: We're a traveling family ranging in age from one to sixty-five. The Handlery Hotel exceeded all of our expectations from Vickie who booked our rooms to Marty who greeted us very early every morning as our small kids were still on central time and made our check out effortless. Jason answered all my pre-trip, trip and, yes, even post trip questions informatively, treating us as if we were guests in his own home!! He even gave me some excellent vacation ideas!! Jason arranged early morning transportation to the airport that was absolutely perfect for our group. Jeff was a shuttle driver EXTRAORDINAIRE!! He moved our group of twelve around with ease, safety, and was always going above and beyond to help us with any and everything we needed. When I lost our Sea World tickets, he stayed with us until tickets were secured. Eric provided excellent insight in securing tickets to various venues in San Diego enabling us to make the most of our vacation dollars!! After arriving home, we found Shamu was missing and Rich, the security guard, made a sweep of all our rooms keeping an eye out for a Shamu sighting in case he'd swam out of our luggage!! We have traveled around the world literally, but have never stayed anywhere that treated us any better than the Handlery Hotel. We would ABSOLUTELY recommend the Handlery Hotel to anyone wanting a clean hotel, with an excellent location, at a reasonable price, excelling in HOSPITALITY PLUS!!

Reviews.Title: “Best service and one of the cleanest hotels of San Diego”
Reviews.Author: niki66r
Reviews.Content: From the convenient location to the excellent service to remodeled and the cleanest rooms with a great balcony, I must say that it was a wonderful experience. Having stayed in the most expensive hotels, this was by far the best service and the most reasonable price I have ever paid for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Completely satisfied with my stay at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mmk06
Reviews.Content: Words alone cannot express my satisfaction with our stay at the Handlery Hotel. My husband and I stayed at the Handlery 3 years ago when we came to San Diego to visit friends. We chose the Handlery because of it's central location to all of San Diego's finest attractions (downtown, beaches, old town, sea world, fashion valley, airport, etc.). In addition to it's great location we found the Handlery to be affordable, clean, and quite. This year we decided to spend Thanksgiving in San Diego so we booked a room again at the Handlery.
