Upon our arrival I was amazed at how much the hotel had changed after undergoing renovations. It's absolutely gorgeous and has a fresh, new, modern feel to it. We were extrememly pleased with our room; it was clean, elegant looking, and stocked with all the amenitites one would expect to find at a top of the line hotel. The staff at the Handlery went above and beyond to accomodate our needs as well. I highly recommend this hotel. It's extremely affordable for being such a higher end hotel in such a great location. My husband and I will definitely be staying here on our next trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: taybull84
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a work conference last month, and I had a wonderful experience. The staff members were extremely friendly and helpful, and seemed happy to assist with any needs I had. I was impressed with the quality of the rooms... I slept great, and the beds were very comfortable. I even had a chance to visit the spa, and I must say it was very relaxing. I had not heard of the Handlery before, but I'm glad I stayed here. It was very convenient location, with easy access to shuttle service. I will definitely return when I get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “"Fart Water Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: love_the_sun_Calgary
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Nov 20 - Nov 22/10 as we went to the Monday Night Football Game. We found the location to be excellent. Within walking distance to the Trolley Station and Fashion Valley Mall (which is awesome). The lobby and entrance is very nice. The staff were friendly and knowledgable and were pleasant to deal with. The rooms were furnished and dressed nicely but could use some more help. The doors didn't close properly so you had to the slam them (which is great when your neighbour comes home at 1am and has to reef on their door to close it OR when you are using the bathroom in your own room and your spouse is trying to sleep). Really though, not the end of the world. The drain in the bathroom did not work at all, nor did the overflow drain, so the sink was always gross and overflowing. The thing that really got me was the lingering smell. My friend used to call the sulphur smell that water sometimes has "fart water". That's the first thing that came to mind for me. It hung around pretty good. I am sure that housekeeping had to have noticed when they cleaned the room every day...surely they ran the water in the sink? In any event, the bathroom didn't really cut it for me but again, not the end of the world. The linens / bedding were nice and the matress was quite soft. I slept OK considering we have a firm mattress at home. There was a wedding the first night so there was not much sleep to be had for us given our neighbours were super loud and the noise really carries (as with most hotels I'm sure). The pool area is by far the biggest and nicest I have seen so far (a few beauties in Palm Springs but this was nice too). The outdoor furniture was not that cheap white plastic junk either, which we appreciated. The restaurant was OK so we only had one breakfast there. As usual, it was overpriced for what it was. We have found that all hotel fare is overpriced. The long and short of it is: we would stay again if the price was right. We paid $109 for a Premiere King with bottled water, bathrobe, WiFi, and parking included. During the warmer months, we might pay a little more because the pool area was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable hotel, great pool area”
Reviews.Author: ElsieBeachcombers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Handlery for a small vacation of only a week, we payed extra for the premium room that was close to the pool, free internet, paper and bottled water. Everything was worth it, except i had to call daily to recieve our water, not sure what the issue was or why they couldn't get it right. Our friends met us from AZ and stayed a couple of nights as well, prior to leaving we were under the impression that our reservations were correct, when we got there, they didn't even have us together or near the pool. They did fix it up quickly though. Jeff the shuttle driver was awesome, very knowledgeable and flexible and ON TIME! This hotel doesn't shuttle from/to the airport which was kind of a pain, but Jeff arranged awesome transportation on our way back to the airport - he made a difference! The restaurant is touch and go, when our friends came they rec'd coupons for $10 breakfasts each morning, we had no idea about these, no one told us! Also the chef has issues with making toast, unless you like it cold with no butter? the egg's benedict was very good!! we had burgers one night watching the football game, they were very, very good.... Overall a very nice hotel and i would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Hotel Circle”
Reviews.Author: MigratingBirdie
Reviews.Content: Booked the room for one night to attend a family event in San Diego. My family members were also staying at the hotel. The Handlery Hotel and Resort is located in the well-known Hotel Circle. I've stayed at a few places in Hotel Circle, and I have yet to see any place that blows my mind. Most of the hotels located in the area are low-end to moderate hotels. The rooms were clean, and equipped with 42 inch flat screen TVs and coffee for the morning. There were plenty of plugs available which is a huge plus, most hotel rooms never have enough plugs available for your hair styling tools, computers, etc. The rooms with one king bed have a balcony, and the double doubles give up the balcony for a little extra room. My only complaint is that the double beds seemed really small, even smaller than a typical double bed (making it hard to share with others). There is a golf course and eatery available on the site, but I didn't get a chance to try them out. All in all, a good hotel and I would definitely come back when I visit family in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in SAN DIEGO”
Reviews.Author: annz117
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at around 12:30pm and luckily they let us check in at that time even though check in does not begin until 3pm. We were initially a bit confused about the room we'd booked . The clerk at the front desk did her best to accommodate us & offered to book us an upgraded room but we decided to stay in our original room instead. Every staff member we encountered during our stay greeted us with a genuine smile & was very friendly. The hotel grounds were clean and nicely kept. The pool is heated but we opted to take advantage of the spa tub on our last night there which helped us out relaxing after a very long couple of days. We stayed in one of the superior king rooms in the last building of the hotel. I liked the fact that in order to get in to the building itself you have to use your room key, the downside to that is that the key slot seemed to be faulty in our building so it took a couple tries to get it to open. The room itself was a decent size. What we liked most about it was how amazingly comfortable the bed was. They could use a microwave in the room and maybe a bigger bathroom as it was difficult to have two people getting ready in the tiny bathroom. We stayed for a total of 6 days and the bath products they provided were gone by day 2 but we asked for more and they had someone bring it up while we were out & on that same occasion they took care of a bug we found on the bed side table and reattached the knob in the shower which came out while we bathed. We didn't come across much of the hwy noise that was mentioned in other reviews which was good. The menu at the hotel's restaurant was a bit overpriced so we only ate in once. We ate at the hotel lounge on Monday night as they run a special for Monday Night Football for $5 burgers. The plate comes with french fries but cheese on the burger is an extra $1.50 so make sure to ask for cheese if you want it added. The burgers are a good deal if you find yourself there for MNF. I cannot stress enough how important the location of this hotel was. Its about a 10min walk to Fashion Valley Mall. You can jump on the trolley/bus from there & go just about anywhere in San Diego. There's even a bus stop right in front of the hotel! I would definitely stay at the Handlery again if we get as good a price as we did this past time(booked through Orbitz) .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: gernblanston12345
Reviews.Content: Great location in old town. They bill themselves as a hotel and resort, but really is more of a motel. The free shuttle service was terrific-Jeff was our driver and he was amazing-taking us the zoo, Sea World, etc. . The outdoor pool area is very large and nice. Just ate breakfast in the restaurant-food was good and good value, but the service ranged from outstanding to distracted. Our room was smallish and quite dated, but we are used to paying more for five star hotels. Good value and would work well for many families.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff was excellent!”
Reviews.Author: kenc_1983
Reviews.Content: The great: -easy access -close proximity to most everything -very clean -nice bar (w/great TVs) -great area for wedding & reception -nice pool/hot tub area -decent work out area, mostly cardio. a few dumbells & one bench. I do P90X so this was enough -Everybody & I re-emphansize EVERYBODY from maids to front desk to parking attendant to bar tender to restaraunt folks to maint. persons etc WERE VERY HELPFUL, FRIENDLY, COURTEOUS, AND EVERY OTHER NICE DESCRIPTIVE WORD. The Bad: -not much for resistance training, but enough to bridge the gap. -bathroom small, no vent. -have to pay for parking, but that is pretty normal for every hotel down here. We were able to get them to include it in the price. Do your homework and do not be afraid to talk to people personally instead of an email or some other type of electronic media. Again, the great far outweighed the bad

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay at the Handlery!”
Reviews.Author: dczegers
Reviews.Content: The shuttle service was a very nice feature! Jeff, the driver, was SO available to drive me to all of the local attractions. He had tips for restaurants, etc. HE definitely made my stay better than it would've been without his knowledge and willingness to accomodate everyone's schedules. He's a GEM!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION AND COMFORTABLE”
Reviews.Author: freebie30
Reviews.Content: Had a good 2 day stay to visit Seaworld and do some shopping, well located and quiet if away from the freeway. Good malls just a minute or two from the hotel and easy access to the freeway to visit other areas of San Diego. Nice pool area . Rooms on the small side , but clean and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dalugoz
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with a great staff (Very helpful and friendly). Great for couples, singles, families, large groups. There is a large pool with jacuzzi to relax by or for kids to play in. This hotel is centrally located close to Old Town SD, Seaport Village, Gas Lamp District, Pacific Beach, Naval Base Seaworld, Zoo, Legoland etc. There is also a large conference room area that can be used for weddings/Parties etc. Great food and large portions from the restaurant (breakfast). Easy check in/out process. Safe and well lit parking lot. Easy Freeway access to Interstate 8, 5, 805, 15. We would definately stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved San Diego and the Handlery”
Reviews.Author: Indykim
Reviews.Content: Our 5th annual girls trip took us to San Diego and the Handlery Hotel and Resort - we arrived Oct 1st and checked out Oct 5th. The hotel was not what I was expecting by the appearance when the shuttle pulled up, but don't be disappointed by the outside - it is lovely, everyone helpful, especially Jeff and Ryan driving the shuttle, they gave great tips on where to eat and what not to miss. Our room did not overlook the pool (as it costs more) but was in the building next to the pool and lobby. The pool area is nice, lovely flowers, tables and umbrellas, great place to sit and enjoy coffee and the complimentary paper in the morning. Very comfortable beds, two doubles (no queen beds, just double and king size) mini fridge, coffee maker, hair dryer, ironing board and iron are standard in all rooms. Housekeeping was great and there were plenty of towels and shampoo/soap/lotion every day. There is a business center and you can print your boarding passes for no charge, but internet in the business center or wi-fi in the room is approx 10 dollars per day. The hotel provides a free shuttle to the zoo, seaworld and old town, but not to the airport - take the Cloud 9 super shuttle to/from the airport for 12 dollars each way. The location of the hotel was great for us as it was a 5 minute walk to Fashion Valley Mall, which has Macy's, Bloomingdales, Kate Spade etc and a transit stop. We bought a 4 day transit pass for 15 dollars each which allowed us to use the trains and buses and we got around San Diego with no difficulty. Do not miss Coronado Island and Balboa Park - both are beautiful. Rained some at the zoo (buy the 4 dollar poncho) and the zoo is expensive, 37 dollars for a one day pass and this includes rides on the buses and sky-tram, but it is a great zoo. On Monday night, the bar at the hotel had hamburgers for 5 dollars and beer for three dollars for Monday Night Football - can't beat that! We loved San Diego, the weather and the Handlery!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: helensmith52
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in your hotel and the whole experience from rooms to service was fantastic, the rooms and surroundings were lovely and clean the pool area was gorgeous. The staff were all great especially Jeff who drives the complientary bus. All in all it made the last leg of our trip great and we were so relaxed before heading back to the uk, so a Massive thankyou to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “The Handlery hotel in San Diego has been by far the best service and best value for money hotel we have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Amanda_1989
Reviews.Content: The Handlery Hotel is located a little way out of San Diego but has a complimentary bus service to take its guests to their location of their choice. The driver was prompt, courteous and friendly. The food there was great tasting and good value for money. The service from everyone at the Hanlery was without fault. Everyone was friendly and made guests feel welcome and pampered. The bartender that served my daughter and myself was hardworking, friendly and made great cocktails all at very reasonable prices. The rooms were comfortable and quiet The pool area was good and the hotel accommodated for conferences I would recommend this hotel without reservation

Reviews.Title: “The best!”
Reviews.Author: ErikdeHoog
Reviews.Content: The Handlery Hotel & Resort is one of the best hotels I've ever experienced! The hotel was just renovated and from the hotel you get easy access to the numerous attractions of San Diego. But especially: thanks again to the great staff for making our stay at the hotel "a home away from home". Very highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: HollyMollyB
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Handlery for more than a week attending a conference at the Town & Country next door and for some personal vacation days as well, all we can say is: what a great stay! We're so glad we found this hotel and would definitely stay there again on future San Diego trips. Having had a terrible experience at the Town & Country (admittedly quite a few years ago, perhaps it has improved since then), we were searching for an alternative nearby. While perusing google maps, we discovered an icon for the Handlery just a block away from the T&C. Based on the Handlery's website - and tripadvisor reviews of course as well - we decided to take give them a try. Wow, are we glad we did! They have some of the nicest housekeeping staff we've ever encountered and the room was always spotless when we returned in the evening. The front desk staff were super-efficient at check-in (much appreciated after a long and tiring trip due to airline delays) as well as helpful when it came to printing out boarding passes (they offered to do it for us). Our room, as requested, was on an upper floor, far from the pool and road, comfortable and quiet. It was very handy to have the mini-fridge in the room to keep some sodas and snacks chilled; the large closet was nice. The bathroom isn't huge but it's sufficient. The only two minor comments we have: it would be useful if there were a handtowel holder somewhere in the bathroom as well as a makeup (magnifying) mirror. The landscaping around the property is just beautiful and impeccably maintained, with lovely flowers and plants situated in all sorts of corners. The hotel's location was perfect for us: an easy walk to the Town & Country Conventon Center as well as Fashion Valley Mall (googlemaps indicates it's about 0.5 mile). There's a transit center at the mall as well, with both busses and the trolley. As we did not rent a car, we used the public transportation quite a bit to see some of the San Diego highlights (Hillcrest neighborhood, Balboa Park, Harbor Drive, Little Italy, Gaslamp, Downtown San Diego). A general San Diego travel tip: we discovered that there's a Water Taxi service which will come to pick you up where ever you are along the harbor. You just give them a call to let them know where to pick you up. We took it from near the Seaport Village over to the Hotel del Coronado, then walked back through Coronado to the Ferry Landing to catch the ferry back to San Diego. Lots of fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with friendly & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: NickOof4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 weeks & can't fault it. (Don't rush away from San Diego folks!. This place is GREAT!) The staff were very all helpful and pleasant. To illustrate we decided not to hire a car. We used the hotel's courtesy bus/public transport. Jeff the driver is a great guy & he dropped & picked us up from local attractions. He helped make our holiday so enjoyable & has a few recommendations for restauants etc (Jeff - thanks for the "Little Piggies"restaurant recommendaiton on Coronado Island - we seriously pigged out!!) (Ryan's also a great & helpful guy who drives when Jeff's off). We'd also like to thank, one of the hotel's managers, Sandra. After returning from a fishing trip I'd hoped to have my catch cooked but understandably food hygiene rules did not allow the chef to do this. Sandra organised a cook out pack for us with tin foil, olive oil, lemon etc - how thoughful & such a nice touch!! We had a great cook out at Mission beach!! With regard ot the room this was very clean & comfortable - lovely bed! We hardly spent any time in the room! You'll find the facilities are very good. The pool was very well kept & I reckon this is the sign of quality hotel (poolside rest rooms were also very clean - as were the others we used). Poolside entertainment was fun & the bar there was a gathering point for all visitors. I used the gym which was small but had good equipment! The shop sells breakfast stuff, rolls, salads drinks etc. In addition Jeff suggested we visit the on site ticket agency who booked us great seats at the Padres base ball. The hotel is well located for all of San Diego's best attractions. We ate a lot at Fashion Valley (including breakfast). Hotel was a little pricey on food & not unusually for the US I guess we ate out all the time. You can hire a car at Enterprise in the hotel. We used the trolley bus & the buses to get around so with the hotel drop offs we didn't need one. In summary we would go back tomorrow but with a mortgage & 2 kids we can't!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JulesBirmingham
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Handlrey for 4 nights during our trip to California. A lovely place. Our room was a decent size and beds were comfortable. The pool area was lovely but became crowded when the sun finally came out. A few more sun beds would help. We had breakfast everyday in the restaurant plus a meal one evening. Portions are huge and the food tasty. Our daughter has Coeliac disease and has to have a gluten free diet. The chef came out to speak to us and was prepared to make something special for her. A nice touch. There is free transport provided by the hotel to take you (during the day) to Seaworld, the old town and the city. You just book your leaving and collection time with Jeff. There are plenty of spaces to park but there is a charge of $12 a night. I do think if you stay in a hotel you shouldn't have to pay for parking, howver, after later staying in a hotel in SF and paying $26 a night, this is very reaonable! I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone and plan to return for a longer stay in a year or two. My only regret is not stopping at their sister hotel in SF later in my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: raphael00
Reviews.Content: My family & I stayed here for a weekend in August! It was absolutely a great experience! Where do I begin, first the hotel staff was just great, from check-in to check-out they were just awesome. Every single employee was helpful, considerate & always willing to try and help us enjoy the city. The location is great, minutes from Sea World & the beach, & walking distance from a big shopping mall The room was cozy, clean & really comfy beds. The restaurant was insanely delicious, keep an eye out for the specials we had a veal spaghetti that was great & prime rib on Sunday! Lastly, the movie nights by the pool & the live music on Sunday afternoon, to wind down our vacation was just the perfect touch! I wish we could've stayed longer, we will definitely try the San Francisco hotel!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME JUST DOESN'T FIT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ntae
Reviews.Content: We arrived early by 5 hrs, there was no problem with checking in. Our bags were brought to the room. The front desk person Jose was fantastic!! We planned 3 trips from the hotel and each time we had Jeff, who drove us. He was awesome, on time and early, he provided excellent help on places to go and eat, he even made an out of the way trip to get coffee!!!!!!!!!!!! Housekeeping was also awesome, everyday things were PERFECT!!! The pool was great, our son loved it. The pool bar was AWESOME too. The food at the on site restuarant was fantastic too!!! Everything was clean neat and all of the people were great!!! Thanks for a great time, and the location was perfect!!! We will use this place again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Neaseoul
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and price was very reasonable compared to most other modestly priced hotel chains in the area. Check in was easy and staff was very knowledgeable of things to do in the area. San Diego zoo, gas lamp district and little Italy were all within 15 minutes of the hotel. My friends and I were only there for one night so we were unable to partake in the hotel activities such as the pool party and "dive in movie". Would recommend for families or groups who want a nice place to stay for a reasonable price. Pros: Location to area attractions Cons: None

Reviews.Title: “a great place for the whole family”
Reviews.Author: beentheredonethat31
Reviews.Content: We (me papa, mom, daughter 2.5 years old, bother-in-law and mother-in-law) all had a great time at the Handlery Hotel & Resort. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The pool was awesome for everyone young and old(er)...oversized beach balls are a nice touch. If you want a place to relax do nothing or go to the zoo, sea world (we did both...very near by) the Handlery is the place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveltravelsf
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in such a great location. It only took us minutes to get to the zoo and sea world. The hotel is newly renovated and the rooms are fantastic. Plenty of room for a crib. The pool was fabulous and our daughter had a blast. Can't beat this hotel for location, price and great property.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the $$$!!!”
Reviews.Author: kjmilehigh
Reviews.Content: I just got back in town yesterday from San Diego. I booked this hotel through Bookit.com back in June based on the reviews on this website. I got a deal that I was able to lower by looking at the prices again before I left. Althought I got it cheaper, it still wasn't worth the $120/night. If you travel to Vegas, staying here is like staying at Imperial Palace, it will do if you can get it for $80-$90/night. But even with the free wifi, the $12/day to park is just ridiculous. If it was 1/2 full (Mon-Thurs) stay, I would be shocked. Pluses: Great pool although we only had 1 morning to swim. The grounds including the pool were very clean. Our room, although small, was clean in the sleeping area. The staff was very accomodating and easy to contact. The location for Sea World and San Diego can't be beat. Negatives: The room is SMALL. If you have more than 3 travelling, it is cramped. The bathroom is even smaller. Although it looks like the hotel room was redone, the bathroom needed more work as the tub was old and the grouting was moldy near the bottom. Plus, the shower didn't drain. As for the walls, paper thin. I had a room with a door and I could hear everything in the next room. I will say that they did check us in early and were willing to move us from the front of the hotel that faced the road. Even then, if there is another person staying next door, you will think they are in the room talking. Add $12 to your price if you are renting a car. Nothing special, but not worth what I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Very good overall - missing only free WiFi...”
Reviews.Author: rmsato
Reviews.Content: Staff helpfulness, plentiful parking and decent restaurant make this hotel a keeper for our regular San Diego trips. Only drawback is the high price charged for limited WiFi access...

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: ricci80
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and 6 month old twins while in town for a wedding. I saw the pictures online and it looked nice, and was central to everything in San Diego. When booking the room, I requested a room with a balcony or patio and was assured that was what we would get. When we arrived the staff was RUDE and gave us a room that was DIRTY, OLD and smelled horrible as well as had no balcony or patio. I called the front desk and asked why our room didn't have a balcony and that I was told there would be one. The man told me I wasn't getting a room with a balcony. I had no problem paying extra for it and was never given the option. For the money they charge, there are soooo many other, better places to stay. Plus the fact that they open their pool to the public and it is so crowded the people that paid to stay there don't even have a place to sit.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and completely remodeled”
Reviews.Author: bdm10
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8 nights on the 2nd floor on the far side of the pool, away from the I-8 freeway noise. The newly remodeled rooms were just fine. The rooms have new interiors, new beds, 37" LCD TV, small refrigerator, free newspaper, and inside building hallways. Actually the whole hotel complex had a 4 million dollar complete renovation finished Feb. 19, 2010. I got a great rate, including free parking. The location is excellent. The I-8 entrance is 100 feet away and I-5 is 2 miles away. The airport, downtown and beaches are only a few miles away. It is close to 2 major shopping malls and numerous good restaurants. The hotel has a good restaurant, lounge, gift shop and coin laundry room. The staff was very helpful. The Handlery Hotel fit our needs to a "T". My only complaints: The room balcony chairs and tables ordered in January 2010 had not shown up yet. We had to share an ice machine with a building on the other side of the pool. The hotel needs another ice machine by the work out room, downstairs in the building where we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Good-Only Minor Drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: TheGoose34
Reviews.Content: Our experience was generally quite nice. We arrived very late but the front desk person was friendly and quick to get us to our rooms for some much needed rest. The rooms are quiet and the beds are comfortable. We especially liked the flat-screen televisions. The only problem we had was our remote to the t.v. stopped working (batteries ran out) and we called down to the desk in the morning to have someone come look at it/change the batteries. We were on our way out and they said they'd have someone up while we were gone. We didn't return until past 10P.M. and the remote still hadn't been fixed. We called down again and they asked if it was okay if someone came right up, we said yes. Fourty minutes later no one had arrived and we called down AGAIN. We finally told them nevermind and watch CNN Business while we fell asleep because we couldn't change the channel even from the actual television buttons. They do charge for parking, FYI, even though they're nowhere near downtown. That caught us a little off guard. They do charge for internet in their business center as well. Usually a hotel's business center is free for 30 minutes or something but their's is charged just to log on. You are allowed to check-in and print your boarding pass for free but when we went to print, there wasn't paper in either printer and all the drawers were locked. We looked for someone to help but couldn't find anyone. All-in-all, the things we disliked were extremely minor and because of such a central location, would definitely consider next time!

Reviews.Title: “good time”
Reviews.Author: travelchic62
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late at night after getting lost in San Diego. The hotel staff were excellent in making us feel a bit bettter. We got to our room and found there was not enough beds, my husband rang reception and told them and the bought a fold out straight away. When then went to the resturant which was nearly closed but found that they kept it open for us because we had got lost. We stayed three nights and had a really wonderful experience, this was even before your upgrade so I guess we will have to come back and see it for oursleves. Fabulous Hotel. Fantastic Resturant. Really worth the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: mickeyvictorharbor
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days with a family of 6 Adults & 6 children.( total of 4 rooms) We had a great stay & all the staff went out of there way to help with all our needs & requirements. Jeff who was running the shuttle from the hotel to all the attractions went out of his way to help us. He organised tickets to Legoland at prices that was cheaper than the ticket box. WELL done Mate. The owners of this Hotel should be very proud of his staff. Des & Sandy Manuel Victor Harbor South Australia

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother unless it has changed since 2008?”
Reviews.Author: LissyL0u
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Handlery after Flight Centre (who I have never used since) advised this place was "an Icon". We looked at the sight on the net and said, I don't think so, but she was adamant that it was an icon. Peoples perceptions of "icons" are very different obviously. We arrived at the Handlery, and we confirmed we wanted a smoking room, and the guy said "no problems" and put us at the very back section of the lines of rooms (long distance from anything). We walked all the way down there to discover, that there arent any smoking rooms, just rooms with balconies, which is absolutely fine, however, he gave us a room without a balconey, it is quite easy to work out too, the upstairs rooms have balconies, and the downstairs ones dont. So he was obviously just being a pain. So we walked all the way back to reception to be given an upstairs room. The front section of the rooms are nice and surround the pool, however once you go past these, they are prison type looking places, green wooden rooms, inside is much nicer, however outside is extremely dated more like the Bates Hotel in Physco. After we unpacked we noticed that the bed smelt of dog, we rang reception and they sent out staff to change the bedding. We then went out to discover San Diego, and returned tired and went to order room service, we noticed that the menu was very limited, i.e. sandwiches mainly, we ordered rec\luctuntly x 2 sandwhiches as we were tired and hungry, Next morning we walk up to have breakfast only to discover (after paying) that the staff were trying to cook on what looked like bunson burners, apparently the kitchen was under renovation, they neglicted to inform us of this. Had a nice day at Sea World and then returned to room to discover toilet was over flowing, rang reception yet again and they said that they would send someone, we waited an hour and rang again and someone was there within a few minutes, the repair man attended with towels to clean up the mess! All we could think of was thank goodness we were leaving the next day or we might have received those towels for showering! Where the Flight Centre really pushed the Handlery, I can only imagine that they were getting kick backs because the only place that we discovered heaps of Australians staying at the same place, and yes upon speaking with them, were not happy with the Handlery either, and yes had booked thru Flight Centre. Would not recommend this hotel or Flight Centre

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Indeed”
Reviews.Author: hillsofperth
Reviews.Content: Had a short 3 night stay as part of our US Trip - HOtel is very clean and comfy - lovely pooland spa , fairly convenient to most attractions , friendly staff and very comfortable beds indeed ! We had a 2 Queen room and it was plenty spacious WiFi was included which was neat - I would definitely stay here again !!

Reviews.Title: “didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: ShamuTasmania
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had 9 days staying here, and we were looked after superbly. Excellent front-of-house staff arranged tickets etc, nothing was too much trouble. We chose this hotel as we didn't have our own tranport, and they have a fantastic van and driver to take you to nearby local attractions, which are plentiful. We had no trouble filling in our days, plus the pool and spa were just excellent, beautifully warm and clean. Restaurant/cafe had delicious food. Now we are planning our next holiday, and it will certainly be to this hotel, as the staff were just so welcoming and turned our holdiay into a real treat.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING VALUE”
Reviews.Author: Ralphs
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving early we were greeted courteously and allowed to check in early. The hotel recently went thru a renovation and everything was spit and polish. Our room; one of the smaller ones; was adequate in all ways. Clean and airy. The bed is a story in itself. Wonderful comfort. Plenty of comfortors and pillows; European style. There is a bureau type desk instead of the usual armoir. There is a 40" flat screen TV on top. There are two open shelves; one holding the coffe and condiments the other with the ice bucket. The counter top is faux marble as was the sink in the bathroom. There is two cabinets below the counter;pne has a refrigerator the other is for storage. The bath room is small but has all the needs. Plenty of towels and wash cloths with the usual amentities. There is a built in open "medicine chest." Unusual in most hotels today. Also has a hair dryer. The closet is large and has an ironing board and iron. Plenty of wooden hangars. The main room has no pictures hanging. There is a desk with an executive type chair and lamp. No other chairs in the room. Two night stands with drawers on each side of the bed with alarm clock and lamps. The restaurant is a pricey but there are many restaurants of every type within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “friendly and comnfortable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ritzmge
Reviews.Content: The locations was so centered around attractions in San Diego. They employees were very couteous and friendly. The property is beatiful and comfortable. I recomend this property for any traveler with or withour family.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: 3soccermom
Reviews.Content: Stayed with soccer team for tournament. Great service at front desk- best service compared to other tournament sponsored hotels- no mistakes with reservation, all players actually had rooms in the same building as promised, very friendly and helpful staff. Felt that our teenage girls were safe- room key needed to get in to buildings. Rooms were small and beds very small, but overall nice and clean. No dresser- had to live out of suitcase. Restaurant over priced, but mall within walking distance. Would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation falls short of hype”
Reviews.Author: ilovescoobs
Reviews.Content: If not for the renovation special, there are better bargains to be had. Hotel occupancy was at best 30% yet no bargaining power for paying extra for a room facing the pool, as opposed to viewing the freeway, and extra for having a balcony. A cheap modern renovation but still better than most on hotel circle. I sleept on the floor because I was sinking in the renovated bed.

Reviews.Title: “NICE ACCOMMODATIONS, TOO MANY HIDDEN EXTRA PRICETAGS”
Reviews.Author: navyguyNewBern_Nc
Reviews.Content: The Handlery was 95% renovated when we entered. They've done a nice job on the rooms, though they are a bit on the small side with bathrooms that make you feel like you're in an airplane. Beds and pillows are comfortable and A/C works well. If you want internet access, you'll pay $10/day unless you have a poolside room. Local calls are 75 cents for the first hour, 5 cents a minute after that. If you choose to eat breakfast in their dining room, you'll pay ala carte prices, and they're not cheap. Plan on spending about $18/person for breakfast, and it could possibly be more. You won't find complimentary fruit or cookies in a bowl by the front desk either. When we checked out the following morning, breaking a 5-day reservation, the clerk asked why. I told her we were upset with so many hidden charges, especially for internet access. She replied, "Why didn't you say something? I could have given you a free access code." If she could have given us a free access code, why didn't she? And what about the guests who have already paid the fee? is it fair to them that others who complained got for free what they paid for? We both had a very bad taste in our mouths with this place. We went to the Hampton, Sea world, where we were treated like guests, not objects to be milked.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: gwiz13
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my girlfriend while she attended a conference. While the rooms were clean and the staff friendly, I felt the hotel was lacking. Had a room overlooking the pool with a balcony. No furniture on the balcony. Smallest bathroom I have seen in a long time. No spa, no guest laundry, pay parking, pay internet. I think the most annoying thing was the music coming from the pool area, which I could hear even when the doors were shut. Restaurant was average.

Reviews.Title: “Give this place a chance when it reopens, we like it”
Reviews.Author: marionspence
Reviews.Content: I worried myself sick about staying here Nov 14 - 17 because of the reviews of others despite having briefly stayed here in Mar 2003. I should have trusted my own views. We arrived late on Saturday evening and check in was very polite and helpful. We got a king size room over looking car park and freeway. Luckily my husband and I don't mind traffic noise. The aircon in most hotel rooms drowns out everything else. Room was clean and comfortable. Bathroom was a little small but you only use it one at a time. The hotel was very empty waiting to close for renovation but staff in Postcards for breakfast and Jeff (?) the courtesy bus driver were great. We didn't have a hire car and managed with this bus and the trolleys and buses to and from Fashion Valley Mall. It is not downtown and not at the beach but for the cost of a UK Premier Inn it is perfect for a short break. Thank you Handlery management and staff and best wishes for reopening.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool area, great potential, thank goodness theyre renovating”
Reviews.Author: eddiebocephus
Reviews.Content: It was a late arrival after a long drive from Los Angeles, heavy suitcases...and NO elevators.....bit of a down side getting up to the room. Room furnishings were very outdated, but clean. Balcony room overlooking the pool area which was beautifully lit overnight and very inviting for an outer city hotel. Handy shop and tour desks for planning day trips, etc. Only ate breakfast here, but the fruit platter was worthy of a picture but I ate it before that could happen. Staff were helpful and friendly. If your in San Diego to see the sights of the city, then unless you like driving and are familiar with the roads I would suggest this might not be the place for you. There is a local bus service that can get you in and out of town for $5.00 a day ( hop on/off ) , but I personally did not use the service. A very large shopping centre/mall within walking distance with a large food hall is another alternative for eating close by.

Reviews.Title: “excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: fullheadofsteam
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 5 nights in nov 09 had a most welcolm reception from the girl on the desk hotel location is good for everything we needed, a short walk from the hotel is a mall which you can access without going near the main highway and there you can for 5 dollars all day ride the trolleybus to any place The men on the desk booked us tickets for the zoo and seaworld and the city tour at reduced rates and provided a free shuttle to anywhere we asked . Staff were helpful, rooms clean and tidy, food was excellent and our waitress freindly and chatty, after reading some of the comments left by people that had a bad time i can only assume they expect too much or are incapable of looking after themselves we honestly could not fault this place

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, otherwise very average.”
Reviews.Author: birdseye77
Reviews.Content: Had a 4 night stay here as part of a 2 centre stay in California. The welcome when we arrived at the hotel was not the best we've ever received by any means, with a receptionist demanding a $400 (about £280!) deposit before she'd handed over our room keys. We've had to pay deposits before but felt that this was excessive, especially considering we had no warning prior to travel and our room had been paid for in full. Eventually after a little bartering they agreed a $100 deposit for the stay, but I still didn't enjoy having to argue that ridiculous sum as soon as I arrived. We'd been staying at the Holiday Inn Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco for the previous 4 nights and they required no deposit from us whatsoever. The rooms were motel style and were very average, we had a loose toilet seat which meant a call to maintenence. One good thing though was the provision of a fridge... v. useful. The air con was ok, but again not the best I've come across. Now the best part of this hotel was the pool area - and a good pool it was too. Especially the hot tub! There always seemed to be clean towels on the sun beds too, and sunbed space was plentiful. The hotel is situated on a freeway, a little out of the way from the main attractions of San Diego. The only thing within walking distance really was the Fashion Valley Mall. We didn't drive but found the local public transport to be very good, with a 3 day pass costing around $12. The hotel ran a free shuttle to the Old Town which you normally had to pre book in advance, but from the Old Town you can reach the tram and bus network for the city. A member of hotel staff called Kevin often drove the shuttle bus, and he was always very helpful and able to offer advice on things such as which bus route to take etc, and even had advice for our return journey back to the airport. I'd love to return to San Diego, but would maybe consider staying elsewhere. The rooms are in need of a bit of an update as the bedding and other furnishings furnishings felt a bit cheap, but if the rooms were refurbished, I'd probably give it another go.

Reviews.Title: “family reunion”
Reviews.Author: mommatty
Reviews.Content: Great time ,Staff was very helpful to all of our needs. Rooms were comfortable. Pool area was clean and hospitality room personnel were very pleasant

Reviews.Title: “Just Dont Stay here its awfull.”
Reviews.Author: Kiwibrit_9
Reviews.Content: Were to start. ??? From the room that was tiny and next to a huge carpark or the terribble food in the restaurant or the disgruntled staff who decided to go on strike outside the Hotel wavin placards and screaming at us to"take your Children and run" , needless to say the kids were frightened and Management couldnt even take the time to see if they were okay, or to the fact that it was sooooo far way from anything that you had to get a Taxi to cross 8 lanes of traffic to get to decent restaurant............ the list goes on . Just dont stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in town”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaHistorian
Reviews.Content: The Handlery Hotel is located on what they call Hotel Circle, two parallel roads of hotels along Route 8, one of the main east-west highways in San Diego. As it was our first visit to this lovely city, we appreciated all the help we got form the staff at the hotel, telling us (before we arrived) how much cheaper it was to rent a car at the hotel (Enterprise has a rental office inside the hotel), what it cost to get from the airport to the hotel ($21), and tourist advice. They printed out mapquest directions each day before we drove anywhere, recommended sights and activities very accurately (Old Town truly was a little lame and the trolley tour was well worth the price). The restaurant and bar were nice and reasonably priced, the pool courtyard was lovely and comfortable, and the rooms neat and clean. They have special events on certain nights (Wenesday was Happy Hour for 3 hours, Sunday is movie night in the pool, etc.) In a couple months they are going to start major renovations in all the rooms plus the public spaces, which frankly looked nice to me but I guess they know what they're doing, so by early 2010, it should be spectacular. And the price was far below what I expected to pay. We highly recommend the Handlery.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: grabagran
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the scathing reviews on this site I think I must have stayed in a different place! We stayed at the Handlery for three nights last week (Mon-Wednesday), we were upgraded without charge from a quad room to two doubles with a poolside view, a welcome bonus and finale to a fortnight's holiday of sharing a room with two strapping teenagers! The rooms were immaculate, spacious and quiet, the staff friendly-nothing was too much trouble for them. Kevin the shuttle bus driver was a pleasure, Levi the bellboy helped us out a lot, Sandra and Jose were charming, and the recommended taxi driver Cientang was informative and a complete gentleman.We were very pleased with the hotel's location, Fashion Valley was a brisk ten minute walk away (Abercrombie, Gap and Hollister for our teenagers, Macy's and JC Penney for us!) and the the free bus shuttle took us to the Zoo and Seaworld, we took the trolley to the Gaslamp Quarter, Old Town and Seafront and taxied it back. In fact we gave up our hire car on arrival (we were flying back from San Diego) as I'd worked out it was cheaper to use two taxis a day than pay for daily parking and daily carhire- I was right.Postcards Bistro did the job, we ate there for breakfast, lunch twice and one evening meal, my only criticism would be the frozen french fries (freshly handcut are so much nicer) but that's a pretty trivial nitpick and the only one I could find!! We also stayed in the Handlery San Francisco ten days earlier which was again fautless.I would recommend both hotels without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Best mid-price hotel for the money - Handlery's extras make it special”
Reviews.Author: Snzuluz7
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Handerly in Hotel Circleand we had a wonderful time. The site was clean and well kept, the staff extremely helpful and courteous, and the little extra’s that the hotel provides was extremely well received in these current economic time and makes the hotel stand out from its competition in the area at a reasonable price. We had a room which champagne included was delivered with some exquisite chocolate tuxedo strawberries too which were a surprise. I was with a friend for her 50th birthday as a girlfriends getaway weekend and we were impressed by the thought and care that goes into the planning of hotel operations. It was wonderful to see the refrig stocked with various drinks at no charge, parking was included, the different events the hotel runs are very unique and make the guests feel welcome. We loved the band that was playing blues by the pool that attracted a huge crowd, then at night showing old movies at happy hour and then on a big screen by the pool was great. We encountered many such extras during our stay, and thought it was great to have a car rental firm, gift shop, and hair salon colocated also, in addition to the restaurant and bar. It is great they have wedding facilities too, as there was a lovely one going on arrival but was very private and didnt affect normal ops at all. I will definitely plan on staying at the hotel again on my next trip and may try the one in San Francisco too.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: MartinusAustralia
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Handlery for 7 nights in April 09. The hotel itself is not in the best location if you don't have a car - it is quite noisy with a busy freeway next door. The pool is nice and clean. The rooms are clean however are quite dated and old. Check in went smoothly however check out turned into a nightmare and has ruined our holiday. Be very wary when offered a 'complimentary upgrade' of your room as we accepted an upgrade to an extra room on check in and when we checked out paid for just the one room however a week later after we went home an extra room charge of US $900 was taken out of our credit card without our knowledge or consent. The hotel is refusing to admit their mistake and refund the money. I believe this hotel has a scam going whereby they give you an 'upgrade' and once you have left they then charge your credit card for the room. Holidayers BEWARE of this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, ok for short stays”
Reviews.Author: GreyK44
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Handlery over the Memorial weekend in May 2009. The hotel was part of a package deal with Virgin Holidays and it was the second hotel in a series of three that we were staying in in California. On the plus side we liked the room decor and furnishings, the line that could be fixed over the bath to aid towel drying, the in-room safe, friendly reception and concierge staff and the great map with really good directions to attractions. We weren't too bothered by the size of the room as UK hotels tend to be of a similar size. Howvere, the bed was disappointingly small for us as we're used to a King Size at home so we didn't sleep as well as we'd have liked. In fact in all our stays in the US we've never come across beds as small. The pool area was nice and big, but the water was chilly and our experience was spoilt by the number of guests smoking around it. We were happy with the hotel's location. We walked to the Fashion Valley Mall on the first evening and caught the trolley down to Seaport. The fares were very reasonable and we didn't have to wait too long for any to turn up. The other two days we used the car to get around and the closeness to the I8 meant that everywhere was just a few minutes away. As others have said we expected to have to pay for parking but when we checked out we were told it was complimentary. Karen, Ian and David, Leeds, UK

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: gundem28
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for 3 nights, he's in the Marines and the Marine Corps ball was at a hotel nearby. We weren't in the hotel too much, but it was very clean and the staff was very helpful. The people at the front desk were very friendly and pointed us in the right direction of the places we wanted to check out and also suggested some fun things that we could do out there. We didn't have a car, so we had to take a taxi pretty much everywhere, but there is a really nice mall just down the road, it's walking distance! We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “If comfort matters run away”
Reviews.Author: banshee17
Reviews.Content: We were in town for one night and decided to stay somewhere inexpensive. The Handlery had an excellent deal. The staff was friendly and helpful, the room was clean, but the bed was awful. The mattress was very hard and I think the pillows were full of small cotton balls made of pumice. I couldn't use them and after fitful, tossing turning night awoke tired and cranky with a sore back and neck.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: bethb182
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed here. We booked in May and only paid $75 per night which is a great deal, especially for the location. I have to admit I was a little worried about the price being so low but when you're in San Diego you don't stay in your room the whole time! The bathroom was small but seemed redone since the last time we stayed. Room is a typical hotel room, pretty tiny. I was amazed at how quiet it was. I figured we would be able to hear everything! We drove and parking was $12 per day but on our checkout receipt it said there was no charge?? The purpose of our travels was to see our baseball team and it was a quick hop on the freeway. The mall is very close as well as the trolley. The bar was a typical hotel bar, but no complaints! The food is good, as well. The only downfall is the costly internet (if you need it) but otherwise very satisfied for such a good price!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, clean, good value, well trained and helpful staff - Good location”
Reviews.Author: lssssss
Reviews.Content: Good location, 2 large shopping outlets close by. Within 5 miles of local attractions (the Zoo and Seaworld). Convenient self park facilities, located close to rooms. Clean and well maintained rooms (appearance is more classic rather than trendy, however is tasteful). Staff are very helpful and friendly. The restaraunt has a nice menu and variety of quality meals. Overall good value, clean and safe. Fantastic Margaritas and the Monday night $3 burger and beer special is awesome!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ariane_M
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, great rooms and clean bathroom. Easy access for all the places and very close to the Fashion Valley Mall. I recommend for all and certainly I will be housed again in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, nice, quite and great service”
Reviews.Author: maprak
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 week to enjoy all that SD had to offer. The staff were helpful with free shuttles to seaworld, zoo etc. they also help out with tickets and reasonable prices. The rooms were clean, quite and had a fridge The parking is a rip off at $12.00 per day but if you stay for a week the price drops to $6.00 per day. The in room internet is poor and displays on CRT TV screen and is too slow. Location iswitin walking distance to the fashion valley mall and transit centre which makes it very easy to get into SD, old town and get around so if you stay here you wont really need a car at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: mbbye
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Handlery for a short weekend getaway - we were not disappointed!! The staff was very friendly - Front Desk, Bellstand, Bartenders, Housekeepers - always a cheerful hello. The rooms were extremely clean and well kept...this is an older hotel but they do a wonderful job maintaining the property. If you are in San Diego to do some sightseeing the location is perfect - very close to Balboa Park, the Zoo, USS Midway, Coronado, Old Town, shopping, etc. We would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “As the Governor says, "I'll be back"!”
Reviews.Author: jimboGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Second time at Handlery both times recommended by travel agent for a pre/post cruise stay. It's a decent hotel with a nice pool area and always seems busy. It doesn't originally appear to be in an ideal location if you don't have a car but the local transport is cheap and very inexpensive - we went down to the Mexican Border for $5 return! and if you have a car it's quite expensive to park but neighbouring hotels have similar charges. The rooms are pleasant enough and like most hotel rooms are only to sleep, shower and change in and are kept in a good standard of cleanliness. We didn't eat in the hotel, preferred Kelly's Steakhouse along the road, but the bar prices and service were excellent. Reception was good and changed our room on request to a pool view room and even had a room available at 11am when we came back from our cruise even though check in is supposed to be 3pm . We would like to return to San Diego for a linger stay and would definitley consider this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough in a package deal”
Reviews.Author: twillmill
Reviews.Content: Hotel was accessible to highways. Fairly clean. Breakfast was too expensive. Added expenses- pay to park. No fridge. We had a private patio area. Nice pool area.

Reviews.Title: “5 ***** All Round. Can Not Fault.”
Reviews.Author: shona&terry
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our 6th visit to the Handlery and as usual everything was just perfect. Beautiful pool view room, friendly staff, great breakfasts and fantastic location. Really handy for the shopping mall + trolly and bus stations We had previouslly spent 10 days in San Francisco and it rained every day so to return to sunny San Diego was great. I would like to say a big thank you to Mike the reservations manager for all his help in making this a great stay. Also Fermen the waiter in Postcards, what a lovely friendly hardworking man. All I can say is please take no notice of the neg reviews on here. The Handlery is a well run spotlessly clean hotel and we would not think of staying anywhere else. Mike we will be back. See you in 2 years.

Reviews.Title: “Too pricey for what you pay.”
Reviews.Author: Martinique_3
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Handlery for 4 nights. When we first entered the room, we used the bathroom. The soap from the previous guest was still on the ceramic shelf in the bathroom...GROSS! We were told we would have a smoking room...LYE! Non-smoking hotel. The iron leaked all over my capris when I went to iron them on the highest setting without overloading the water chamber. The gate into the parking lot sucked as well as the 1-way parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mara86
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights during October. The hotel was pretty and clean with nice staff. We had a room overlooking the pool which was great. Our room was very clean and quite large with comfortable beds. The restaurant was wonderful, delicious food and great staff. The shuttle service to the major attractions was great and saved us money. The hotel shop was well stocked and sold stamps which was really helpful as a lot of the other places we stayed didn't. The hotel also had a post box outside which was good. As Queenslanders we didn't feel the weather was warm enough to warrant a trip to the pool however it did look very nice, clean and well sized.

Reviews.Title: “Major Credit Card Fraud At This Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: RUSTYknoxville
Reviews.Content: I was originally looking forward to staying here on my tour around California, while I was out there it was great, pool was brilliant, food was classy and well prepared and staff seemed friendly. But it was when I arrived back I realised what had happened. My credit card details had been leaked out, 3 of us used a credit cards in this hotel only and it was us 3 that got stung for £600.00. If you plan on going and not using a CC, then don't worry. Your stay will be great.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: aussierocks
Reviews.Content: This was the place I was looking forward to but after taking four emails and finally one to the owner to confirm my booking before we left Australia I should have woken up. We arrived around noon and because we were staying for five nights should have been upgraded to poolside rooms. The reception staff (Jose) told us that we would have two rooms overlooking pool but they wold not be ready until 3. Walked over to Fashion Mall (great Place) and came back at 3.30 only to be given rooms in block 2 upstairs. Asked if these were upgraded rooms and told yes because they were upstairs. Bull!! 10 suitcases later pulling upstairs found very average room with airconditioning not working and a pathetic fridge cooler that you had to get ice to keep drinks cool, We overlooked the laundry and was woken with big trolleys being moved around. Complained but got a blank look from staff. Shuttle bus service was good if you could get a seat. Tried twice but missed out. Food overpriced in restaurant. In my opinion it is a 3 star hotel trying to pretend to be a 5 star and missing out badly. Would not recommend and feel completely ripped off. Footnote: charged on credit card when arrived home $61 emailed one week ago to find out whatcharges for(settled account at checkout) Still waiting for reply. Looks like email to owner again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, relaxing stay.”
Reviews.Author: leighxwhite
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, nice, modern, clean rooms. Very good breakfast. Very clean and relaxing pool area. Nice bar. Fab location. Fashion Valley, open-air mall, next door - brill! Very well stocked hotel shop. Perfect location for Zoo, Oldtown, Gaslamp and Coronado.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: vnavarrette63
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a wedding and needed a place to stay we walked in and found a room we enjoyed the stay that night that we decided to stay a couple more nights the kids enjoyed the pool and everyone was great the rooms were comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Very Dissapointing - stay away from this one.”
Reviews.Author: ozdudes
Reviews.Content: We did a lot of study on Trip Advisor and Expedia for all of our stays on our holiday but this stay was very very dissapointing. The good reviews must of been from people staying in the rooms overlooking the pool as they are the only ones worth staying in. The photos on their website are very deceiving and we found the chap on the front counter very arrogant. In saying this I must say the girls there were great but our first up impression was not good. We were directed to a room which was more like a school block than a hotel and after a long drive from LA we were just about to look somewhere else but decided to try and get a room closer to the pool and not out in the back blocks. We managed to get a room which was better but very outdated and could not believe they didn't have lifts. I am defintiely not one of those serial complainers and whingers and this was the only bad experience of our five week trip but I don't like people being deceived and paying out good money when you can do a lot better. We managed to have a good night however as the girls swam in the pool and we talked to a few people in the spas who were not too happy either but the Mai Tai's and company made for a good night. We were looking forward to San Deigo but I must admit that this stay didn't do it justise. Cheers, Mike Swallow Brisbane, Australia

Reviews.Title: “DATED AND IN NEED OF FACE-LIFT”
Reviews.Author: SY1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 7 years ago so were familiar with the area which was the sole reason for booking to stay again. The hotel charges $12 dollars per day to park which is really is unacceptable given the large parking facilities. The rooms are dated, small and in need of a makeover. We stayed in the same block (block 4) as we did 7 years ago and nothing had changed at all it didn't even look as though it had been redecorated at all in that time. The rooms have a poor view of the car park and the corridors are dimly lit. The doors close loudly and you can hear noise from the next door rooms including the wake up calls! Each block is accessed via your room key but the exterior doors are rarely closed and when they are they can be accesed without a key - so much for security! There are no in-room safe facilities so you you have to use the reception which is inconvenient. Given my recent experience I wold lock all valuables away, no matter how small. We did not use the restaurant facilities preferring to eat out at a more reasonable cost. I will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “A dated motor hotel - nothing special”
Reviews.Author: robbomac
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Handlery with a wedding group. SInce the wedding unfortunately coincided with Comicon weekend, better hotels had already booked up. This is a 50+ year old hotel, one of many along the "Hotel Circle" service roads of I-8 in Mission Valley. Cinder block construction, long dimly lit interior hallways, very plain and uninspired room decor. The room was clean and all was functional, but very underwhelming for the $200+/night rate. The room doors all closed with a hard slam - even when you tried to close them quietly. We clearly knew when people in the rooms within several doors of us were entering/exiting. Front desk service was slow and understaffed. It took about 20 minutes to check in at 4 PM on Thursday afternoon. Parking is a bit of a nuisance, too - all cars must pass through a security gate using a coded paper ticket to enter and exit. One of the readers ate our ticket durung the stay, and it took at least 15 minutes at the front desk (at 10:30 PM) to get a new ticket. The on-site restaurant (Postcards) serves an OK breakfast, but here are better breakfast spots in the Hotel Circle area. The pool areas were OK (kids didn't mind them), but nothing extravagant.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some reviews state”
Reviews.Author: keeNewHampshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 nights. We had read reviews beforehand and had requested a poolside room, which was not a problem at all. The room we got was overlooking the jacuzzi as we had requested, but still with lots of privacy. We found it to be clean and reasonable. The only things we did not like were that there was no microwave and that when you went to the pool it was impossible to find a chair. Also, that the refrigerator was in the armoire with no freezer ; it seemed to be hot and possibly a fire risk being stored in the armoire. No control either in the refrig. Other than that we found the place very accomodating. We did not try Postcards restaurant as we were up and out fairly early each day we were there. They replaced all of the mattresses in the building one day during our stay. I have back problems and I slept quite well even before they changed the mattress. We found no bed bugs and had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Practical Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: staffo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights at the end of June 2008. First impressions were good, the hotel looks in good condition and the lobby is well kept. We arrived very late (1am, had previously advised the hotel) and had no problems with late check in etc. Here's a quick summary of plus and minus points :- Plus Room - large, good condition, bathroom fine. Pool - Good Location - Although near to the Highway we were at the back with view of the pool (thank you other Trip Advisors for the tip !!) and room was quiet. Very short drive or bit of a walk to the Fashion Valley Mall (golf course in between). Park here (free parking) and ride the train into and out of the city etc. Amazingly cheap for an all day ticket. Minus Car park fees - $12. I knew in advance, but don't agree with paying hotel car park fees. But, I understand it's the norm in this area. To sum up, we would stay again. Overall view, it's a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charge extra for everything”
Reviews.Author: geocacheferrets
Reviews.Content: Attended a Navy ships reunion at the Handlery! Don't know how it compares against other hotels in the area, but I did not like that they charged for parking, internet, and to attend the Sunday pool party? Food was gourmet, but expensive! Maybe it is just Southern California. At these prices in Oregon, Washington, & Idaho I'm used to free parking, internet, and breakfast. The reunion was a success and the staff was great. The rooms are older. Best food for the value is at Rickys on South Hotel Circle, fantastic breakfast and number one voted hamburger in SanDiego!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Blinkybill11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in April with another family, each had 2 children aged between 8 and 13. Were very disappointed with the location of our room, it was block 4, quite a walk from the reception area and pool. It was upstairs so a lot of carrying of suitcases and a dismal view of the carpark. Not at all like the pictures in the brochure of rooms overlooking the pool, obviously they are more expensive. The pool itself was very nice and the lady in the giftshop more than helpful, but the overall impression was disappointing. We tried the in room internet but gave up as it was so slow and frustrating. We also ordered pizza one night from the "advertising brochures" that they come in every day and slip under your door (so much for security). Needless to say, the advertising was very misleading and the food was terrible. I know it was nothing to do with the hotel, but there must be a way of warning guests about this company as we assumed it was promoted by the hotel. I would not recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nickeled & Dimed to Death”
Reviews.Author: CableJoe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located close to downtown San Diego next to the Fashion Place, there are several other fine hotels nearby. Do yourself a favor and check them out. Not to say that this is a bad hotel, its okay. Its just that they do several things that really got under my skin. The first hint of what the Handlery Hotel does to its guests was the parking. There is a large lot that was three quarters empty when we got there. The sign informed us that parking would cost paying guests $12.00 per night. Think this is a cheapskate move? Try the TV. No HBO or Showtime or any movie channel, just pay per view movies at $12-$13 per title. Want to pull out your laptop and check emails? Not without paying more money you won’t, no free WiFi at this joint. I wouldn’t try to drown my sorrows with a bunch of food and drink from room service either, they add 16% gratuity on to your bill, and then slap a $5.00 delivery charge on there just for good measure. I will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and great for young family”
Reviews.Author: Switchback10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in San Diego for 5 nights. We have a 5 year old and 9 year old who loved the pool and hot tub. The pool and hot tub was very nice and clean. I loved the coin laundry machines! Rooms are a little small and the double beds are just okay. It was clean but it was an older building (no elevators). Need room key to get into the building. They have updated the bathrooms with a sile stone looking counter top which was very small. Not much counter space in bathroom. We stayed in building #2 on the 2nd floor. We had a balcony overlooking the top of a building. People next door were very loud on the balcony and it echos. The hotel is right there where all the hotels are (hotel circle) a short drive from Sea world! I stocked the fridge in the room with snacks and lunch meat to save on some meals. The coffee pot in the room was nice so I could heat water for dry soup mix for the kids. I would stay there again if I was busy sight seeing all day and just came back to the room to sleep. Didn't like the $12 a day parking charge! It is good if you are looking to save a little money. I picked it because I wanted to save money for a nicer hotel when we went up to DIsneyland. I'm glad I did.

Reviews.Title: “Couple from Canada - A good experience!”
Reviews.Author: BeachbabyCanada
Reviews.Content: Pros: - The staff was very friendly - especially Lisabeth at the front desk. There was one concierge who directed us to take the bus to Mission Bay beach which was helpful. We saved $20 in taxis. - There is a daily free shutttle service to Seaworld/San Diego Zoo and other places around San Diego. Pick up is at 9am to 4:30pm. It was a bit rushed since we wanted to explore Seaworld more, but overall the free ride was worth it (otherwise would have costed about $15-$20 in taxis) - Very close to the Fashion Valley mall - the hotel is about a 10 minute walk. My bf and I walked there twice to grab dinner at the Cheesecake cafe and then go shopping. Great stores and fairly upscale - Nieman Marcus, Gucci, Louis Vuitton, JCPenney, Macy's, Abercrombie etc. (stuff us Canadians do not have in our malls) - The room was clean, towels were clean and the room had all the amenities we needed (fridge, hairdryer - however, they do not provide an iron) - we got a pool view and it was fairly quiet. Do not get a room by the highway. - Buy bottled water in the little souvenir shop in the main floor. This is better priced that buying water outside. - Pool is very clean. The towels were replaced daily and the surrounding is kept organized. - Location is good. The surrounding area is very safe for first time travellers to San Diego. Options for getting around also include taking the bus (which is $5 for all day pass). The bus stop is right in front of the hotel. - Take advantage of the discounted SeaWorld/Zoo tickets at the hotel - Complementary Safe - it was good that the access was through front reception. Cons: - The breakfast was overpriced. There isn't anywhere else to grab breakfast aruond the hotel so we had to eat at the Postcards for $14 each per dish and it was good, however too expensive. They usually had the buffet breakfast but on the day we were there, for some reason, they did not offer it. A bowl of cereal was like $6 or something! - We booked a King room in advance. When we got there, they could not find a King room which was one of our specific requests. Instead they offered two double beds which was fine but still we had to adjust to it. - Lots of activity around the main floor. While we were there, there was a prom and wedding and numerous conventions everyday. It was bit noisy since we can hear the bass coming from the party rooms from inside our hotel room. - On the first day, there was a faint old smell coming from inside the room (probably the carpet or the bed). Bring fabreeze or room spray since it took me a day to get used to it. It wasn't horrible, but it does need to be aired out.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't even shower!”
Reviews.Author: haystack28
Reviews.Content: I'm sorry to say but this hotel was absolutely horrible. My family (mum, dad and two children) traveling from Australia stayed here on our holiday centred mainly in Los Angeles. There was no elevator so had to drag so many bags up the staircases, we were annoyed all night by a family down the hall running up and down but this was okay, what really got me was the fresh brown stain on the bath towels, a hair in the bath and the stains on the pillows. This was an absolute turn off and I honestly would not reccomend this hotel, seeing as it was completely overpriced for the terrible circumstances and there were many other hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “No Problems”
Reviews.Author: ourfamilyholiday
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews we were not sure what to expect. We could not speak more highly of this hotel. Every one was helpful the room was clean and the courtesy bus to the zoo and seaworld where good but the pick up from seaworld is a bit early so we caught a cab home. The is a 10 min walk to the shopping mall and the train and bus station which we went to and got the bus to the wharf which was hassle free and the bus driver was most helpful. We would stay here again no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Maynot be everything you expect.”
Reviews.Author: norman321
Reviews.Content: We've just returned home after spending 2 weeks in San Diego visiting family. We were recommmended the Handlery hotel and overall it was pretty good. We arrived quite late in the evening and were welcomed by the staff on our arrival , they seemed to be expecting us as they had the room keys already on the desk. Check in took around 30 seconds and we were off to our room. the hotel is set out in four different 2 storey blocks, there are no lifts in the buildings so if you are disabled or have a lot of luggage then you may struggle a little. The rooms are a good size for what we wanted all be it a little dated with comfortable beds and plenty of draw and waredrobe space.Plenty of coffee with a coffee maker in the room but if you are a tea drinker like my wife then take your own teabags as its quite difficult to get hold of these when you're out there.We were fortunate enough to get a room overlooking the pool as we were told getting a room near the highway would be quite noisey. The pool doesn't open until 9am but there always seems to be some kids who couldn't resist a 7am dip on occasions.The pool and hot tub are excellent and kept very clean with fresh towels on the sun longers every morning. The breakfast and dinner in the Postcards restaurant is very good quality but a bit pricey but there are some bar/restaurants close by in Mission valley Mall or like us you wanted to see the real San Diego and it doesn't take much to hire a car or jump on the local Trolley to Downtowns Gaslamp district for endless restaurants and bars. This hotel does seem to be a popular place for weddings and we did have an issue when a noisey wedding party were put in a room next to us and made as much noise as they could with there drinking (and other things). We didn't hesitate to complain by phone and security were on the case right away,(although it did start up again once they had left.)I complained again in the morning and as compensation was given free breakfasts for the remainder of the stay and had the $12 per day parking fees wiped from the bill ($168 in all). Overall , yes a good hotel and would recommend anyone to stay but bear in mind it is a 3* hotel and may not have all the facilities you are looking for. If you want posh then stay at the Marriot or Hyatt .

Reviews.Title: “An 'OK' experience”
Reviews.Author: 1ballerina
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights with our 9yr old daughter from 2nd -6th April. Nice location but you do need a car to get around to explore what San Diego has to offer. Stayed in block 3. Room was clean but slightly dated and walls are quite thin so we did find it a little noisy on a few occassions. No view from room other than the car park, however, the pool area was great for my daugter and the hot tub was excellent.
