As we were there over the weekend, the hotel got quite busy, with people who were attending events that were going on. As a result the pool area seemed to be a gathering place for some non-stayers which made it a bit noisy. Didn't eat at the hotel, but did have a pizza delivered one night. Beware - read the adverts carefully before placing your order as they are not always what they seem and turn out to be a bit pricey On the whole it was 'OK' , but maybe would choose somewhere else to stay if we return.

Reviews.Title: “OK place to crash”
Reviews.Author: Cornpopgirl
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is right off of the highway, which makes travel easy. My fboyriend found a great rate for this place and was pumped that it was considered a "resort". Uhm... no. Outdated rooms and hallways, will find lots of little ones running around on family get aways (we're single so not what we wanted). First room we were shown didn't have working A/C, in the middle of July! The second room was moldy and smokey. Third room was ok. Heck we weren't down in San Diego to stay in our room. There was a handful of HS soccer teams staying in our building and they were all sitting in the hallway, the up all night yelling. Thin walls... but we got our revenge by being loud on the balcony the next morning. I'd crash here for a night on a roadtrip, otherwise you won't find me here again. If you need a mini fridge, lie and say you need one for your insulin. Even then you may not get one.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: GCtraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Handlery from Feb 20-Feb 24. Upon arriving we were put in Building 4 which is very close to the Motorway and were not impressed slightly. The rooms in Building 4 were smelly, old, no balcony, noisy and mouldy and looked nothing like the photo's on their website, or in the travel agents book. We could not stand these rooms so we went back to the front desk and asked to speak to Michael, the reservations manager. After complaining to Michael we were moved to Building 1 which overlooks the pool and spa area and are away from the Motorway. These rooms were what we were expecting, but I think they cost a bit more, so it is worth paying a bit extra to stay in these nicer, quieter rooms. The staff in general were very helpful, apart from Jose, the guy on the front desk when we turned up - he was a bit abrupt, and we felt he didn't really care if we stayed there or not. Once we had moved, our stay was good. The hotel itself is not located close to anything at all, so we had to eat at Postcards, or order in. In saying that, Postcards is a really nice place to eat. We had two evening meals, and two breakfasts there and found the food very nice, great service but a bit expensive - $140 for 4 people. They have a gift shop which sold water, chocolates, etc which was handy as there was nothing else around the hotel, except other hotels! It rained for 3 of our 4 days at San Diego but we still used the pool and spa and they were both heated and very nice to relax in. My husband and I ordered poolside bar service and enjoyed the spa each nite. They have a free shuttle service to both San Diego Zoo and Seaworld which we used. Just remember to book the day before as they fill the early shuttle runs quickly and you will need to order a taxi which we had to do to the Zoo one morning as we left it too late. Checkin was a bit slow, we had to wait until 4.00pm for the first horrible room and there isn't much to do around the hotel if you have to wait. We went to Fashion Valley Mall which is walking distance, but this was just an overpriced labels mall which we found all over California, so nothing special. I am not sure if I would stay here again because of the location of the hotel, but in saying that, our stay was enjoyable once we changed rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: Demor1
Reviews.Content: We LOVE the Handlery! It was just what we needed, VERY easy to get to, wonderful informative help, easy parking, comfortable clean rooms very nicely renovated with lovely landscaping AND affordable! Not knowing the area, it's central location was PERFECT! everything we needed was right at hand yet a nice peaceful setting to sit back and relax after a busy day. Lovely and well maintained hotel, pool and Hot tub! you can not go wrong by booking your stay here. The only downfall was the internet service was a hassle but was informed they are in the process of changing the service to better suit their customers needs AND adding a business office! We took a gamble not knowing the area and WON! Thank you Handlery! Denise and Michael Morgan

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: ctbeachbum131
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Handlery for a week and found the accommodations better than we expected. The hotel staff was very accommodating, the rooms were clean and comfortable, and the pool and pool area were enjoyable. Its location made accessing many of the San Diego attractions easy to get to. Would definitely stay there again and would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to the Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: lclindauer
Reviews.Content: The staff was fantastic before and during our stay 2/21-2/23 and again 3/2/08. The hotel staff was great with reservations and answering all of our questions. They took their time and were very friendly. The shuttle was also perfect, we were able to take the shuttle to and from the cruise ship terminal, Sea World, the Zoo and the Mall. The mall was a 15 min walk after shuttle hours. The property is a little dated and second floor room are a little difficult if you have lots of bags. I would stay again. The room rates are good and the staff really goes above and beyond. From from desk, to reservations to the shuttle drivers. Thanks Dirk.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, Great location, Great food”
Reviews.Author: careyanne
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend surprised me with a 3-night stay in San Diego at the Handlery Hotel Feb. 7-10. The hotel was easy to find right off I-8, though even in the lobby (that is just a block from the highway) there was no street noise. We requested a pool-view room, and had a nice, quiet little balcony that overlooked the Jacuzzi. The room was spacious, with an especially high ceiling, and the bathroom was clean and looked as to have been recently remodeled. The Handlery’s complimentary shuttle to area attractions was GREAT, saved us the parking $ when going to the zoo, and provided a good little overview of the city from the driver. It was very nice to have a shuttle that left on time from the hotel and picked us up at EXACTLY the time they said. We have found this to be a seldom occurrence with other free shuttles. Our first night we had dinner at the hotel’s Postcards restaurant and were pleasantly surprised by the sophistication and elegance of the menu options! The salads were wonderful, and our steak was top-notch. Good atmosphere and décor as well. Also had breakfast at Postcards one morning and were just as satisfied! The Handlery Hotel was overall a great value and a great stay, and the best part was its location. Close to the Zoo, the Cruise Ships and Whale Watching Harbor, Gas Lamp District, even the suburbs! We were very happy that the Handlery was centrally located for everything we wanted to do, and every staff member we encountered (front desk, restaurant, transportation) was especially friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Handlery Hotel & Resort”
Reviews.Author: LadyJLasVegas
Reviews.Content: The Handlery is located on Hotel Circle, which makes it centrally located (by car) to the zoo, Old Town, Fashion and Mission Valley Malls, Sea World and so on. Check prices on the hotel's website, since they offer discounts there only, not available on other sites. But be aware that, like much of San Diego, there is a separate parking charge - $12 a night. I need to emphasize that this is very much the norm in San Diego, although there are some places, even on Hotel Circle, with no separate charge. You positively need to have a car. No car? Check out hotels in Old Town. The room was comfortable enough but not exciting and adequate in size, but not sumptuous. Heat and AC both quite comfy. Skimpy on the amenities: one bar of soap and no replacements over our 2 night stay. I can't speak to the pool - it was rainy and about 45 F much of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for the memories”
Reviews.Author: Austraveller01
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed at the hotel by very friendly reception staff who quickly and efficiently had us checked into our room. Once we arrived at the room we were glad to see there was a balcony but very unhappy to see (and hear) the highway located almost right outside. A quick trip back to the reception desk along with a small upgrade charge and we were moved to a much quieter room with a great view over the pool and hottub. The rooms were comfortable although I'd love to see in room safety boxes added to them. All staff members were friendly and helpful especially in the Lounge Bar where we dined most nights (love the bar menu try the Calamari) Overall, I wouldn't recommend booking the base room type due to road noise, it's only a little extra to get the pool view and we loved the complimentary shuttle. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: chefmikeMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Handlery Hotel and found the room to be quite nice and spacious. The bathroom was especailly nice and recently redone I heard. The Restraunt and lounge was also very nice and redo recently too. There was live entertainment Wed-Sat night in the Lounge, which was free. The pool was especially nice and the brand new fitness equipment in the poolside fitness room was a very nice treat. Staff was very friendly and gave great directions. It was nice to have housekeepers greet me in the halls while walking to my room. Everyone seemed to be one big happy family. I would certainly recomend this hotel especially for families.

Reviews.Title: “Free Shutle & Close To Shopping”
Reviews.Author: WarrickJL
Reviews.Content: The Handlery is in a hotel circle where there are a lot of other hotels nearby. We chose this hotel because of their free shuttle to the San Diego Zoo (great money saver, nice driver) and awesome looking photos of their pool. Glad to say that their pool is wonderful, very large with umbrellas and tanning benches to lay out on and a Jacuzzi nearby. The wife used the gym and was surprised with the new treadmills and how clean it looked. Usually hotel gyms are dirty with dated machines that don't work, so it was refreshing to have treadmills that actually worked! The rooms were clean, the staff was very pleasant, and the free shuttle was even better. We didn't rent a car, but next time we might since you have drive just about everywhere in San Diego if you want to see it. They do have some rooms accessible through indoor and outdoor hallways, but we asked for a room with an indoor hallway which was right off the lobby and pool. The Handlery Hotel is also a short walk to a large mall, when I asked for directions the front desk gave us some coupons for Macys which was nice. It's not a luxury resort but it's very comfortable, clean, has friendly staff, and is perfect for families or people on a budget who still want quality.

Reviews.Title: “OK stay”
Reviews.Author: akandadirect
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 4 nights. The room was quite nicely appointed but had a bit of a mouldy smell. The staff were friendly but we received poor advice from the Concierge one day (either because he was busy or he just didn't know and tried to guess the answer) which was annoying however other staff members went out of their way to try and sort out the resulting issue with transport. Note, if you're going to Legoland, Gray Line buses don't go there from San Diego on a Monday. The meals were OK but nothing special - we had better food in Old Town which is about 5 mins by taxi (not easy to walk as you have to cross a freeway and we didn't see a walkway and the Concierge didn't think there was one). The Hotel has a free shuttle bus to SeaWorld and the Zoo and quite possibly other places which is useful. We would probably try staying somewhere else if we went back to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “It is a motel not Resort and Spa”
Reviews.Author: DavidAndPed
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel thinking it would be the same standard as Handlery in San Francisco. We are wrong. First thing first, San Diego was boiling in November, we wanted to put A/C on but was told by the engineer that they switched it off for winter. Err it was 80F outside and 87F in the room are you kidding me??? At around 1am you would hear a group of motobikes raving their engines near the "motel". Also at approx 3am, the overworked employees started their nite shift dragging things around outside your room. Lets say, combining being jetlagged and all I didnt actually got any sleep! Hotel Circle is a nightmare because of the traffic. However in a bright side, the hotel is near Fashion Valley which to me is better than Horton Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, would be even better with a lick of paint”
Reviews.Author: BOBJP
Reviews.Content: The Handlery is placed in the 'Hotel Circle' - an odd concept, where lots of hotels all seem to be based in one place. In terms of proximity to the city centre. yes it is quite a way off - but rather than catching taxis, just walk round the corner to the Fashion Valley Mall and catch the trolley bus - runs every 15 minutes and takes you into all the areas you would wish to visit - and $5 gets you a day pass... much cheaper than a taxi. But I digress. As for the Handlery itself? Overall, this is a nice enough place to stay. The reception, bar and restaurant are all well decorated and welcoming. And the food at the restaurant is excellent - we dined there twice in our four evening stay and have nothing but praise for the standard of food. The corridors to the rooms and the rooms themselves could do with a lick of paint to brighten them up - but that said, we found the bed comfortable enough and the facilities were good (no room safe though - something of an oversight). The pool area is excellent - one of the best we've enjoyed. The sunbeds were better than the ones at the MGM and I think the pool was better as well... and the hot tub really is hot! I would ask the management to ensure that the key-pass activated doors at the bottom of the stairs genuinely lock - coming back to our room. we were less than pleased to see that a pizza company had free rein to wander the corridors, slipping advertisements under the door. Other than that? A nice touch is the hotel shuttle - we took this to the Zoo and were also picked up at the end of our time there. The staff were all friendly and helpful - special praise to Manny, who, if he didn't know something, made sure he found out for you. It would have been good if a proper map of the trolley routes was available in reception, the one there was very much a 'tourist one' and had to be read in conjunction with other maps to make sense of it. Overall opinion of the Handlery? It is a nice enough place to stay - but they do need to make people more aware of the local transportation options (this is a hotel very much geared up towards the driver). A lick of paint to brighten up the corridors and make sure those front doors lock and I'd come back and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: southboundman
Reviews.Content: Yes....well........where do you start? I suppose you've gotta go back and blame the brochure we looked at which said nothing about this being more of a motel than a hotel. It is situated on a dual carriageway with the nearest thing being 1 pub (with a walk of death to get there) or, a shopping mall which was around 15 mins walk, again skirting along a highway with no pavement. The hotel itself is good enough with tennis courts and great pool and good rooms etc., but do NOT book this hotel unless you have a car for the full length of your stay. There is no bus route and you have to depend on taxis all of the time. There is a courtesy bus provided by the hotel but we found it pretty useless except for once when it dropped us in town. The hotel is nowhere near downtown San Diego and it would take you more than an hour to walk there. Otherwise......the hotel is OK with a high standard of cleanliness and service and was priced reasonably as well.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: islandmann
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights for a seminar my husband was attending. Got a room overlooking the pool area. Definately a seminar business hotel. Has a really nice pool area which we enjoyed daily and ate most meals by pool. Got the special which included room, breakfast and parking so really a good deal. Lived in San Diego for 14 years so we knew our way around so location was good for us . Went to the fashion Valley Mall which is min away fri night and got dinner from the food court. Had live music wed and fri night in the lounge which was really good! This could be a really nice hotel but the Beds are so hard and uncomfortable and the bedding is motel 6 quality. So until they upgrade the beds which I think should be the focus of any hotel that calls itself a resort I think they are rated too high! Overall aside form the beds enjoyed or stay!

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off!!”
Reviews.Author: Washy10
Reviews.Content: This place was terrible if my travel agent had told me it was only a 1 hour drive from Anaheim to visit Sea World we wouldn't have bothered staying in San Diego. This place was terrible the room was small and smelt musty or mouldy, and talk about expensive $12.00 dollars a night parking what a rip off and the Internet charges were ridiculous the staff were rude and didn't offer any help at all, i will never stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “West Coast Tour 2007”
Reviews.Author: Shrimper72
Reviews.Content: This was second stop on our tour, though a bit of surprise to find it bang on the freeway and surrounded only by other hotels though strangely no restuarants other than ones owned by the hotels themselves, no Chilli's, TGI's, McDonalds, Red Lobster etc. The hotel itself was fine, rooms comfy and the bar and restuarant very good though a bit expensive. Location for the local shopping mall, Sea World, the Zoo and Downtown excellent all within 10 minute drive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, great customer service, but expect to pay for some extras”
Reviews.Author: LunaAlpha
Reviews.Content: We booked the Handerly a day before we arrived via Orbitz. Just in case, have your reservation number handy: they couldn't find ours and had our first name under the last name and vice versa. Some extras you have to pay for: -Parking at the hotel is $12 dollars a day during your stay. The first half hour is free. -WiFi internet connection in room was $9.95 -No free breakfast! -No snack vending machines if you have the late night munchies, only drinks. -A tempting liter bottle of aquafina in our room for only $2.50 Despite it being the busy Labor Day weekend, the room was very clean, the bed comfortable and the staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. Some highlights: -After a late night search for a snack machine (the gift shop was closed), a barman opened the bar up long enough to give us some spicy snack mix. -At one point, our toilet would not flush, and it was promptly fixed. -Free shuttle to nearby areas, including the San Diego Zoo: you can schedule drop off and pick up, but the last pick up for the Zoo is 4 pm. Our driver was very friendly and knowledable. -Left our laundry in the laundry room after it closed, and someone quickly let us in. -Complimentary copy of Newsweek in our room on Sunday The breakfast from the in hotel restaurant, Postcards American Bistro, though not free, was delicious. For more details, see separate review.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT - The Best in SD to Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Lensmeister
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that we have stayed at the hotel twice now and for us it's perfect. In 2001 it was great, and in 2006 they were FANTASTIC. In Jul/Aug 2006 we stayed for 14 night. We were allocated a room in the far end, at first we were a bit concerned, but it was actually good. We got a parking space almost by the door, it was quiet, and we were able to rest without noise from the pool area. On the sunday prior to returning home my wife was taken poorly with a possible urine infection. The staff on the sesk on the SUNDAY morning were great helping find a local hospital, contacting them and heloping me with directions etc. Then the Thursday at 2am I was struck with Kidney Stones and my wife had to get an ambulance, the Staff reacted quickly and efficently. They got their act together and asked if we needed someone to watch the children (aged 3 & 8) for us, but we had another family member with us ans she was able to watch them. A Member of staff came to the room and was genuinely concerned. My only complaint was not about the hotel or staff (well not directly), it is about the large group that were having a family gathering at the hotel for a few night. Their coach was parked out front (not badly) but on two nights when I took my son to the pool to teach him to swim better, they had taken over. Loud rap music and food eating all over the place. The breakpoint for me was when a few of the older children tried to gang up on my son. MISTAKE, fo a man from South London I didn't put up with it. When the family gathering started shouting about the food and began throwing their fried chicken across the pool area to each other we called it a night. Might have been nice that a member of staff had kept a watch over the pool on these nights. Yes it's by the I-8 Freeway, but you hardly notice it. The freeway is an asset in my book, as you can get on it and then on to the I-5 to go North or South. The Fashion Valley Mall is round the corner not miles but enough for a walk, not the greatest mall but it works. Over the small bright over the freeway to Taylor Street and you are in Old Town. Up Friars and you are almost at seaworld. GREAT location too. On Firars is Dennys which was our usual breakfast place. But The Postcards resturant has improved from 2001 and we had a couple of breakfasts there. I have written to both the Hotel and our booking agent (Virgin Holidays) to say how great the hotel is and now we are planning another trip to California we have already decided that we are staying here. I will alway recommend this hotel. Everytime.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing break at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: grumpyhumpy
Reviews.Content: When you first arrive at this hotel it would be easy to turn around & drive away, but dont. The look is of a motel & it runs along a main freeway. When we walked into our room it was facing the freeway & was noisy & dark. A quick visit to reception resulted in being upgraded to a Kingsize room with two foldaway beds for the children. Nice for the parents ok for the kids. The staff were extremely helpful & courteous. A refrigerator in the room was helpful especially as this was our second week & we'd got fed up of eating out for breakfast all the time. A quick visit to a local supermarket meant Breakfast & Lunch could be done a lot cheaper & probably more healthily. The room was a little dour on the decor & the whole hotel is in need of a facelift. We didn't eat at the restaurant as it appeared pricey not suitable for young children unless they only wanted something with chips!. The pool was the best of our 3.5 week vacation, long enough to swim in & a decent depth one side whilst safe on the other. Lots a seating around the pool & a good area for sunbathing most of the day. The location is ideal for most attractions that San Diego has to offer, Seaworld, Zoo & Old Town although Wildlife Safari Park was 25 miles away, about 40 minutes. There is a mall only 5 mins away, Fashion Valley, with some great designer shops if that's your want. A great place to eat is "the cheescake factory" also located at fashion valley but be prepared to wait & waddle out. The food is of large proportions & not too expensive. So good we ate there twice in the week.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, friendly place”
Reviews.Author: Sleepingkoala
Reviews.Content: I read some of the other reviews before our trip, so I was pleasantly surprised by the Handlery when we got there. Our room was beautiful, with a cathedral ceiling. We had a hairdryer, microfridge, cofffe maker and ironing equipment. It was clean as a pin, and I check bedding and towels obsessively. The staff was fabulous -- helpful and friendly. The pool area is beautiful and there is an onsite spa and nail salon. The gift shop is wonderful. True, it is next to a high way, but you still have a view of hills, beautiful houses, and a lovely golf course. The walk to the trolley is about 10 minutes, and the trolley takes you all over the city; where it doesn't go, the hotel shuttle takes you. It's also a ten minute walk to the mall. It is not outdated, unless you consider Neiman Marcus, Tiffany, Victoria Secret, Bang and Olafson outdated. It is actually large, open air, has several restaurants and an AMC movie theater. When we go back to San Diego next year, this will be my hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Smelled Really Bad!”
Reviews.Author: love6kies
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel thru Hotwire.com and after I read their reviews, I was prepare to have a horrible night. my entire room was stink! i had to go out and buy a disinfectant spray to fight that odor. the closet was even more stink it made me sick when i opened it... i would never trust they are a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: jfjScotland
Reviews.Content: have just returned from our holiday to california which included 7 nights at the handlery.Our family loved this hotel we had a room with a balcony overlooking the pool,the room was the nicest of our stay.good considering our other hotels were a holiday inn and a marriott.The staff were friendly and helpful nothing was too much bother for them,as we dont drive we relied on the shuttle and taxis and easily managed to takein all San Diegos sights.The nearby mall was good for shopping and dlfferent places to eat though we ate breakfast in the hotel and it was lovely.We will definately return to San Diego and this hotel

Reviews.Title: “No No No!!!!”
Reviews.Author: zak276
Reviews.Content: What can i say apart from don't go here! We booked this place for 4 nights because it looked and sounded okay in the brochure and as we had spent out quite alot on other hotels we thought we could save a bit of money on this one. It was right next to a motorway and there was absolutley no restaurants etc nearby apart from a depressingly out of date shopping mall. The rooms were depressing, dark but clean, it was very noisy when we stayed as there was a large family reunion and numerous basketball teams staying. In our first day we got moved rooms 3 times due to noise and then when we had reached our breaking point we went to reception to say we wanted to leave the hotel and on our way found ourselves in the middle of a massive fight. The hotel manager did apologise no end but by this point we just wanted out - he did help us find other accomodation and did pay partly towards our taxi fare to the new hotel. We recieved a letter from the hotel saying that they would not charge us for any of our stay so we can now get a refund from our travel agent. All in all i was gutted to have lost a day in San Diego due to the messing around at this hotel. As they say sometimes if you cut corners you end up paying the price and i now know what they mean, dont skimp pay the extra and stay somewhere nice like the Best Western Hacienda in old town - this is were we moved to and wish we had known about it when we originally booked.

Reviews.Title: “Old and Worn”
Reviews.Author: djr76
Reviews.Content: When traveling to San Diego I would steer clear of this hotel. It is located off the freeway and it hasn't been updated in YEARS. Almost everything about this hotel was depressing, the rooms were small and dark and looked out to the parking lot. The room was clean but in desperate need of an update and overhaul. It was the type of room you sleep in but don't want to spend any other time in. The hotel was fairly near Old Town, just a quick Trolley ride away but it is located in a very inconvenient location when trying to access the downtown or other districts of the city. I felt very isolated and pretty much stuck at the hotel. You can take the nearby trolley but it took us almost an hour with two transfers to reach the downtown. Cab fare to reach downtown was $20 each way. The only upside was that the hotel has a decent pool and hot tub and it was nice to relax there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the pool and Hot Tub”
Reviews.Author: ElleBee77
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for five nights in May this year. Everything about this hotel is good. The restaurant does really good food, the staff and concierge are really helpful, the pool and hot tub are excellent, although the hot tub may be a little too hot for some, and the location for getting around and the local fashion mall is superb. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Non smoking is an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Over All, Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Member from Surprise
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for 3 nights, in 3 two double bed rooms. The rooms are attractive, and they were clean, but small, especially the bathrooms. Staff was efficient and attentive. Maid service was prompt and early each day. The restaurant food was pretty good, but the service was beyond SLOWWW. Pool area was clean and attractive. Short walk to Fashion Valley mall and the trolley station made for a good location. This is a good midlevel property for this area.

Reviews.Title: “Almost no redeeming qualities”
Reviews.Author: the_cobster
Reviews.Content: This overpriced "resort" was par with a badly run motel 6 at best. Only stayed here because of a conference nearby, would not stay here again. Our room had a view of the parking lot with freeway noise all night, other rooms don't offer much better views or noise buffer. Walls are also incredibly thin, we heard conversations from the next room as if the guests were in our room with us. Hotel charged us for every nickel & dime - internet, parking, even breakfast! Service was also very poor: loud neighbors were ignored by management (made worse with paper thin walls), had to wait for 20 minutes to get my key when checking in, and we got no help with the internet - which turned out to just be spotty, but if you are going to charge for it, how about some service? The decor is ugly, the TV was old and broken, there was a giant roach at our door in the morning, we had to pay for the most basic things and didn't get good service even then (e.g. lame, greasy breakfast, broken internet, etc.). If you need to be near here, please go to any of the hotels down the street, you'll get a lot more for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise...”
Reviews.Author: Feliciab625
Reviews.Content: We booked the Handlery through Priceline for $55 a night, and that proved to be a great bargain. The room was a nice size and the bed was very comfortable. The location is great,(right of Interstate 8) it was a 10 minute drive to Balboa park, 15 minutes to the gaslamp district, and 5 minutes to old town. We also went to Carlsbad and that was no more than 30 minutes. They have a great pool and a lot of services. We did room service and it was not outrageously priced. They have a spa and hair salon, I did not use either but I thought it was good to know that they were available. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I was especially impressed by the Concierge Jimmy, I don't normally ask for more than a restaurant rec,s and directions, but he was a wealth of information and very easy to talk to! The other staff standout was Lindel she worked in the restaurant and her efficient and pleasant demeanor was definitely a treat! There were a couple of things I did not like about the hotel; one was the $10 a day parking fee, it seemed a bit silly since parking did not seem limited like some of the downtown hotels. The other was that there was not a courtesy PC for printing boarding passes or directions, there was a PC but it was $.40 a minute, with a 10 minute minimum. Since I got such a good price for the hotel I am not complaining, but I did kind of feel like they could be nickel and diming you on some of the charges.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fine”
Reviews.Author: leannenufc
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Handlery for three nights in January, and we found it to be a perfectly nice hotel. It certainly isn't the fanciest of places, but as we were just looking for somewhere clean and comfortable to rest our heads every night, it worked fine. At check in, we were offered a room either in the third or fourth block; we chose the fourth because that room had a balcony, and we were pleased with the choice. The view from the balcony wasn't fantastic (it looked out over the swimming pool of the hotel from next door!), but it's a nice place to sit and relax, and the hotel is compact enough that the walk from the end block to the lobby only takes a minute. We were actually quite surprised at how nice the room was; it was basic, but decent-sized with really pretty decor and probably the nicest bathroom of the six hotels we stayed in during our trip to the States. As for the location of the hotel-we didn't have a car, but it's only a ten minute walk to Fashion Valley Mall (via a well-lit road, past a golf course and convention centre, which we had no problems walking down late at night) where you can get the San Diego Trolley. You do have to change trains at Old Town to get into Downtown, but the journey generally only takes around fifteen minutes. Fashion Valley Mall was also a really great place to spend our evenings, with a big cinema, and plenty of restaurants and shops to keep us occupied. The hotel shuttle is really handy, getting us to the park in time for opening, and then picking us up promptly at closing time, though it is quite small, so I would recommend booking your seats at check in. My one real complaint about the hotel would be the tour desk; on check in, we mentioned that we were interested in doing a trip to Tijuana, and we were told about a tour where we would be given a tour of the city and then dropped off for two hours shopping before returning to the hotel at about 2pm. We only wanted a half-day trip, as we were planning on spending the afternoon at Coronardo, and this sounded good, so we booked it. However, on the day of the tour, about halfway to Tijuana, we were told that it was a day long trip, and we wouldn't be returning to the hotel until 5pm. This really irritated us, as there is simply not enough to do in Tijuana to spend a whole day there, and we felt like an afternoon of our time in San Diego had been wasted. So if you book a tour, make sure you find out exactly what you're getting! We also didn't think too much of the restaurant-we ate there once for breakfast, and thought it was a bit too expensive (the food was really quite bland), with slightly rude and inattentive staff. It really didn't have the same feeling as the rest of the hotel, where the staff made an effort to create a very friendly atmosphere. If we were to return to San Diego on a similar budget, we would definately consider staying in the Handlery again; it may not have been the best hotel we've ever stayed in, but in general we had no problems, and we would certainly have no complaints about a second stay.

Reviews.Title: “Worked fine”
Reviews.Author: MamaofEnS
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while my oldest daughter was at a gymnastics meet at the Town and Country next door. When we pulled in, it looked a little motel like, but it was actually fine. Check in was fine. Our room was right next to the lobby, which was convenient when we needed something from the gift shop. It wasn't noisy, but we were right on the parking lot, with our window overlooking the main sidewalk. Passers by could look into our room when ever we had the curtains open, which bothered my husband a lot. Around 5:00 am, the alarm clock in the room next door went off with an annoying beeping. No one turned it off until we complained to the front desk. It took them about 5-10 minutes to turn it off, but by then, we had been listening to it for over 15 minutes. It scared my youngest daughter, since she thought it was a fire alarm, and had a hard time getting her to go back to sleep. We went to the dining room for breakfast. It was a little pricey, and not really meant for families. They had a huge buffet set up, but was not open. I felt like the value was pretty good, since we were not staying at a fancy hotel. Short drive to Sea World the next day to celebrate medal won at meet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Aussie064
Reviews.Content: If you are visiting Seaworld, then this hotel is ideal. We stayed there in 1997, and although it is getting a little old, it is still a pleasant place to stay. With Fashion Valley Shopping complex a 1 munite drive away, and Seaworld about 10 minutes, you can't get a better location. Rooms are a little squeezy, there was my wife and I and our 2 children, but we managed for the 2 nights. Not happy with paying $10 per day to park though. Not sure why this is charged, but should be scrapped. Overall a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for sightseeing.”
Reviews.Author: CMCNJ
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was friendly but often too busy to respond. Not a serious problem, however. Room smelled slightly musty but appeared to be clean. Room was double/double, small but okay for two people, would not recommend for family. Restaurant was fine, had good breakfast buffet but not free. Pool is great, as is hot tub. This is not a "resort" hotel, but is in a great location for sightseeing. Never used the hotel shuttle, but there was one to various locations around San Diego, including the Zoo and SeaWorld. No airport shuttle. Buses stopped in front of hotel, but even a cab ride to downtown or Oldtown or Seaport Village was only a few dollars. I'd stay there again if simply sightseeing or in town on business.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: aussiemaggie
Reviews.Content: great hotel, great location, wonderful service! Overall, very good value for money! my favourite place i stayed at on my trip to the u.s!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place I have EVER stayed!!!”
Reviews.Author: justgk
Reviews.Content: I had to write something to tell everyone what a great place this is!! I took my daughter to San Diego on vacation and booked this Hotel online, I had not known anything about it before. I really can't say enough about how WONDERFUL everyone was there! The staff was excellent the Hotel was always clean the room smelled so fresh everyday. I never saw one bug and any dirt . ( I am known by my family and friends as a VERY fussy person when it comes to being clean) and the truth is I really hate staying in Hotels but, staying at the Handelry changed my opinion. If I am ever fortunate enough again to go back to San Diego I will stay at the Handelry. Please feel free to email me and ask me any questions about our stay there! @justgk7@yahoo.com PS~ Thanks to all of the housekeeping staff who replenished my extreme daily towel usage!! And thanks to all of the front desk clecks who always made printed and or hand written directions to everywhere we wanted to go (and could'nt figure out how to get there!) G.R.

Reviews.Title: “Resort like”
Reviews.Author: Fender57
Reviews.Content: The Handlery Hotel in San Diego gives you a feeling of being in a resort----it's adjacent to a golf course and the pool area is very nicely done. The rooms were very clean and quiet. It took us a couple of calls to get a rollaway bed but it arrived by the time we needed it. They charge $10 for parking for some reason. Parking doesn't seem to be a problem in the area. They advertise the trolley as being steps away when in fact it's about a 15 minute walk. Drive to the station and park in the mall. It's about a 15 minute trolley ride to downtown SD and 10 minutes to Old Town where all the good Mexican restaurants are located. You're supposed to pay for a ticket on the trolley but no one ever asked for ours nor did they seem to care if we had one.

Reviews.Title: “friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: neontetra
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Handlery for a week in July. We found the staff friendly and helpful. Good breakfasts in the Postcards restaurant, and evening meals not too bad either. The rooms were clean, but a tiny bathroom, couldn't swing a cat! The hotel is located on a main freeway, so we hired a car for the week to be able to get around. The bus outside the hotel doesn't go straight to the beaches, the trolley service 5 minutes walk down the road also doesn't drop off at any beaches so if it is a beach holiday you want I would recommend choosing a hotel next to the beaches. In all a good week.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best hotel I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: smmuconn
Reviews.Content: My family and I were visiting San Diego for two days and needed a hotel that was close enough to both the Zoo and Sea World and this hotel was it. Besides the pool that was the best feature of the hotel. The hotel is showing its age and reminded me of my dorm room in college. Check in was slow and was not very friendly. Had a musty smell to the room as we entered. Construction was going on so we had to walk around the buidling with our luggage which was a real pain. One of the nights were were woken up by someone banging on the door next door screaming "Let me in" and calling the phone about a million times. There was a small refridgerator that didn't work. Parking was 10/day which I truly did not understand. I think if we were to stay in San Diego again we would look else where.

Reviews.Title: “A bit dated, but a great pool”
Reviews.Author: BenHaMin
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Handlery while vacationing in San Diego. The hotel is right off the westbound Highway 8 exit. On check in, we discovered that there is no elevator. As we carried our bags in, we passed the bellman, but he did not offer to help us. Once in our room, we discovered it was a bit small, with two double beds. The beds were typical hotel beds, nothing exceptional. The room was light as one wall (the north) was a mostly glass with a sliding door. There was a balcony overlooking the pool with two chairs and a small desk. The room came with a small refrigerator that did not work very well. My wife complained that the room was dusty. There was no Internet access except for the $10.99 per day WebTV access or a public computer in the lobby. From the exterior appearance, the hotel looks as though it was built in the 1950s or 60s. It is more of a motel than a hotel as most of the rooms are accessible from exterior, open hallways. Parking cost $10 per night, though for some reason, we were not charged when we checked out. The location is convenient. It is a short drive to either the San Diego Zoo, Sea World or the Fashion Valley Mall, where there are several restaurants including the Cheesecake Factory. The breakfast buffet was rather meager for $12.95; only one type of eggs (scrambled), French toast, sausage and bacon, fruit, yogurt, and cereal but no toast. (Courtyard by Marriott serves a better breakfast buffet.) The pool was great. It is large and appears to be be well maintained. Some of the pool towels, though, looked as if they had seen better days. I would not book the Handlery again for a family visit. The rooms are too small and there are too few amenities on site (except for the pool).

Reviews.Title: “not recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel's location is very convenient--close to all the sight-seeing points and shopping centers, and it's right next to the major freeway exit. I don't like the poor cleaniness of this hotel, especially the dirty linens---stains on pillow cases, holes on blankets, and dark marks on towels. I think the pillow cases and the blankets should be thrown away. Although it meets the 2.5 star rating (e.g. iron, hair-dryer, coffee maker, etc), the dirty linens outweight everything else. Also the staff was not professional/helpful at all. On our check-in day, after 5 minutes we entered our room, our door was knocked, and before we answered, the door was opened by the housekeeper!!! Since then I chain-locked the door whenever I'm inside the room. On our check-out day, our door was knocked at 8am (!) and the housekeeper asked us when we'd check-out... The front desk staff was polite and friendly, yet not informative--told us things incorrectly. The free shuttle bus for going to the Sea World was another surprise---my seatbelt was not even working. I also don't like the idea of charging hotel guest $9/night parking fee. All in all, I think this hotel should be removed from priceline pool and I do NOT recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not really impressed”
Reviews.Author: bevhen
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for 5 nights from May 23rd and were not that impressed. They only had us down for one room instead of two, but did quickly fix that. We then had to carry all our luggage right around hotel and up flights of stairs because there is no elevator. Renovations were being done so we had to continually walk around back of hotel to access our room for 3 days. The rooms were okay but I found the bathroom area a bit small. We also found the area a bit isolated from everything. I would choose a different hotel next time. I will add that the pool area is great and it was nice to have a balcony overlooking the pool.

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend the Handlery Hotel and Resort to families.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to San Diego. The Handlery was suggested since I would be traveling with my 8 and 4 year old sons. The hotel staff was more than accomodating to us. The shuttle to the Zoo was adjusted to our schedule and we were able to be picked up early, given a driving tour of San Diego, dropped off at a shopping spot and then picked up later! One big plus was that the hotel has Enterprise Leasing onsite. We were able to order our car to go to the Wild Life Park, have breakfast then take off on our excursion with leisure. The only negatives were: The hotel is located next to the freeway... convenient to getting around but noisy. The restaurant was slow on service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little 3 star!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last year for 5 nights and really enjoyed my stay. This IS a three star hotel - it has private facilities, gym, pool and room service. I can't believe some of the complaints here. Want a 1 or 2 star? Go to a hostel!!!! I chose this hotel because of it's location. I couldn't justify the prices of the 3 star hotels downtown which I thought were overpriced for the same standard. There is a bus stop just outside the front of the hotel and the trolley stop was near Fashion Valley Shopping Centre some 10 min walk away - and really, that's not far to walk. I found this hotel between downtown, Sea World and La Jolla. I also think that paying under $10 for parking isn't too bad. I've seen it over $20 elsewhere, closer to downtown. I found the room to be cosy - now European hotels are small! For me, I'd say medium in size with comparison to other hotels of various ratings that I have stayed in around the world. I found the room clean - bathroom clean and of a decent size. All of the linens were clean as I checked all of them before I used them.The heating also worked well and I'm glad it did as I was running 9 hours late and it was cold when I hit San Diego at 4.45am one foggy morning. I didn't notice excess noise - maybe because I'm from the city and it wasn't any worse than what I'm used to. There was even a wedding on while I was there and there wasn't excessive noise. I couldn't vouch for the pool or washing machines as I didn't have time to swim and I hand washed my clothes. I was also glad to see that each building had a lock on the door that needed a card to open. Important for a solo traveller like myself. I did eat at the restaurant - the dinner was great, though for a budget traveller a little pricey. (Though on my next trip I will eat here again - the food is incredibly fresh and tasty). I bought breakfast from the souvenir shop and the lady there was nice. I also found the rest of the staff quite nice and they answered all of my questions. I am diffinately staying here again. It has everything I need and nothing I don't. I refusing paying premium prices for things I don't need or use. I am looking at doing another 4 nights here in October.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, but don't expect quiet!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are after a full nights sleep, then this hotel is NOT for you! I think this place was built before sound-proofing - you can hear your neighbours as if they were sitting on your bed - word for word! On the positive, the staff were friendly and helpful, a good price for what you got (I suppose noise was free!). The free shuttle to zoo and Seaworld was great. I won't be staying here again, but if you are a heavy sleeper, then it's probably worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “If You Like Old Howard Johnson's This Place Is For You”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Handelry with a group on buisness. The group as a whole likes to stay at budget hotels so this review isn't based on expecting a four or five star resort. First point, calling the Handlery a resort is marketing at best. The hotel is a 1950's style motor court that looks like it was last updated in the mid 1970's. I made my reservation on the internet. When I checked in they couldn't find my reservation. They kind of winced when I told themI booked on the internet so they must have recuring problems with that system. I had a printed reservation confirmation so I gave that to clerk to assist. It didn't help. The young lady at the front desk told me that I made a mistake in booking the wrong date, was charged a no show and that was the reason why they couldn't find my reservation. But she said at that point everything was fine. I asked for the confirmation back the check for myself and as I suspected, I had booked the correct dates. I later checked with my credit card company to see if they had charged me with a no show and they had not so the front desk clerk had totally lied to my face to cover their mistake. So they put me in first floor room that had two double beds, which would have been fine except that I had reserved a king. So back over to the front desk I went. The clerk (different one this time) moved me to a different room with a king. We wake the next morning to find that the pipes had backed up into the sink in the bathroom and left a deposit of rust and god knows what else. If we were not with a group we would have sought another hotel close by but we didn't have much of a choice without a major pain going from one hotel to stay and another for meetings. Other than the first front desk clerk who lied to me the other staff were friendly and tried to help but obviously have very little to work with. Do yourself a favor and avoid the Handlery.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a nice pool but was a bit tacky and tired looking. You really need a car if you are stopping here! Nothing to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “suprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the package that I received from the travel agent. I was nervous about going to this hotel after reading the reviews. The hotel doesn't look like it does on the web site of the hotel. The Handlery is somewhat run down on the outside and the hotel lobby is outdated with furniture from the 70's. I was surprised that the room we had was nice with balcony. The worse part of the entire trip was the parking,they charge 9.00 per day and I felt that was outrageous. There are no elevators in the building and you have to carry your luggage to the room up stairs. Iam sure in it's hay day it was upscale but it needs some remodeling. A elevator should be installed and ice machines should be at the end of each hallway.The staff was nice, but if I travel again I will not go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but looked to be better hotels nearby”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We pre-booked to stay here three nights. We arrived after a long day driving in heavy freeway Traffic from Los Angeles. Kids were tired and we appreciated the huge pool and large spa. The Fitness Centre also looked the part. The hotel is on a huge parcel of land with three lots of two storey units so no lifts to carry bags to the upper level. The room had a balcony but ours overlooked the pool pumps so some noise was evident 24 hours a day. The Handlery is located out of San Diego and is in an area where there are many hotels on both sides of the freeway. There is pretty much nothing else there except hotels so you need a car to get there. To be charged $9.00 a day for parking was a bit much – I doubt many people would arrive at this hotel without a car. Also no breakfast provided – of course you could dine in at their restaurant. Many other hotels we saw in the area advertised Continental Breakfast provided. We did have room service for dinner one night and this was fine and good value. Probably better hotels available in the same area known as Hotel Circle Pros: Pool and Spa and balcony off room Cons: Location – nothing there and having to pay for parking in the suburbs

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jneanie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Handlery for 3 nights from Oct 27 to Oct 30, 2005. Our family of 5 loved it. The room was a tad small for the rollaway cot but we made it work. I did tons of research before we left because we are a family of 5 ( 3 kids - 7, 15,18) and I work at a travel agency so my family expected me to get the best I could to fit our budget. They were impressed. I had wanted to get a hotel on the beach because it would add to our 'California Experience" but we really didn't have any extra time to spend on a beach, and for the price of a beach hotel we were able to rent a car and drive to Anaheim and see beaches there. Our patio was a great extension of our room, but a screen door would have been nice so we could leave it open nat night. Our view was ugly ( the roof around us) but we didn't really spend much time in our room. There was a small fridge and no microwave so making food in our room was not really an option. Internet is available - at a cost of $10 per day. The location of the hotel was perfect. In hotel circle, right at a City Trolley Tour stop ( we highly recommend taking the tour, it is a great way to see all of San Diego and the land/sea tour was great!). The hotel has a shuttle to Sea World, the return shuttle was at 4:30 and the park was open until 6, so we caught a cab back to the hotel and it only cost $7. The pool and hot tub were very nice. The restaurant has a great breakfast buffet although it is a bit pricey. From here we went to Anaheim and stayed at the Best Western Park Inn and Suites. If you found this review helpful and are heading to Disneyland, check out the other review too.

Reviews.Title: “Poor standards. poorly trained staff!!”
Reviews.Author: CK82
Reviews.Content: If we had read the reviews before booking we would have stayed elsewhere. As it was we went with low expectations and most of them were met. Uk prices are not as favourable as US so we paid too much for too little. Our package included an upgrade to a deluxe room and the staff had no idea what a deluxe room was (and we certainly didn't get one!) Standards of cleanliness left a great deal to be desired and the restaurant's idea of cleaning a table was to wipe all the crumbs of the previous diners on to the floor! Rooms were superficailly cleaned. Staff were well meaning but poorly trained. There was no evidence of anyone giving them guidance. We asked the reception if there was a happy hour and were told they didn't know, the bar was 20 feet away and they didn't seem to realise that it might be good idea to find out for the future. The girl working behind the bar was great but we just wanted to drag the rest of the team to the computer to show them what Trip Advisor reviews were saying about them. Once again the parking fee now $9 a day is excessive since others don't charge one!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - Far exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having read the previous reviews of this hotel we were really concerned and contacted the Hotel directly. Their response was rapid and gave us the reassurance we were looking for as we were two families travelling to San Diego for the first time. The Hotel and the staff were without fault. The rooms were spacious and cleaned to exceptional standards every day. The pool area was fantastic, safe and very clean. Food was great quality and the staff always willing to help and advise. The location of the hotel was also great for exploring every area of San Diego with trolley buses, shopping and restaurants all within a close distance. would srongly recommend this Hotel and would return without hesitation. Special thanks to Jimmy, a great help !

Reviews.Title: “Good Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: DaveRuss
Reviews.Content: As has previously been mentioned here. Don't believe all the negative comments about this hotel/motel. We stayed here for four nights after a two week drive of the SW States and had no problems at all. The staff at check in were friendly and the room on the ground floor of building three was good. If you happen to get an outside room in block four beware, there is major building work going on over the fence ! Our room however was a good size and had everything we needed. It was clean and tidy too.The only downside was the door slamming at night. These doors aint light and they slam shut waking everyone. Used the pool one afternoon and it was good, being clean and of a very reasonable size with lots of clean towls freely available. If you use Postcards restaurant in the hotel be warned that it is a la carte, don't expect burgers and such like if that is your want ! As the hotel is right on the entry/exit to the freeway getting around in the car was a doddle, oh and never heard any noise from the freeway from our room either. The only gripe I have is that it cost $9 a day to park your car, yep even for guests.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: tbowne
Reviews.Content: Before I booked, I checked Trip Advisor and got mixed reviews but I decided to book based on value. The hotel is old and the rooms are small. The bathroom is about 5'x6', there's no counter space and it's just dinjy with bad wall paper and old tile with mildew. The TV is small and the furniture is cheap. Holiday Inn is better. I would compare it to a motel 6 with a large pool. Don't be fooled by the name, this is no "RESORT". The lobby is old and tired. It may have been nice when it was built circa 1960 but the bad paint job and re-stucco fall short of any sort of renovation. The pool area is tacky and the gym has 20 year old Nautilus machines. They probably ruined some nice mid century architecture with pink stucco and white columns. The Best Western, Double Tree or the Holiday inn across the way are better values. They also charge $9.00 a day for parking, many other hotels in area are free. I'm glad I was only there 2 nights and only used the room to sleep. Even that was not so great, the sheets were rough, the bed cover was dirty and the blanket had a big tear in it. Aside from a 10 min wait to check out, I did not experience other service issues.

Reviews.Title: “Not good!”
Reviews.Author: rgilmoreaz
Reviews.Content: This place is NOT worth your stay! I was truly disappointed with Priceline for listing this property as a 3 star location. The rooms were very, very small, dirty and old. The pool was fine. The fitness room had an operable treadmill but that was the only positive experience in that facility. I am pretty easy to please but I cannot tell a lie...this place was awful and is in dire need of a "wake-up call!"

HotelInfo.Name: Handlery Hotel San Diego
HotelInfo.Address: 950 Hotel Circle North, San Diego, CA 92108
